Description

Junior Data Analyst
We are hiring for several shifts: Monday to Friday morning and Monday to Friday afternoon.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon in a promising new market segment?
Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?
Amazon is seeking a Transportation Performance Analyst to join Amazon's European Special Handling (EU SH) team. EU SH team is responsible for the end-to-end Heavy/Bulky journey in the fulfilment, supply chain and transportation daily business and its strategic vision in Europe.
Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to take our important business decisions.
Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics.
As an Analyst you will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse and redshift clusters, creating automated reports through macros, creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of team as well as for transportation operations. Publish daily/weekly performance reports. You will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations and processes.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results.

You should have an internal drive to answer ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù questions, excellent analytical abilities and strong technical skills.

Responsibilities
Create metrics, performance dashboards and reports
Drive root cause analysis
Engage with cross-functional teams and/or carriers/vendors for implementation of project/program requirements
Managing multiple projects/initiatives
Communication at all levels with the ability to present information professionally & concisely with supporting data

Basic Qualifications
VBA, SQL or other coding experience to support automation initiatives
Working experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Quicksight.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in business process improvement, Lean/Six Sigma
Proven independent decision making skills in an often times ambiguous environment.
Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes
Previous experience within transportation or logistics.
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates

Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced company? We are looking for a Business Data Analyst, this is a great opportunity for you!

About us
At Packlink, we aim to be the fastest-growing global provider of shipping services and technology.

We're building the ideal shipping platform for private customers and businesses. Shipping is a complex endeavor and small to midsize companies need to be able to easily handle the shipping needs of their day-to-day work. With our technology, SMBs can improve their shipping experience and deliver a premium service to their customers.

Operating in more than 10 countries, our passion for getting shipping right means we support our customers every step of the way, making shipping simple and transparent. 
 Our employees work on interdisciplinary teams with clearly defined responsibilities that maximise individual talents to further common goals.

Is it the right fit?
This time we are looking for a talented, highly motivated and data-driven Pricing Data Analyst to join our Pricing Team.

As a collaborative team player you will be:
Delivering on our budget targets. In the Pricing team our main KPIs and daily obsessions are Revenue and Gross Profit. You will analyse performance, define optimisation measures and implement them through A/B tests. 
New tools: we have ambitious plans to revamp our Pricing tool and to develop state-of-the-art dynamic Pricing capabilities. You will contribute to the definition of those new tools and use them once developed by our Pricing tech team.
Benchmark: we are setting up an automated price benchmark and need to develop an analytical framework around this data.
Revenue diversification: you will contribute to revenue diversification initiatives (e.g. Insurance).

What we're looking for?
An appetite for solving Business problems with data.
3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst (preferably in Pricing / Revenue management).
An entrepreneurial spirit (the team is just starting and there is an exciting challenge ahead!).
Some knowledge of SQL / BigQuery.
Professional proficiency in English.
A very strong Analytical mind.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for Data Analysts to join our teams throughout Lookiero. You will work with talented members of your team to help Lookiero makes better business decisions.

Successful members of this team are self-motivated professionals with a passion for both the business and technology innovation.

We look for these individuals:
Solid understanding of statistics coupled with strong business acumen.
Comfortable writing code on a daily basis (such as Python/R, others) and have strong SQL skills.
Experience with analytics tools such as Tableau (or similar‚Ä¶).
Analytical skills. Working with large amounts of data and being able to see through them and analyze it to find conclusions.
Communication skills to present your findings or translate data into understandable charts, documents, and dashboards.
Prioritize simplicity over complexity.

What can we offer?

A key position in one of the most important teams of the company where you can see your impact on the business from the very beginning.
Competitive salary
Remote working when you need it (even though this is not a fully-remote position, it's ok if you want to work from the beach).
Freedom entails responsibility.

You will work in an autonomous cross-functional team where decision making depends on team consensus.

What's Different About Us

Big impact - you will directly see your impact on the business and on our clients.

Data-driven - we use A/B testing to drive feature and product decisions.

Unique culture - We love to meet to have technical discussions, spend time in the book club to discuss technical approaches, prepare internal workshops, talks and much more.

Mission
As a Junior Data Analyst you will support and empower Yego¬¥s departments with key data that will allow them to make strategic decisions and improve business performance.
Reporting to the Data Scientist Lead, this role is embedded in the day-to-day business performance and holds the reporting responsibilities for Yego.
The Junior Data Analyst will be a key partner for Operations and Marketing departments providing and analyzing performance trends, user acquisition, and retention rates, rides forecast, operations performance, etc.

Responsibilities
Business KPIs reporting
Product Analytics, tracking and reporting on the product features and improvements
Maintaining and improving the reporting and visualization outcomes
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and anomalies in the data for different departments, communicate findings
Provide insight, guidance, and recommendations to Operations and Marketing by interpreting and analyzing the business data
Discovering and exploring datasets and proposing new tracking to improve data sources and decisions
Forecasting and setting targets at department/function level to reach objectives as well as working with the teams to see business cases for uplifts in the KPIs results

Requirements

BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Business Administration or related fields.
1-2 years of experience in relevant roles
Knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis techniques for both quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Possess advanced computer skills knowledge, experience working with different databases and data warehousing understanding
Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL (MySQL or Postgresql), and understanding of ETL programming (Python)
Expertise in statistical analysis and experience using tools to report and visualize (Tableau, R, Python, Cluvio, and others)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Good communication and presentation skills as well as utilize data obtained and analysis performed to guide the business performance

Perks
Participating in changing mobility for good into a cool, hassle-free, and environmentally-friendly experience with passionate people to work on the same goal.
Private Health Insurance.
Gym membership discounts.
Unlimited use of Yego vehicles.
Flexible working hours and remote working conditions.

Descripci√≥n:
About

We want to let you know more about us and our project, but first we're going to share with you a little bit of our history

At Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, we are in the midst of a digital transformation and international expansion process. To achieve this, we are recruiting a team of great professionals, who love technology, innovation, the digital world and of course achieving great challenges. Sounds good.

We were born in 1994 as pioneers in digital banking and since then we have worked to innovate every day. Proof of this is that we launched the first native application for iPad and implemented WhatsApp as a way of communicating with our users. We currently have more than 1 million customers who have placed their trust in us, and that is why we take care of the quality and security of all our services. In 2017 we launched a new web and app platform, using the latest cloud-based technology and with an API layer for all services. That same year we created Open Digital Services (ODS), our technology subsidiary, to recruit the team that would help us achieve our greatest challenge: international growth and technological development. Today, we are developing our Core Banking and have already landed in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal, and will soon land in Argentina.

As you can see, we haven‚Äôt stopped growing and innovating, working in a start-up format, using agile methodologies and making use of the latest technologies. We work with AWS, Microservices Architecture, Mobile Development (iOS and Android) and Big Data Ecosystems among others. Our goal is to take our users' experience to the next level. We are a flexible and fast adapting team, able to work with displaced teams and with a culture that makes us different. We have social and diversity clubs, such as our Padel or LGTBI+ Club and we have more than 30 different nationalities which allows us to have a multicultural and changing environment.

Now that you know us a little better... Would you like to join our ODS team and grow with us?

We are waiting for you!

Innovation focused and passionate about data are a must!

Main Tasks
Collecting and interpreting data from different sources in our AWS Datalake.
Analysing results from different commercial actions and drive insights that can lead to optimizing our business.
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business, using data visualization tools.
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets, as well as automate these tasks so we can spend less time reviewing normality and more time analyzing interesting anomalous patterns.
Defining new data collection and analysis processes from our different business verticals, such as wealth, insurance, or new countries.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Ability to identify and automate recurring tasks (through scripts or dashboards).
Create a repository of key queries (really useful queries could be interesting for the rest of the team and for your future work).
Generate documentation of all the processes to facilitate their understanding, transfer or backup.

Qualifications

You have experience on:
Statistical analysis: you know the basic statistical concepts, and know how to implement them in different programming languages (ideally R, Python or Spark). You know when to use different indicators and have experience summarizing data insights with them.
Dealing with large datasets, and implementing scalable solutions. You know what data cleaning means and how to interact with a data engineer.
How to solve problems using data: analyze the problem and decompose it into different analytical components, and recycle all the components you can from other projects.
Software development: you know what git means, and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. Open-source lovers get a plus if you show us your github!
Data Visualization, and tools like ggplot, matplotlib, tableau, or similar. Bonus points for Microstrategy, or QuickSight.
You are an SQL-ninja, writing simple exploratory or efficient queries won't be a problem for you
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in the sector

Moreover, We Need That
You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you have to be polite enough to challenge others¬¥ ideas.
You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when you need it. When they don‚Äôt know something they just say so. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
You get things done. You collaboratively create thoughtful plans, communicate them to others, hustle to get resources, and then execute. You are organized. You strongly favor simple and elegant solutions over complex ones.
You don‚Äôt freak out when things go wrong. Who wants to work for someone who is constantly in a panic?
You can think at different altitudes. That is, you are equally comfortable dealing with both the big picture and the fine details.
You are superb communicator. You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly. You ask others for input. You listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others. Your presentations are not death by PowerPoint.
Transparency is one of your main cards. You enjoy sharing your knowledge.
You are a team player

You are superb communicator. You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly. You ask others for input. You listen carefully

Company Description

We are a world leading online classifieds business that reaches more than 200 million people each month through our household name brands across 16 countries. Our brands include Leboncoin, OLX, fotocasa, Infojobs and Shpock to name a few.

Our brands are supported by global tech hubs in Paris and Barcelona. Their goal is to develop common global product & innovation platforms which all of our brands can use; this means using bleeding edge technology to create highly scalable, highly customisable and secure products and components to free up the development time of our brands and leverage our access to global data.

Job Description

The Trust & Transactions tribe will play an instrumental role in supporting marketplaces in our joint mission.

Our Product Portfolio Consists Of Three Strong Products

We will achieve this by working closely with marketplaces to solve their main problems within these domains.
Messaging: Our in-app chat product
Serenity: Our fraud prevention application
Trust: Our product aimed at increasing the trust between buyers and sellers
We are looking for a proactive Data Analyst to help us take Trust and Transactions to the next level.

Responsibilities
Work closely with Product, UX and Engineering teams on optimizing existing features and building new ones.

Descripci√≥n:
NOTICE: ONLINE RECRUITMENT

LOCATION: Barcelona, Spain or remotely

Brainly is looking for Data Analysts to join our teams. As a Data Analyst dedicated to Product you will cooperate closely with engineers and designers to create the best experience for 350+ mln Brainly users all over the world. 

You will have an opportunity to join our Subscriptions or Tutoring teams. The mission of the Subscriptions Team is to help users to understand the value of Brainly and make the purchase process as efficient as possible. The work is mission-critical, directly contributing to Brainly' s bottom line. Because of that, they are also called SWAT - Subscription Web Acquisition Team. When the company needs help regarding the Conversion Rate Optimisation, SWAT gets in the game. As a part of this team, you will create new ideas, test hypotheses and use data-driven techniques to deliver the optimal solutions. Working as a part of the Engagement Team, your role will not only be to measure and analyse how our users behave, but also to take part in an exciting journey to bring machine learning-driven personalization to Brainly. Your recommendations will influence the shape of individualized engagement experience that we are currently building in Brainly.

To help you deliver that, you will become an integral member of our data-driven and user-oriented data analysts community, ready to give support and share knowledge whenever needed. On top of that, you will get a unique chance to observe how one of the most successful Polish startups operates and take part in developing it.
 WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU:

Intriguing possibility to make an impact on a product used on a global scale - Brainly is used by 350+ million users monthly in 35 countries
You will transform the world online education by developing related products for students, parents, and teachers around the globe
Opportunity to work with the newest technology stack (Google Analytics 360, Google Optimize, Tableau, AWS, Google Cloud Platform)
Possibility to work with scrum values which will bring you maximal productivity and joy of work
 YOUR TYPICAL DAY WILL INCLUDE:

Working with the Product team to ideate, create and launch experiments 
Analysing and synthesizing experiments data to make recommendations for optimization
Managing the experiments queue, results and documentation
Supporting Product and Business Owners in their decisions about product development by collecting and analysing data
Preparing measurement specifications for new features in cooperation with Engineers
Defining KPIs and measurement plans, create reports and dashboards
Working as a part of an agile product development team on a day-to-day basis (take part in standups, brainstorming sessions, planning and backlog refinements)
 WE WOULD LOVE TO WORK WITH YOU IF YOU HAVE:

Experience:
2-3 years of experience in digital analytics
AB testing 
Statistical background
Experience in market research or user testing (considered an asset)
Consumer subscription experience (considered an asset)
Experience in performing a large number of experiments (considered an asset) 

Skills and systems:
Experience in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
SQL 
Excellent Google spreadsheets/Excel skills

Nice to have:
Tableau 
Google DataStudio
Google BigQuery
G-Suite
Python

Attributes:
Analytical skills: drawing conclusions from data and proposing recommendations
Strong collaborative skills
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Demonstrates independent thinking when evaluating critical information to reach conclusions
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Fluent English (in speaking and writing)
Flexibility and ability to adapt to rapidly changing conditions
 
ADDITIONAL DETAILS:
Location: Barcelona (Carrer de L¬¥Escar, 26 Edificio de OneCowork)

Some of our benefits: 
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely
Personal development budget 800$ per year + unlimited time off policy for participation in conferences and workshops and access to an online learning platform with courses from Udemy, Harvard Manage Mentor and many others
Full medical insurance (including partner and children)
Gym & wellness card (including access to gyms, sports classes)
Access to the Mental Health Helpline - providing virtual support of external psychologists, psychotherapists, and coaches
Possibility to join one of our Employee Resource Groups and initiatives (Inclusion Council, Ladies at Brainly, Brainly Cares)
If needed, additional budget for work remote work accessories


WHAT IS BRAINLY?
Brainly is the world's largest peer-to-peer learning community for students, parents and teachers. At brainly.com, and its group of websites around the world, students connect to both receive and offer help with homework problems and questions. The unique opportunity for students to freely ask questions and gain the confidence that comes from helping others and inspires students to learn in a collaborative community that receives more than 350 million users each month.

Based in Krak√≥w, Poland, with its US headquarters in New York City, Brainly is currently available in 35 countries. The total funding from current investors, including Naspers, General Catalyst Partners, Point Nine Capital, Runa Capital and Learn Capital equals $150M. More information about Brainly is available on www.brainly.com.

In connection with this, you have the right to withdraw your consents, the right to access to your data, the right to obtain their copy, rectify them, erase, limit their usage and also data portability right and object to their use by Brainly, as well as to lodge a complaint with the President of the UODO. If you have any questions regarding the use of information about you and exercising your rights related to this use, please contact our DPO - privacy@brainly.com. Descripci√≥n:
Graduate Analyst - Junior BIG DATA Analyst

As a Graduate Analyst you will become part of our AIM team which provides a full range of data and analytic services to clients across multiple industry sectors. You will be assigned to a client engagement where you will work alongside experienced Cognizant employees delivering technology solutions to gain experience from practice. An introduction to Analytics & Information Management (AIM) AIM is one of the world's biggest BI practices (20.000+ colleagues) and well known for her ability to execute, thought leadership and client focus. We have a broad range of experience in different functional areas like Customer Analytics, Big Data, Data Governance and others. Although we are big, towards our employees we act in small communities where everybody knows each other. Your role as Junior BIG DATA Developer We are looking for passionate graduates with a mind-set to software development in the digital space. In this job you will be responsible, as a big data developer, for the technical realization of project related transactions, i.e. responsible for independently implementing the design of new transactions within the architectural framework and respecting development standards. You are motivated and interested in data warehouse and/or big data technologies and a team player..

You have attention for quality, maintainability, security, performance and testing. You document your status and progress in our JIRA ticketing system and document your code in our Confluence wiki. You have the ambition to obtain the best possible result for our customer and are not afraid to point attention points and/or propose improvements along the way. Personal development Prior to starting your first client engagement, you will attend a three weeks induction program for graduates abroad to ensure you have a solid understanding of Cognizant's culture and processes.

You will have the opportunity for further training and support by our own Academy to help you achieve your long-term career goals, like working with different cultures, requirement gathering, project management, agile development and many more.

The induction program normally starts in January, May and September. These are also the moments when you will start with Cognizant. In addition to your day to day project manager and your supervisor, we will assign a mentor from another Cognizant practice to ensure you get all the help and support you need to start your career on the best footing.

Descripci√≥n:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!

Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst in our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers‚Äô behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
What are we looking for?
2/3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
And you are ...
A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn‚Äôt stopped us from offering these great benefits!

You‚Äôll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser ‚Äôs for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
‚ÄúAn apple a day keeps the doctor away‚Äù so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Position Snapshot

Nespresso Global

Location: Esplugues de LLobregat, Barcelona

Full time position

Position Summary

Serves as a liaison between the IS/IT & Nespresso Business Customers and SAP project partner As part of the Nespresso HRIS Project Team, brings deep understanding to the opportunities and issues facing your business function and advises on the best solutions.

Translates business strategies, opportunities, threats and needs into IS/IT product requirements, then plays a key role within the product team to specify, test and deploy those as IS/IT solutions.

A day in the life of HRIS Business Analyst

Contribution to IS/IT Strategy - under the supervision and guidance of her/his Nespresso IS Project Manager based in Switzerland
Supports the Product Manager and Nespresso Total Rewards CoC Head in the development of the strategy through incremental improvement of the product.
Operational Effectiveness and Efficiency
Analyzes, documents and tests program development, logic, process flows and specifications
Documents training materials for the product area
Delivers training to the end users, deployment and support teams
Supports the analysis and resolution of solution issues as part of the third level sustain
Designs business scenarios and use cases for the product mix, including product introduction, specification and the change management required to maximize its adoption/value
Works with Project Managers to define the minimum viable product (MVP) that satisfies the business need
Secures by early business feedback that the MVPs defined will really provide the desired value (MVP taste-testing)
Identifies gaps in existing functionalities, options for improvement and opportunities for process automation.
And:

Virtual Team Influencing:
Develops, motivates and directs staff belonging to various organizations (Nespresso Markets, Nespresso HQ Channels/Function and Nestl√©/Nespresso IS/IT) to understand the business needs and find the best solution that will both align with the customer objectives and the IS/IT strategy.
Security, Compliance & Risk Management:
Responsible for identifying security & compliance requirements, including roles, associated with the business process and ensures they are considered in the solution design
Stakeholder Engagement:
Partners with business and Nestl√©/Nespresso IS/IT to elicit, analyze, translate, and document business requirements, pain points or opportunities into IS/IT requirements
Works with business partners to conduct paper-based design, solutioning sessions, and MVP taste-testing all along the life cycle from business demand to value delivery.
Assesses near-term needs, using structured interview processes and consumer research methods to understand opportunities and help business establish priorities. Consults with product teams and proposes alternative solutions. Advises on options, risks, costs versus benefits, and impact on other business processes and product priorities.
Supports the Nespresso Total Rewards CoC Head and Nespresso HRIS Project Manager to facilitate both strategy and innovation planning with business stakeholders.
What Will Make You Successful
Bachelor's degree in business, information systems or related discipline, or equivalent; M.B.A. preferred
5+ years of relevant experience of business analysis in a relevant functional area. Operational Market experience preferred.
Relevant Project management experience
Business experience in a relevant function is beneficial
Experience working in an Agile/DevOps environment using design thinking methodology
Experience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in English
Experience working in a global environment and with virtual teams
Relevant experience in similar multi-team / global deployement project set-up

Descripci√≥n:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors from some of tech‚Äôs most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel industry.

Over the past few years, we‚Äôve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market‚Äîworth over $1.3 trillion‚Äîby simplifying the process for everyone involved.

In spite of the ongoing global pandemic, we‚Äôre continuously growing and adapting to the situation. We‚Äôre turning lemons into lemonade‚Äîbecause we‚Äôre innovators. We‚Äôve even developed TravelCare, our very own travel risk management tool, to ensure business travelers are safe and sound before, during, and after their trips. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal‚Äîand that‚Äôs where you come in!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.


What You Need
Data engineering or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English.
Excellent analytical skills.


You Will Need To Prove The Following
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)
Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data: ETL processes (i.e. Pentaho Data Integration).
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker).
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals.


What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain, 25 in the UK or Germany
Flexibility to work from home most of the time.
Health perks, these vary depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Perks such as language lessons, yoga and office food have been put on hold during Covid-19 and will be reviewed


Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in.
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain, UK or Germany for this position.
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona, London or Berlin twice per week.
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event.
We have core working hours.
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!


We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base‚Äîand we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer, which means you‚Äôre welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you‚Äôre from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

DNV GL Energy Systems division is seeking a Junior Wind Energy Data Analyst to join our Project Development and Analytics team in Spain . This role is to enhance capabilities and increase resources of the Project Development and Analytics (PD&A) team , which is responsible to support developers from the prospection phase, development, and operation. Energy production assessments, both pre construction and operational, are the main service we provide to developers, investors, operators or lenders.

Analyzing wind and other climatic data
Analyzing SCADA data and alarms
Monitor performance issues of a wind farm
Predicting wind farm energy production

About AbbVie

AbbVie‚Äôs mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Summary

From the Business Technology Services (BTS) area we are looking for experts in Data Engineering to join our team based in our Madrid offices. As a Data Engineer, you will have the mission of managing our Data databases to ensure the acquisition, modeling, and visualization of data that will be used to support business decisions aligned with the company strategy.

About AbbVie

AbbVie‚Äôs mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. Descripci√≥n:
At Domestika we are looking for a Data Analyst.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us make a positive impact in the decisions we make daily. We believe in creating an environment where data analysts can actively participate in formulating hypotheses, making proposals and follow through in a close relationship with our colleagues in business areas.

We need you to be driven, courageous and ready to learn. While you will work closely with our Senior and Lead Analysts, you will be virtually sitting next to our business users to understand their challenges and help them use analytics to best support their decisions.

We Are Particularly Interested In Profiles With Experience In The Following Areas

As a Data Analyst, you will work with Data every day, finding ways to interpret it so that it makes sense for our users.
Social Media campaigns performance
Digital content performance
CRM and Loyalty programs
Growth performance
Pricing Strategy
Product Analytics
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

What does a Data Analyst do at Domestika?
Help Domestika colleagues in everyday analytics questions.
Deliver actionable insight to business stakeholders.
Understand Domestika business model and key drivers.
Help define performance measurement such as metrics or KPIs.
Operate and support the good use of Analytical tools such Periscope, GA, Amplitude and more.
Follow-through analytical requests to understand its added value to the business.
Actively contribute to our User tracking framework definition and implementation.

Requirements
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a digital company, consumer apps.
Analytical mindset.
Ability to read and write complex SQL.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.
Preferably, a Math/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.
Based within European time zone.
English required at Full professional proficiency.

Would Be a Plus
Familiarity with business intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics, etc.
Experience in designing events and tagging for analytics.
Ability to work independently, take the initiative and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?
Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
Balanced work life with a Remote First approach.
A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
An honest salary according to your experience and profile.

Clarity‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to markets. Our disruptive tech tool allows systematic measurement and optimization of the social impact of investment portfolios, and our proprietary methodology provides a deeper understanding of the needs of the population and gives a comprehensive view of how those needs are covered by different economic actors. Together, the tool and the methodology will improve the allocation of the World‚Äôs capital to human needs.

Clarity is working to become a global standard in social and environmental impact measurement. That‚Äôs where you come in!

We are looking for a Data Research Analyst that will help us build a reliable and scalable data base of sustainability information, through research on Companies‚Äô CSR and ESG indicators methodology and quality assurance processes.

The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION

Madrid or remote (part-time or full-time)

Key Responsibilities

Working as a Data Research Analyst you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate data, in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Data Research Analyst role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities
Conduct frequent research for procuring, verifying and processing data on Sustainability trends by browsing through various financial, exchange and government regulator websites and materials.
Review company-level sustainability issues including environmental, social and corporate governance practices and synthesize these findings into broader frameworks.
Adhere to quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) processes
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed.


Qualifications

Excellent oral and written English communication skills. (Minimum C1 level-proficient user). Other languages are a plus
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree - Finance, Economics, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study.
Basic to intermediate knowledge of MS Excel and/or database applications.
Strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Ability to work with complex data sets with consistently high levels of comprehension and to apply defined methodologies appropriately.
DESIRED EXPERIENCE
Ideally experience with data collection and validation
Prior knowledge of corporate governance, ESG and/or financial markets is an advantage.

Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Descripci√≥n:
We are a global scale-up from Barcelona, born in 2015, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We envision a world free from fossil fuels and we believe the first step in this journey is creating solutions that make electric vehicle charging easier for everyone.

We‚Äôre devoted to researching and developing state-of-the-art electric vehicle charging solutions for homes, businesses, and cities. And this way, our mission is to create more sustainable ways of using and sharing energy.

We want to empower people to create, use and share renewable energy in ways they never imagined.

Wallbox currently operates in over 50 countries and has offices in Barcelona, Madrid, Shanghai, and San Francisco. We are powered by a culture of trust, innovation and diversity. For us, talent has no borders. We have more than 350 dedicated experts from over 30 different nationalities working together to create the most innovative products and the best experiences for our customers.

This culture has shown to be rewarding in many ways - amongst them, the creation of the world‚Äôs first bidirectional charger, the Quasar, and the recognition as the best of CES 2020 in transportation technology. We have recently closed our second tranche of Series A investment, bringing the total round to ‚Ç¨23M and we‚Äôve been recognized as LinkedIn's Top 5 Startups 2020 in Spain.

At the end of the day, working at Wallbox is at the same time challenging, fun and rewarding. If you like the idea of a dynamic environment, desire to work alongside an incredibly talented, fast-growing team and believe in the future of sustainable transportation, this is the place for you.

Are you ready to change the world with us?

About The Role

We are looking for a Digital Data Analyst; your primary responsibility will be for Data analysis, from working with 3rd party data to 1st party data by using multiple tools such as Adwords, Search console for but mainly Google Analytics.

The position will be very data and relationship focused. Working in the e-commerce team with our digital agencies, UX team and marketing team.

A strong understanding of Data is essential. Specific tasks will include; working with different analytic tools, stakeholder relations, embedding change. In addition you will also create dashboards for better understanding and data visualization.

You will
Work with a multicultural digital team.
Work with all the global markets.
Work in a growing industry.
Help to create and constantly improve the e-commerce business.


Requirements
High level of English.
Barcelona based.
Minimum 3 years of Experience as a proven Digital Data Analyst, Marketing Insight Analyst, Insight Analyst, or Campaign Analyst
Degree in Marketing, Business, Finance, Statistics or Economics.
Being a Google Analytics expert is absolutely essential.
Previous experience in a e-commerce team.
Experience with Data and analysis in order to bring a data-driven approach to decision-making tactics.
Excel advanced skills are essential (able to work with complex Excel formulas).
It is a plus knowing data visualization tools.
High attention to detail and appreciation for understanding processes.
SQL experience would be plus.
Experience with Amazon platform would be a massive help
Knowledge in any of the following areas Attribution Modelling, Programmatic (DMP, DSP, SSP), Cross-Device Measurement.

Attractive compensation package

Friday afternoons off

Sports channel, which offers online classes until our gym is opened

Over 20 different nationalities
No suits! Unless it‚Äôs Carnival or Halloween

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. We currently deliver over +100M annual orders and operate in 22 countries, and in over +300 cities.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst to join the Q-commerce team. Would you rather read numbers than books? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona‚Äôs fastest growing Startups ‚Äì helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

As a Data Analyst in the Q-commerce team you will be responsible for using data to support different business areas unlock their potential, always in the business front-line creating tools that optimise operations, improve marketing effectiveness, and in general developing new ways of doing things.

We are looking for a tech savvy analytics professional with the same passion that we have for creating solutions from scratch in a Groceries business that is scaling like a rocket.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Create customised tools to enable new business operating models such as darkstores and fulfillment
Automate and improve manual processes to relieve pain points from the Groceries local teams
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
A/B test the launch of new features
Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data
Mentor junior colleagues
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders


You Have
2-4 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions
Expertise in business operations within specific function or area
Proficient with SQL
Amazon Redshift experience is highly desirable
Proficiency in Python or R
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview
Previous experience in programming is desirable
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field
Experience managing a small team
Proficiency in English is a must


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

Brief Description
This job is for you if you‚Äôre an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company ‚Äì and an industry ‚Äì where you‚Äôll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience.
Description
This job is for you if you‚Äôre an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company ‚Äì and an industry ‚Äì where you‚Äôll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience. You‚Äôll also have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills that make you the ideal team player. The nature of the role means that analysts travel frequently, so you‚Äôll need to be ready to jet-set across the globe.
Here‚Äôs what an ordinary day could look like:
Business Analysts will typically perform the following tasks and responsibilities:
- Work in a project module with support and guidance from senior team members
- Facilitate in producing reliable and accurate research for client projects and proposals
- Conduct analysis of quantitative and qualitative data
- Summarize main ideas and findings from work through written, graphical or oral presentations
- Help facilitate discussions within project teams
- Increase proficiency in unfamiliar TMT topics
- Supports senior team members in the development of intellectual capital
Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
Skills and Qualifications
- Undergraduate degree in: Business, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, Management, Strategy, Analytics or a related field, with strong grades (min. 2.1 equivalent grade)
- A relevant internship assuming similar responsibilities
- Interest in the Telecoms, Media and Tech (TMT) industry
- Good problem-solving skills
- Strong quantitative and analytical skills
- A logical and lateral thinker, who is intellectually curious
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with fluency in English (written and spoken)
- A team player, who can work in a truly diverse setting
- Highly motivated individual who is looking to learn and grow with the company
Additional skills that give you the edge
These are advantageous, but not strictly required from all applicants:
- Previous experience within the TMT sector

For one of our corporate global client selling and servicing home appliance devices in Europe, we are looking for one experienced Business Analyst to join a global Field Service Management/After Market rollout in 15 European countries (starting with Finland, Sweeden, Norway).

The location of the candidate must be in Europe and the work will be remote, with some travels to customer's premises in Europe (when allowed).

 You will participate to the Field Service Digitalization and Transformation program rollout of our client, consisting of implementing globally defined processes and IT systems, and you will be a key player within the project rollout team, taking the role of lead Business Analyst for the countries you will be assigned to. You will combine your own experience with our Field Service in Motion methodology‚Ñ¢ to make the project a success and realize the expected benefits.

¬∑      Driving the scope definition to adjust local configuration requirements while keeping the technical consistency of the processes end to end

      Your ideal profile:

  Our company:
 We are a unique company operating actively in Field Service Management with core expertise in Field Service Management Optimization
 FIELD SERVICE in MOTION (www.FieldServiceinMotion.com) is  a  highly specialized niche management consulting firm uniquely active in assisting Field Service Organizations in "Getting their Field Service Right", by improving their customer and employee engagement, their internal efficiency, mainly (but not only) along with the rollout of Field Service Management softwares.

(Field Service Organizations (FSO) typically dispatch technicians to remote location to provide (planned & corrective) maintenance, repairs and/or installations services on equipments, often by respecting a predefined maintenance contract signed with customers. Efficiently managing a team of service technicians, or "field force", is a an operationnally complex task, as it requires to "optimize" many variables : equipments downtime, customers SLA's, clear jobs requests, technicians skills & knowledge, logistics and spare parts management, etc)
 Thanks to our outstanding Field Service/aftermarket expertise and to our dedicated methodology to get the benefits out of FSM software rollouts, we typically run Field Service assessment, detect hidden potential in Field Service companies, propose very concrete actions plan, assist in selecting the right Field Service Management Software and implementing teams, and lead End-to-End transformation and digitalization programs in Field Service companies‚Ä¶ up to the realization of the expected benefits !
 With our network of Field Service experts, we are advising more and more companies in the BeNeLux countries, and in Northern Europe, and we take the lead of major Field Service Management transformation programs in several companies, mainly with the implementation of Field Service Management Softwares. We work in close collaboration with all stakeholders within the FS companies (from technicians to board members), and with IT Integrators (selected by our customers).
 Our major differentiated strengths are first to have demonstrated in the past many successful FSM software rollouts in many major companies. As we are fully independent from any Field Service Management Software companies and FSM Integrators, we are recognized as a trusted partner to assist our customers getting their Field Service Right.
 We understand the trends in Field Service Management
 Today, there are 20 million Field Technicians operating globally (source : Gartner), and the Field Service Management digitalization market is growing by +16% a year, to reach $4.45 billion by 2022 (source : Reuters) ! 
Many Field Service Organization are trying to find their way in getting the benefits out of Field Service Management Software implementation. We know how to help them, and we are convinced we are best positioned to take a piece of this market potential !

We‚Äôre looking for a Commercial Data Analyst to join our Analytics team, working on a fully remote basis until at least March 2021.

About Carwow

Buying a car is the 2nd biggest financial decision people make after buying a house, and it‚Äôs an incredibly complex one. Consumers face many challenges in the process from choosing the right car to buy, to making sure they‚Äôre getting a good deal - here at carwow we aim to fix them all.

From an attic to the 6th fastest growing company in Europe in 2018; carwow is an online marketplace making car buying better for everyone. Car buying is one of the last areas to be revolutionised by the internet - here at carwow we‚Äôre leading the online revolution. Already we‚Äôve improved car buying for 200,000+ people who have bought ¬£5 billion+ worth of cars with our help.

We‚Äôre a highly driven (excuse the pun), energetic scale-up with a team of 200+ based in London, Munich and Madrid. We‚Äôre backed by some of Europe‚Äôs leading VCs & car manufacturer Daimler (Mercedes-Benz) with over ¬£55m of total funding raised.

We‚Äôre constantly asking ourselves how we can make car buying better, so if you‚Äôre curious, motivated, and want to help us change the future of our industry, get in touch. It‚Äôs the chance to be at the very start of something huge.

The role

As a Commercial Data Analyst within the Analytics team at carwow, you will work closely with our General Managers and Commercial leadership in the UK, Germany and Spain, and wider business stakeholders. carwow‚Äôs model thrives on bringing both consumers dealerships together, and this is a unique role sitting at the interface between supply and demand.

You will be able to put your talent and passion of turning complex data into actionable business decisions and doing so in a fast-paced ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities Include
Conduct marketplace analysis - supply & demand balancing, consumer funnel conversion rates, network growth opportunities, dealership churn, commercial model optimisation.
Help to inform, influence, support and execute carwow‚Äôs business decisions.
Develop and run quantitative analysis and reports to support our commercial growth efforts.
Produce automated tools and dashboards to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key metrics and experiment results.
Initiate and drive projects from start to finish with minimal guidance.
Manage and work with senior stakeholders in the UK head office and the Commercial teams in the UK, Germany and Spain.
Work with enormous amounts of data!


Requirements
Previous experience with quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet company (or high volume B2C environment) is essential
Advanced SQL, highly skilled in data analysis and visualisation (e.g Tableau or similar BI tool).
Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Excellent business judgment and strategic thinking/commercial acumen
An excellent communicator with the ability to clearly make sense of complex ideas
A passion for analytics and data
Experience with programming languages (e.g. Python/R) ‚Äì a plus
Bsc/BA in a relevant field e.g mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering or other quantitative field could be advantageous


Benefits
A competitive salary
Equity in the company (share options)
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays and Christmas Eve
Health Private medical health insurance, subsidised gym membership, free access to Sanctus mental-health coaching sessions
Financial Private pension scheme, salary sacrifice benefits (i.e. cycle to work), Travel Loan
Office A dog-friendly office in Victoria to take advantage of in the New Year (let Mat Watson take you for a spin around our office here) with remote working options
Social Company wide collaboration such as bi-weekly product demos, coffee with the exec sessions, culture club, social events (currently virtual)


At carwow, we appreciate the value that comes from having diverse employees. Whether that be diversity of age, disability, sex, gender, sexuality, pregnancy, race or religion, we strive to create a team where anybody can thrive. We strongly believe a varied workforce creates a more innovative company with a broader perspective. Wherever you‚Äôre from, whatever you believe, all we ask is that you have drive and share our company values (you can view them here).

Descripci√≥n:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.

Backed by some of the world‚Äôs leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving the understanding of our customers (supply & demand).

As part of this role, you‚Äôll study user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You‚Äôd be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply‚Äôs marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics across the customer journey, from acquisition to activation, engagement and retention
Increase our customer knowledge through applied analytics, clustering and segmentation
Quantify the impact of the initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, sharing knowledge and insights across the organization
Design, execute, and evaluate experiments on a global scale (CRM, copy, etc.)
Iterate on our growth strategy (attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modeling, etc.)
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behaviour and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards


What We Are Looking For
Experience as an in-house Data Scientist or Data Analyst. At least 3 years' experience, ideally more.
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Previous experience in some of the following Growth techniques: attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modelling
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must


Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)


What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance


Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We‚Äôre obsessed with our customer‚Äôs problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.


Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL

The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.

With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.

Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.

You will be in contact with: - business key users of Finance around EU to collect group and local requirements and use cases, provide data extracted for different systems, analyse issues and fix data - developers (based in France) to provide user stories and to test the deliverables Your main challenge will be to understand the current model, the group products organisation and their interactions to have a strong understanding about the context and be able to define and execute the roadmap of the product in coordination with the Product Owner.
