Company Description

We are a world leading online classifieds business that reaches more than 200 million people each month through our household name brands across 16 countries. Our brands include Leboncoin, OLX, fotocasa, Infojobs and Shpock to name a few.

Our brands are supported by global tech hubs in Paris and Barcelona. Their goal is to develop common global product & innovation platforms which all of our brands can use; this means using bleeding edge technology to create highly scalable, highly customisable and secure products and components to free up the development time of our brands and leverage our access to global data.

Job Description

The Trust & Transactions tribe will play an instrumental role in supporting marketplaces in our joint mission.

Our Product Portfolio Consists Of Three Strong Products

We will achieve this by working closely with marketplaces to solve their main problems within these domains.
Messaging: Our in-app chat product
Serenity: Our fraud prevention application
Trust: Our product aimed at increasing the trust between buyers and sellers
We are looking for a proactive Data Analyst to help us take Trust and Transactions to the next level.

Responsibilities
Work closely with Product, UX and Engineering teams on optimizing existing features and building new ones.
Be responsible for experiments - brainstorm, design, plan, analyze and communicate results of the experiments that should help answering the most important business questions.
Perform analysis to understand user behaviour and proactively propose solutions based on the findings of this research.
Help stakeholders make decisions by answering their ad-hoc questions based on data
Design and maintain tracking events for the product to make sure the performance can be measured. At the same time, ensure the highest quality of the data collected.
Design KPIs to analyze performance of the product and its impact on business.
Build and maintain dashboards to allow stakeholders track performance of the features of their interest.
Work with Data Engineers to design and implement datasets to streamline analysis processes.
Have a key role in building data culture within the company. Teach your colleagues on the importance of data and explain statistical concepts to non-data people.

Qualifications
3-4 years of experience as Data Analyst, ideally in Product team
Excellent problem solving skills.
Ability to organize your work efficiently and prioritize tasks. Experience with Agile methodologies desired.
Solid statistical background.
Ability to run and optimize advanced SQL queries
Experience in defining tracking and events
Strong experience in experimentation (especially AB testing)
Advanced knowledge of Python / R with emphasis on data analysis packages.
Working knowledge of Jupyter Notebook.
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker or Qlik.
Basic knowledge of Git and command-line
Very strong communication skills (both written and verbal). Ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiences.

Additional Information

Not Essential But Would Be a Strong Plus
Experience in e-commerce company
Apache Spark
Basic knowledge of AWS Cloud

Description

Role Description

Makers of the new - DuPont is elevating our commitment and reinventing the ways in which we shape the world. From new kinds of nourishment for the world‚Äôs infants to new technologies that enable life-giving medical care. This is how, together with our partners, we will foster sustainable progress for generations to come.
Our Information Technology organization is recruiting for a Business Data Specialist in Asturias, Spain. This position will participate in a cross-functional, global team environment as a member of the Enterprise Data Solutions Delivery organization, responsible for supporting global design, realization, implementation and deployment of data management solutions (processes, tools and controls).

Key Responsabilities
Drive standardization, simplification, harmonization and improvement of master data and related E2E (end-to-end) processes to ensure maximum benefit is derived.
Champion governance, alignment, and communication of Best Practices across the master data related business processes.
Identify opportunities to streamline the strategic data management processes to support standardization, simplification and consistency in data across channels and regions.

Work with data project leader in defining project plans, setting milestones, and estimating completion dates. May occasionally be responsible for leading projects. Regularly report project status to project leaders, managers, and clients. Plan own pieces of overall projects and fit individual plans into overall plans, often self-directed.
Respond to problems/questions of clients and co-workers. Investigate technical and software-related problems, analyze, and recommend solutions. Explain resolution and impact to clients in terms they will understand.
Develop technology-driven processes to automate strategic data management process and more accurately track benefit realization.
Develop reports to support data management execution and measurement of adherence to key data standards.
Assure that business key information and systems requirements are met by preparing all other external documentation above and beyond program and job source documentation. Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a Principal Business Performance Analyst to be a senior member of our growing Central Analytics team at King. Working with stakeholders from across King, you will provide critical insights into the state and trend of our business that enable better decision making and drive impact. Your work will be crucial to help push the boundaries of how we understand our players and games. As a senior part of the Central Analytics team, you will set the standard for outstanding, holistic business insights. Your reporting will seamlessly combine King‚Äôs own data with player insights and market intelligence.

Your role within our Kingdom
You will be working collaboratively across all parts of the business to crack company- wide problems in how we can grow our business.

Reporting To The Director Of Central Analytics, You Will
Deliver actionable insights that can support and drive impactful decisions
Lead the business, including King‚Äôs Leadership Team, in understanding key performance trends and identifying opportunities for growth
Provide accurate data, insights, analysis and forecasts for decision makers and stakeholders
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis on our portfolio of games and player network
Communicate results in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualisation and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sources
Foster strong relationships with other key functions across King, such as Finance, Corporate Strategy and Marketing
As a senior member of Central Analytics and the whole data community at King, be an advocate for high quality, impactful data deliverables
Position yourself as key expert on our own business, industry trends and the competitor landscape to evolve our thinking
Identify opportunities for growth, influence key stakeholders and drive initiatives to a successful outcome.

Skills To Create Thrills

You are a highly analytical, passionate problem solver. You have the ability to draw data driven business insights that will add real value to King. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly.
Experience working in a commercial data team, providing business insights and models which lead to data informed business decisions
You can see the forest, not just trees. You understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then find the right data, analysis or interpretation to translate into actionable insights
Methodological and pragmatic with a hands- on approach that can get straight to the point when needed
Strong communication skills: you can communicate the most complex insights concisely and clearly in writing and in person
Great relationship building and influencing skills, and experience in managing and satisfying senior stakeholders‚Äô needs
Masters or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics. Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for numerical analysis
Prior experience in an industry with very short implementation cycles such as e- commerce, online products/services or games
Experience in working with highly- skilled peers in analytics, data science and engineering, consumer research, and Business Performance
Bonus Points
Solid understanding or enthusiasm for the games industry
Skills to create reports and dashboards that allow teams to understand and optimize initiatives using tools such as Python/R, Looker and BigQuery (GCS)
Knowledge of and/or interest in dashboard & reporting tools
Open to feedback as a way of learning and improving
Pragmatic problem- solver ‚Äì someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problems

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players ‚Äì and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.

Company Description

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent has brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated, experienced professionals focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, or our respect and care for one another.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our Data team. This person will report to the Data & Analytics Manager.

Your Daily Adventure
Manage and manipulate SQL data sets, including: defining variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address business requirements.
Provide hands-on R development, data processing automation, and statistical models deployment
Building both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis from multiple data sources (Tableau).
Proactively developing new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention and monetization.
Debugging and problem solving issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics.
Identify, document and design data to be tracked.
Design and help development team to implement/deploy new features, systems, experiments/ABTs, etc.
Qualifications

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Math, Computer Science or related field. Masters degree in any of these disciplines is a Plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis
Ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases.
Analytical coding: using tools such as R, Python, Excel, et al.
Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
Passionate about data, creative, highly meticulous, able to work under tight deadlines and are a team player.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Interest in mobile F2P games.
Have an excellent communication and presentation skills.
English business proficiency.
Have a work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.

Additional Information

Descripci√≥n:
What's Landbot

Landbot is a no-code communication automation platform that empowers non-technical users to automate business processes through conversational experiences. COVID19 is accelerating digitalization at both the consumer and enterprise level, so the adoption of communication automation solutions therefore is skyrocketing.

In three years Landbot has gone from a chatbot builder MVP to a product with thousands of recurring customers who use it daily to get more and better leads across the whole world. This is possible thanks to our builder, a centerpiece of the product, which allows non-technical people to build engaging conversational experiences.

What's The Opportunity

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to become a centerpiece in the company as the first member in the Business Intelligence Team.

You‚Äôll work together with all departments (Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance...) in order to build a data-driven culture and improve our performance.

You‚Äôre excited to switch between working with sales and customer success team to minimize churn one day, marketing to set up their attribution tracking systems the next, while structuring the product analytics team the other day.

You‚Äôre intimately familiar with the technical side of business intelligence work, but at the same time are able to think on a company-wide, strategic level.

You will be responsible to setup the foundation for data frameworks, resources and tools with freedom to define such centerpieces at the company level.

Your challenge
Understand the business needs and produce insightful analyses for sales, marketing and product teams.
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions such as "what is the effect of one product change over other KPI‚Äôs" into insights and opportunities.
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders.
Help colleagues to access to the right data and understand what it reveals.
Create hypothesis, collect data to either support or disprove the hypothesis and recommend solutions to help move a metric.
Identify business opportunities based on a combination of internal and external data sets.
Synthesize complex data and present clear recommendations to senior management.
4+ years in a similar role at a SaaS company.
Deep understanding of SaaS business and metrics to provide KPI insights and data guidance.
Degree ideally in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science or related degree or Economics/Business.
Strong knowledge of SQL ‚Äì optimization of big data queries and Airflow are a plus.
Knowledge of Data Modelling, be able to program in Python and/or R.
Extremely organized with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects within tight timelines.
Proven track record of defining and executing key analysis with minimal supervision.
Strong attention to detail.
The ability to data mine across a large and varied business area or key priority for the company.
Great reporting skills being able to transform data into intuitive dashboards, reports and insights.
Very strong communicator, both written & verbally.
You are fluent in English and Spanish (it's a must).
Eligibility to work in Spain


Benefits
A competitive salary package in a fast-growing start-up.
Great culture & working atmosphere, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
Live and work in sunny Barcelona.
Remote friendly.
Friday happy hours after our weekly team meetings.
Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
Bonus transport tickets, educational content, and all you need to feel empowered.
Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.
Top-notch work equipment.

Description

Who we are:

ENGIE is a global energy company, a leading provider of electricity, natural gas, and energy services. With 153,090 employees in more than 70 countries worldwide, ENGIE achieved revenue of ‚Ç¨66.6 billion in 2016. ENGIE is committed to being a leader in the energy transition.

We are looking for talented and motivated people to create the future of energy. Join a rewarding and flexible work environment that encourages innovation and creativity, and help us meet the energy challenges of today and tomorrow.

Global Energy Management (GEM) is one of ENGIE‚Äôs Business Units. We deliver services in supply and logistics management, asset management, risk management, market access management, while contributing to the market understanding, design and efficiency and developing market solutions to accelerate the energy transition.

GEM manages one of the largest and most diversified energy portfolios in Europe, including electricity, natural gas, bulk commodities and environmental products.

With 5 trading platforms and activities in more than 50 countries, GEM has an extended geographical coverage in Europe, Asia-Pacific and in the US. It employs 1,300 people around the world.

Context:

To assist GEM Spain users in their day to day and in the deployment of their projects, we are looking for a Business Analyst.

Role:

The GEM teams negotiate ENGIE natural gas supply contracts, optimize the assets (power plants), manage the energy purchase and sales contracts (long-term gas contracts, Virtual Power Plants, transmission capacity, storage, and re-gasification capacities, etc.). They provide customers with natural gas and electricity, as well as energy price risk management services.

In order to pursue its development, GEM is developing and rolling out various transformation projects on Deal and Risk Management, Pre-Trade systems and Short-Term activities.

Main Activities:

The role proposed aims at supporting the GEM Spain Platform through the following missions:

During the implementation of the projects in Spain :

Assist GEM users and ensure that the IS solutions are fitting users‚Äô requirements (functional and technical)
Integrate local tools with central systems
Drive locally UAT with the users
Raise specific needs linked to the specificity of the GEM Spain use cases
After the project :

Specify how to improve systems and processes in Spain and work with the teams in Paris/Brussels to adapt the set up according to the new requirements in Spain in a given budget.
Share relevant information with support and development teams in Paris & Brussels
Being the IS representative for GEM Spain activities and ensure the link between the GEM Spain stakeholders and the GEM IS teams in Brussels and Paris.
Being the GEM point of contact with the GEM Spain IS Infra/Desktops team to manage the GEM set-up in Spain, leveraging on the local IS Spain offering to meet the Trading SLAs.

The role will be in a managerial reporting to the local Business Platform GEM Spain and the Expertise Center GEM IS in Paris.

The GEM IS team project and teams works in an Agile mindset and with Agile practices such as Scrum, Kanban, Craftmanship.

The main responsibilities are:

Active role in preparing new releases integration (training, testing, enriching procedures, monitoring, ‚Ä¶)
User training and assistance
Process local user support requests (configurations, assistance, ..)
Process incidents (analyze, solve, document)
Coordination incidents resolution with any other IT team when necessary (Paris/Brussels application teams, GEM IS infrastructure, ‚Ä¶)
Monitor the IT platform and execute the associated actions when alerts are raised
Enrich the backlog of evolutions and problems (source of recurring incidents), including description, benefits, priority, ...)
Contribute to development of local solutions, integrations
Continuously Share improvement ideas with development teams
Actively participate in the writing or enhancement of operational procedures
Engaged in cross-location (Paris, Brussels, ‚Ä¶) information sharing and tasks handover
Self-organize continuous learning on the IS systems and landscape
Follow up on the evolution of the IT platform (release) and adapt procedures
Collect regularly user feed-backs on system Run Quality and share it with development teams
Support the IT part of Spain‚Äôs Business Continuity Plan and Disaster Recovery Plan


Work location:

Madrid

Qualifications

Education and professional background:

University degree in IT Engineering
More than 4 years of relevant experience in IT trading environment
Proven experience and good knowledge about Trading processes or Physical Businesses


Hard skills:

Understanding trading/energy environment
Capacity to understand business needs and provide IS solutions
Ability to write high-level and detailed specifications
Capacity to coordinate and follow-up the developments
Testing, Quality and Support competence
Scripting skills is a plus
Preliminary knowledge of GEM IS applications (including for example Bluesnake, Meteor, short term power ecosystem‚Ä¶) would be a plus


Soft skills:

Interactive behavior : Active Listening and communication skills
Problem solving : Issues perception, analyzing, practical thinking, creativity, innovation
Personal effectiveness : Facilitation skills, pragmatism and pro-activity, resilience to stress, taking initiative, learning ability
Note : A training will be required in Brussels/Paris at the beginning to be trained on the system have a first contact with the teams in charge of support, infrastructure and development.


Languages:

Fluent English and Spanish.

Descripci√≥n:
About

We want to let you know more about us and our project, but first we're going to share with you a little bit of our history

At Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, we are in the midst of a digital transformation and international expansion process. To achieve this, we are recruiting a team of great professionals, who love technology, innovation, the digital world and of course achieving great challenges. Sounds good.

We were born in 1994 as pioneers in digital banking and since then we have worked to innovate every day. Proof of this is that we launched the first native application for iPad and implemented WhatsApp as a way of communicating with our users. We currently have more than 1 million customers who have placed their trust in us, and that is why we take care of the quality and security of all our services. In 2017 we launched a new web and app platform, using the latest cloud-based technology and with an API layer for all services. That same year we created Open Digital Services (ODS), our technology subsidiary, to recruit the team that would help us achieve our greatest challenge: international growth and technological development. Today, we are developing our Core Banking and have already landed in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal, and will soon land in Argentina.

As you can see, we haven‚Äôt stopped growing and innovating, working in a start-up format, using agile methodologies and making use of the latest technologies. We work with AWS, Microservices Architecture, Mobile Development (iOS and Android) and Big Data Ecosystems among others. Our goal is to take our users' experience to the next level. We are a flexible and fast adapting team, able to work with displaced teams and with a culture that makes us different. We have social and diversity clubs, such as our Padel or LGTBI+ Club and we have more than 30 different nationalities which allows us to have a multicultural and changing environment.

Now that you know us a little better... Would you like to join our ODS team and grow with us?

We are waiting for you!

Mission

We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our Customer Solutions Team. You will work alongside other business analysts and report directly to the project manager. Your main tasks will include defining detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes and customer journeys, and performing user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to translate difficult concepts to non-technical users

Responsabilities
Evaluating customer journeys and business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest fintech and IT advancements to modernize our digital channels.
Conducting meetings and presentations to trace projects evolution.
Performing requirements analysis.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.

Qualifications

Experience and knowledge:
A bachelor‚Äôs degree in business or related field.
A minimum of 1-2 years experience in digital business analysis or a related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Excellent documentation skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.

Descripci√≥n:
Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

Do you want to bring science and craft to the art of pricing and promotion optimization? We are crafting this dedicated role to work with our 20+ Pricing & Promotion team members and the different country organizations to support decision making for price & promotion optimization. We are looking for an experienced analyst that will autonomously generate meaningful, robust insights that teams trust and act on. Join us on this journey!

What You Will Do
Develop insights from multiple data sources and methodologies to distill relevant metrics to measure impact (e.g., customer lifetime value drivers, customer behaviors) understand the impact of opportunities identified through insights tools.
Collaborate with the data product teams who develop productized capabilities (e.g., list price recommender, promotional depth optimizer) as well as the Pricing & Promo embedded specialists (embedded in countries) and help jointly identify relevant metrics for data product success measurement Tell the story of our data products‚Äò performance through meaningful, iterative test & learn agendas using a variety of experimentation techniques (e.g., A/B, pre/post, simulation) and help synthesize insights to deliver recommendations for next steps.
Prototype reusable impact reports in Vistaprint‚Äôs infrastructure (e.g., Looker, Optimizely) to oversee trends and drivers and enable non-technical users to get easy access to impact metrics
Bring novel and untested ideas to the table to constantly innovate how we define and measure success of our work for customers and the business

Your Qualifications
Proficient in SQL. Experience with visualization tools (either Tableau, Looker, Power Bi
You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques
Demonstrated ability in handling sophisticated problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to determine solutions.
Excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners

Nice To Have
Python and/ or R are a plus
Web analytic tools (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)
E commerce experience

Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don‚Äôt see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey - and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what‚Äôs next, we‚Äôre always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we‚Äôre capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Descripci√≥n:
As an Application Security Monitoring Specialist you will join a highly motivated and open team in the Siemens Cyber Defense Center (CDC) to create custom attack detection concepts for applications with especially high protection requirements operated in Siemens in order to enhance the detection capabilities of CDC's company-wide threat detection service and to keep Siemens secure.

What are my responsibilities?

Lead and support customer projects to onboard new applications into CDC's application monitoring service.
Derive the most relevant attacks for the applications by analyzing application architectures, workloads, purpose, protection concepts, audit findings etc.
Based on that, design suiting detection concepts on top of CDC‚Äôs company-wide detection service and consult the CDC SecDevOps team to implement these detection concepts.
Tune and enhance the detection concepts to production quality (e.g. regarding detection accuracy, alert handling effort etc).
Brief the CDC Security Analyst team to understand the new alert types resulting from the detection concepts and required follow-up actions.
Work closely together with customers during the projects (especially application operations and security teams) to come up with suiting detection use cases and assure proper handling and escalation of resulting alerts that go directly to customers instead of the CDC Security Analyst team.
Support continuous service improvement through own initiative and collaboration with other CDC teams to enhance CDC‚Äôs detection capabilities (like the AI/Data Science team, SecDevOps team, Threat Hunting team, and Security Analyst team).



What do I need to qualify for this job?

University degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science, IT security, or related fields.
Experience with related threat detection and analysis technology like splunk (ES/UBA), Exabeam (UEBA), Wazuh etc.
Solid and proven knowledge in custom threat detection and creation of application-specific threat detection concepts and detection use cases.
Good understanding of the cyber security landscape, TTPs, and related initiatives like MITRE ATT&CK, SIGMA, OSSEM, HELK, OWASP.
Overall experience in security monitoring/security operations center environments (SOCs) investigating security events, threat hunting, handling incidents, threats and/or vulnerabilities.
Proficient in written and spoken English, good interpersonal skills, attention to details, and experience with customer projects.

Diversity at Siemens is our source of creativity and innovation. Having different types of talent and experience makes us more competitive and better able to respond successfully to society's demands. That's why we value candidates who reflect the diversity we enjoy in Siemens.

Curious about our Cybersecurity hubs? The Siemens Lisbon Tech Hub has more than 700 employees with the Corporate Technology Cybersecurity team, making it one of the largest in Europe - check it out: https://www.siemens.com/pt/en/home/company/hr/jobs/lisbontechhub.html

Job Purpose
The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes. She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyze information and make recommendations. An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

The team is also responsible for roll-out Cloud solutions to all Tech Data entities in Europe (21 countries +). The team will collaborate with all of Tech Data's Business Unit leaders and their key partners, to develop the right strategies, and strive to deliver best in class systems with maximum impact and synergy across Europe.
Responsibilities:
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies.
Create process maps and document key business requirements needed to evaluate opportunities.
Create value stream maps to identify and highlight potential areas of improvement.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional / cross-organization meetings between stakeholders on various end-to-end business processes.
Conduct root cause analysis of process inefficiencies by examining material flow, scheduling, production capacity, constraints.
Document Operational ‚ÄúAs-is‚Äù processes and the desired ‚ÄúFuture State‚Äù processes.
Define SLAs and measure results.
Deploy new operational processes and escalate them as needed.
Maintain, manage and constantly improve central processes
Document all process accordingly: Ensure all necessary procedures and management processes are implemented to guarantee homogeneous and up-to-standard across locations within regional scope.
Ensure appropriate training and self‚Äìactualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Knowledge Skills and Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Solid understanding of eCommerce
Knowledge of finance and accounting processes is a plus.
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international results driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful

Descripci√≥n:
Transcom Worldwide is one of the leading global customer experience companies, supplying local and global clients in multiple markets. With our global footprint and forward-leaning customer experience solutions, we serve our clients via different channels like voice, chat, social media, etc.

An exciting opportunity with this dynamic and fast-growing business awaits the right candidate in the role of Global Reporting Analyst for Business Intelligence and Talent Acquisition/HR department. This role is waiting for someone who is passionate about the data, but also about working in an international busy and dynamic environment and who has the drive to get things done - accurately and precisely!

As our Reporting Analyst, you are responsible for supporting the Global BI and TA/HR Teams in reaching performance targets and constantly improving the Transcom way of recruiting by providing sufficient, broad, and insightful analyses. Sharing and using your knowledge of systems, data presentation methods, insights on results, comparative analyzes in different countries.
 The position will be proactive by developing the TA and HR reporting strategy and setting up accurate measurement matrixes. What we are looking for is someone with a deep knowledge of Talent Acquisition software and BI reporting tools and or dashboards that support management in executing their business decisions with a high amount of precision and consistency. Not only proficiency in data analysis, but also the ease of learning new systems (ATS, etc.), and highly developed communication skills enabling professional presentation of the data and having the ability to cooperate with stakeholders from various levels and positions within the organization are critical components for this role.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Data analytics for Talent Acquisition dashboards and Looker (business intelligence tool),
Develop reporting for executives - data analytics progress + ad hoc reporting,
Proactively measuring, tracking, analyzing, and reporting with actual and historical data, ability to imagine the financial impact on an organization based on delivered data,
SME Recruiting reporting portal focusing on data quality + on-time delivery,
Data gathering and consolidating,
Participating in the ATS selection by covering the data availability/accuracy dimension,
Creates and maintains Daily, Weekly, and Monthly Sourcing and Recruitment reporting, trackers/templates,
Created and maintains TA Dashboards,
Maintains daily Sourcing and Recruitment productivity report, hourly report,
Working hand in hand with HR analytics in analyzing operational figures.

Analysis

In-depth analysis specific to Talent Acquisition,
Examine and questions the contents of the report, and confirms the accuracy of the reports, interprets and provides a summary,
Recommend strategic analysis needed to achieve department and company goals.

Process Improvement

To guide and support the development and deployment of the agreed People ‚Äì Process ‚Äì Technology long-term strategy rollout,
Support Recruitment Process Leads to process improvements and implementation.
Suggest proactively on Reporting improvement areas which include automation,
Support the business in terms of disputes on reporting,
Always meet or exceed commitments when engaged in existing and/or new projects,
Identify value-added opportunities to increase client revenues and work with marketing in their implementation.

Job Requirements:

3-5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position,
At least 2 year(s) of experience with HR Analytical Systems - good to have,
 Bachelor's/University Degree, Others or equivalent.
Experience with Dashboard and metric reporting tools such as Looker (preferred), Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or Domo.
Knowledge of Talent Acquisition systems (ATS), KPIs, and metrics.
MS SQL Server Reporting Services and/or MS SQL Server Analysis Services,
High organization skills and attention to details, being customer-oriented and responsive,
Requires excellent communication skills both written and oral and knows how to create a common ground for your plans with your stakeholders at all levels within the organization,
Presentation skills with the ability to create presentations in PowerPoint,
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, strong process management orientation, systems thinking, and problem-solving capability.
Experience in the BPO industry is a plus

Descripci√≥n:
Thycotic is a global leader in Privileged Access Management, a critical layer of IT security that protects an organization‚Äôs data, devices and code across cloud, on-premise and hybrid environments. Recognized as a leader by every major industry analyst group, our modern cloud-ready PAM solutions dramatically reduce the complexity and cost of securing privileged access, providing more value and higher adoption than any alternative. Thycotic is trusted by over 12,500 leading organizations around the globe including 25% of the Fortune 100.

Position Summary

The market need for cyber security solutions is exploding and we‚Äôre seeking experienced, self-motivated sales executives to join our dynamic team!

Based in our Madrid Office and working remotely, you‚Äôll play a key role on our sales team, managing the full sales cycle from identifying prospects and creating opportunities to qualifying and closing deals with strategic accounts.

This quota-carrying role requires top of the line consultative selling skills and strong experience with sales process. You‚Äôll work with clients both directly and through our channel partners to get our award-winning product suite into the hands of organizations with IT security needs across the region.

This position requires extensive travel to client sites in the territory.

With our strong promote-from-within philosophy, successful performance in this role will provide career advancement opportunities to those seeking to take their professional sales careers to the next level.

Key Responsibilities
Find, cultivate and close deals!
Research strategic accounts and establish relationships with influencers in the region.
Lead discovery and qualification discussions to uncover needs and recommend solutions.
Engage the right Thycotic technical experts to provide the prospect with an accurate and compelling story on our products‚Äô strengths and capabilities.
Collaborate with Channel sales team to cultivate partner relationships and engage in large partner deals.
Accurately forecast monthly and quarterly pipeline and consistently meet/exceed sales targets.
Never stop learning! Constantly stay current with industry changes and trends and build your expertise in Cybersecurity.

Required Skills
Experience selling IT Security software sales executive selling to a corporate IT audience.
Experience cultivating and controlling complex sales cycles with audiences of multiple stakeholders in enterprise organizations.
Proficiency with high volume prospecting and creating net new business.
Comfort in diagnosing problems to C-level people and selling value proposition.

Your role

As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your main responsibilities will involve

Develop analytical, regulatory and operational reports using SAP Business Objects, BEX, SAP Analysis for Office, Microsoft Power BI and other analytical tools

Your Skills And Experience

TheFork, a TripAdvisor¬Æ Company is the leading online restaurants reservation platform in Europe, Australia and Latin America, with a network of more than 80,000 restaurants worldwide, more than 30.5 million monthly visits and present in 22+ countries around the globe.

TheFork connects restaurants and diners.

Through TheFork (website and application), as well as through TripAdvisor, users can easily select a restaurant according to preference criteria (such as the localisation, type of cuisine, restaurant type and average price), consult user reviews, check real-time availability and instantly book online.

From the restaurants‚Äô side, TheFork provides them with a software solution, TheFork Manager, which enables restaurants to optimize reservations management, streamline operations and ultimately improve service and revenues.

TheFork team aims to inspire and enable people to confidently discover, experience and share food. We strongly believe that building a diverse workforce of people from all walks of life helps us have a richer, more vibrant, more successful workplace.

Manage and prioritize efforts & projects to reduce the irritants generated by and to b2c & b2b users (diners & restaurants), by efficiently running and coordinating global projects.

Job Title: Interim / Contractor Business Analyst
Location : Barcelona (flexible)


About the company

IWG is the global operator of leading workspace providers. Our companies help more than 2.5 million people and their businesses to work more productively. We do so by providing a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services.
Digitalization and new technologies are transforming the world of work. People want the personal productivity benefits of living and working how and where they want. Businesses want the financial and strategic benefits. Our customers are start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises, and large multinationals. With unique business goals, people and aspirations. They want workspaces and communities to match their needs. They want choice.
Through our companies we provide that choice, and serve the whole world of work: Regus, Spaces, No18, HQ and Signature. We create personal, financial and strategic value for businesses of every size. From some of the most exciting companies and well-known organizations on the planet, to individuals and the next generation of industry leaders. All of them harness the power of flexible working to increase their productivity, efficiency, agility and market proximity.
Join us at www.iwgplc.com.


Responsibilities:

We are seeking interim Business Analysts to build a detailed view of what is coming next in the business and get these ideas delivered. To understand and anticipate what the business is thinking about and who needs to be involved to get things produced. It‚Äôs a highly influential role and is exposed to advanced business and technology concepts (early on).

Develops quality and well-structured pragmatic specifications (coordinating across teams where relevant).
Guides the idea owner through the development process, review progress at set stages, ensure simplicity, lead well thought through solutions, deliver specifications on time and always question and check that the idea is being designed in the best possible way (Overall Solution, Simplicity, Quality, Optimal UX, Design, Third Party Integration, Speed of Delivery etc‚Ä¶)
Works with PMs and System Owners to plan delivery dates
Schedules and runs demos for new features and capabilities
Maintains all documentation in our different documentation tools
Supports post-go live issues management and escalations (via support team)
Maintains deep system and business knowledge.

Qualifications/Experience:

Specific Business Analyst training or certifications
Extensive IT Experience
Specific Business Analyst training or certifications
Understanding of Software Development, System design, Digital, Web, Mobile, UX standards, solutioning and specification
Agile software development (how specifications are written using Agile)
Experience working with Executive and C-Level Mgt
Working with and interfacing to global delivery teams
Proven experience managing agile methodologies delivering business value IT Solutions
Ability to deliver results on time and to the very highest standards.
Ability to quickly gain the required business acumen and technical, behavioural and contextual elements of a project.
Running large and small-scale projects.
Key /technology understanding, how to manage Technology teams and discussion with SMEs in IT
Excellent English communication and executive level presentation skills

Role

The roles that we are looking for to take part in this program are

Nucleus program is driving Vodafone into the smart use of information, by building a platform based on advanced analytics along with Google that marks a milestone in terms of technology within the market. Nucleus will be based on Google Cloud Platform (Cloud Composser, Big Query, Data Studio) and it will be the biggest platform in Europe. The team will be working hand in hand with Google's engineers through learning sessions and online meetings.
Data Engineer
Cloud Engineer
Data Modeller
Platform Engineer
Quality Engineer
Data scientist
Scrum Master
Billing Engineer
BI Engineer
Business Analyst
Data Project Manager

Vodafone is incredibly excited about our digital transformation and the enormous potential for progress and innovation it can unlock. There is also a tremendous amount of data that is generated every single second in the networks. This means that we have a vast body of rich information, which if unlocked, can lead to something very special. Whilst Vodafone has already leveraged on premise Big Data and Business Intelligence we now have the vision to build a central Data Ocean as the centre of this digital change. The Data Ocean‚Äôs raison d'etre is to improve: To support the business in unlocking its potential; to better serve Vodafone‚Äôs customers and to create opportunities for social good. Underpinning the delivery of Vodafone‚Äôs Data Ocean capability is a significant investment in transformation programmes to achieve this radical change. Corporate Information Systems Analytics and Data leads the design, delivery and operation of all Big Data platforms and applications for both Group and Operating Companies (OpCo‚Äôs). For our trip we have decided that Google will join us, working together with them building a new advanced analytical data platform that does not exist in the market today. If you are a dynamic person, passionate about our technologies and attracted to the world of Big Data, we are looking forward to having you in our global team.

To Be Part Of The Team The Requirements Are
Advanced English level.
Be a proactive and non-conformist person.
Have to gain from learning and improving day by day.
Good teammate and be a hard worker.
Be an open person, someone who knows how to listen and build solutions cooperatively.
Knowledge in the world of data (Big Data, EDW, BI, ETL, Cloud, etc.)
Be data driven and have a data intelligence background.
At Vodafone we are concerned about being a company committed to diversity as an engine of change. We are proud to offer equal opportunities regardless of race, nationality, cultural origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and religious or political beliefs.

This is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At the company, we believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and we are as passionate about our lives as we are about our work. 
 The area: Global Affairs- Government Affairs and Public Policy 

As a member of the company‚Äôs Government Affairs and Public Policy team, you'll be part of a diverse global government affairs team, working across regions, product areas, and functions. You‚Äôll combine creativity and intellectual rigor with the organizational skills to manage various campaigns, projects and initiatives.
In this role you‚Äôll advocate for the company to bring external perspectives back into the company to inform our perception and direction. You‚Äôre passionate about the opportunity to shape the future of how we use and build technology for everyone.

Scope of job/Responsibilities:
 - You will coordinate regulatory and reputational efforts pertaining to Artificial Intelligence, Tax, Child Safety in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders.

- You will work in a dynamic team in close cooperation with other teams such as PR, Legal, Industry Relations, Marketing, among others.
 Mandatory:

Enviar mensaje InMail
Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar‚Äôs 30,000 people help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow.
 Profiles
Our profiles colleagues are the experts in helping clients connect with people. This includes survey design, sampling, profiling, data integration and activation for programmatic campaigns. Their single access point to 88 million deeply-profiled research-ready respondents enables clients to build rich profiles of their target audience and access immediately actionable data.
 The Role (wider context):
We are looking for a Senior IT Engineer that will become the local expert of a new Audience Measurement platform. The person will be a leader representative for the platform in the Spain‚Äôs market. High motivation, analytical mindset, and a high ability to communicate with many different teams are the key aptitudes to progress successfully in this position. He/she will be accountable for the correct functioning of the Platform and will be in continuous collaboration with our Central team in London to inform about the particular necessities of the market and thus collaborate in the evolution and modernisation of the platform. This role is also accountable of providing a first-level support service with a critical impact on the delivery to our clients.
 Mission (the sell):
We are embarking on a new exciting challenge to align our legacy Audience platform to a global Kantar platform.
While we are in the final stage of the migration process, we need someone that starts collaborating in the transition and helping us to mitigate the impact on our clients, adapting the particularities of Spain to the new system.
The person will drive all the requests coming from the Operations and Market teams to the Central team and will articulate the best solution in each case.
A challenging position within a fast growing, dynamic and innovative company working in an international role. The opportunity allows for growth and choice in a new and exciting career path
Transforming our Audience Measurement platform is one of the Kantar global strategic initiatives to move towards a new age in the field of the Digital Audience Measurement.
 KEY OUTCOMES
Acquire the knowledge of Atria at expert level
Help on the transition from Comtel to Atria
Response to any incident during the daily operation
Discuss, propose and eventually develop solutions in the Atria platform that can resolve particularities in Spain's market
Interface with the Central Team in London
Contribute to the evolution of the Platform in the Cloud

Long experience in Linux systems
High knowledge of Oracle Database and SQL language.
Analytical skills.
Big Data landscape: experience in Spark.
Cloud technologies ‚Äì Azure, DataBricks, Docker / Containers, Kubernetes.
Programming languages: C, Python, Java and Cobol (valuable)
High level of English (spoken)
High ability to cope with a steeped learning curve
Ability to read and understand "tones" of scripts and components
Interactivity with a great variety of teams
High motivation to contribute to a strategic project
Availability out of working time to support the Atria system
 JOIN US

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.
 We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that‚Äôs out of the ordinary and join us.
 At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst

About The Job

Our opportunity Are you passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a motivated team and help us make a difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world's leading insurance groups!

In this role as a Reporting Business Analyst / Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the " Analytics and Reporting " team within Group Investment Management.

You will collaborate closely with IT functions and a diverse range of end user in different countries and translate their analytical and reporting needs into requirements and solutions.

Responsibilities

Your role As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your main responsibilities will involve Develop analytical, regulatory and operational reports using SAP Business Objects, BEX, SAP Analysis for Office, Microsoft Power BI and other analytical tools
Maintain key business applications (based on SAP/BW, BW4/HANA) and support/lead new business initiatives
Perform impact analysis of application changes, holding an end-to-end view of the system
Support the continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure
Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs
Run requirement gathering workshops; create requirements documents and design concepts
Ensure compliance and data quality

Your Skills And Experience As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
Minimum 5 years of experience as a business analyst/ business intelligence specialist
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or equivalent
Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, data analytics, query design, modelling and reporting front-end tools
Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g. analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Basic knowledge of financial processes and investment instruments are a plu
Knowledge of SAP FSCM-FAM is a plus
Spanish language skill is a plus


Technical Knowledge
Strong skills in SAP/BW & SAP BW4/HANA, Query Design, SAP front-end tools
Advanced skills in modern Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PBI)
Data analysis skills in R/Python are a strong plus

Additional Information
Primary work location is Barcelona. This position requires some light traveling. You can apply by clicking on the button "Apply online"

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Life Insurance
Exclusive employee discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depends on the business needs

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Are you currently studying and looking for an internship experience within an international company and market leader? It's time to put theory into practice - and there's nowhere better to do so than in our pioneering and solutions-driven environment.

This is your opportunity to join our team as an Intern, and gain experience working in a Customer Service & Support Operations environment with highly experienced professionals. Under the supervision of the Agilent EMEAI Quality Manager, you will contribute to the evolution of the Quality Management System (QMS) for the Support Organisation.

As an Intern, you will be assisting/ supporting the team in the following activities:
Maintain our Quality documentation updated and support potential document system/ repository-migration,
Facilitate access to Quality documentation for our Engineers,
Expand Quality documents to other Business areas

This internship opportunity can be based in the following locations: Barcelona/ Madrid (Spain), Waldbronn/ Karlsruhe (Germany), Paris (France), or potentially Manchester (UK).
The internship should ideally be in full-time dedication (negotiable), for a duration of 6 months (or longer).

Who Are We Looking For

We are looking for an aspiring student with a strong work ethic, studying towards an academic degree in a relevant field, including (but not limited to) business studies or engineering, or other engineering fields. Even more critical than your area of studies is an interest in Quality Management Systems. Ideally, you are in your last 1-2 years of studies.

To be successful in your internship, you would also ideally need to be/ have:
Organized, self-motivated, able to manage priorities & to work independently
Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills along with written and oral communication skills
Potentially already a basic understanding of Quality Management System (ISO 9001:2015 typically)
Potentially already familiar with understanding and application of appropriate quality improvement process methodology
Able to collaborate across organizational boundaries
Strong in quantitative data analysis skills
Easy with tools like Microsoft suite, Qlik, SAP, etc.

If you are highly motivated and results oriented, then we are the perfect partner.
Agilent is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Interested?
We are looking forward your application! Please, complete the application process online.
The position will remain open for applications until a suitable candidate has been identified.

For any questions on the application or selection process, please contact our recruitment colleague, Ms. Cecilia Bengtsson (cecilia.bengtsson@non.agilent.com).

Media Markt, the leader multinational in consumer electronics company, is looking for a Senior web analyst to join our e-Commerce team located in Head Quarters of El Prat de Llobregat.

The Web Analyst role evolves around data; implementing and setting specifications for tracking of data, creating data reports, and working out the best ways to visualize data. The Web Analyst use data analytics to troubleshoot the website's design, with the aim of increasing page views, improving the user experience, and converting more visitors into customers. Furthermore, the Web Analyst use advanced analytics to produce concrete improvement suggestions for better decision making for e-commerce

Main Responsabilities
Using a variety of tools to extract and analyze data generated by online user activity
Reporting findings with data visualizations that are easy to understand
Communicating insights and providing solutions that have demonstrable results
Working with web development and marketing teams to implement solutions
Understanding the behavior and expectations of online visitors
Staying up to date with the latest trends in online marketing and design
Requisitos

Experience with data analysis tools and languages like Google Analytics, Excel/Google Sheets, Big Query, and SQL
Experience with tools like Hotjar, Contentsquare, VWO, Smartlook, Crazy Egg etc
Skills and experience with tag management systems like Google Tag Manager
Develop hypotheses based on insights from GA analysis, heatmaps and user testing data
Understanding of CRO process and values
Skills in Data Visualization (Google Data Studio)
Basic knowledge about A/B testing
Your Profile
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
Detail-oriented with strong knowledge of data analysis and interest in data science methods
A critical thinker, customer focused, solution oriented and data-driven, instead of gut-driven
Good time-management and the ability to be flexible with your tasks and responsibilities
A business mindset and understanding, as well as the know-how that a better user experience can bring more value
A team player, with the capability to work cross-functionally and excited to share your experiences and knowledge with your colleagues
Confident to work with analysis development both individually and within your team

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life‚Äôs milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

This Data Analyst will work with the Ads & Growth team at TKWW. They will help the team understand performance by developing analytical tools and performing ad-hoc analysis. They will assist with product testing, modeling, data investigations, and visualizations. They will be a valued partner and trusted advisor.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and product engagement
Identify key trends and areas of opportunity for product and business teams
Help provide data and insights to drive up revenue mix by investigating and optimizing the funnel
Assist with setting up, conducting, and interpreting outcomes of A/B testing and other forms of experimentation
Create and manage reports and data assets in dashboarding tools like Metabase, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the team apprised of key trends
Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
Explore novel ways to look at our data
Assist with development of metrics and goals

SUCCESSFUL DATA ANALYST CANDIDATES HAVE:

Background working within a team in a data-driven environment
SQL and database experience
Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery or other event tracking
Experience with financial modeling
2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
Excellent communication and project management skills
You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
Proficiency with R or Python is a plus

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn‚Äôt right, you say something.
You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.
You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.
You aren‚Äôt afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there‚Äôs no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.

Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

We are looking for a talented, energetic and detailed oriented intern, to join our Analytics team in Barcelona. This 6-month internship is an incredible opportunity to understand better the Ad tech industry and contribute to very impactful analysis for our business.

What you'll do
Advertiser Analysis and Optimization
Analyzing complex data from multiple sources, youll learn how to detect problems with the performance of our campaigns, and suggest improvements that will have immediate impact
Reporting tools and metrics
Youll use your knowledge of our system to develop reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business
Technical studies and analysis
You will work on ad hoc projects that will inform roadmap for the development of the Criteo Product, and run real world tests on new developments.
Campaign control and oversight
You have responsibility for managing and maintaining the smooth running of our campaigns. This involves making sure our ad server is correctly set up and updated, and validating the setup of new campaigns.
Who you are
You are Fluent in English. A good Spanish proficiency would be nice to have.
You are currently enrolled in a Bsc/Msc in Engineering, Mathematics or any other relevant subject.
You like being involved in problem solving
Ideally, you have good technical skills in SQL and other programming languages (R programming, Python).
Previous international experience will be a plus.
You are interested in analysis and statistics.
You are versatile, dynamic, detailed oriented and data enthusiast!
You have a real interest in online Advertising market and the impact of a high-performance technology in this market.
Why you'll love us
At Criteo, life is full of contagious energy, hard work, passion and the occasional scooter race
Everything at Criteo is driven by their hunger to succeed and fueled by a little bit of madness
Criteo has many perks and quirks
Every office is filled with equal measures of hard work and playfulness. From yoga to rooftop parties, early morning kale smoothies to late night karaoke sessions we do it all, together!
Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Job Brief

Tropicfeel does more than travel gear. It‚Äôs a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be achieved.

We look for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. Our culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders, and visionaries. At Tropicfeel, it‚Äôs about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Are you looking for a career where you can innovate, fail, learn and GROW! If that‚Äôs your case, Glovo is your place. Glovo is amongst the highest growing startups in the world and expanding very fast.

You will be a key member in the Commercial Intelligence Team, working hand-by-hand with Global Commercial, Regional and Head of Sales and AMs of each different market. At Glovo, it is in our DNA to do more with less and your job will be to optimize the sales department across all regions.

Glovo is a hyperlocal marketplace featuring the most trendy places in each city, and delivers their products in less than 45 mins. The Sales team is directly responsible for partnering with both local stores and with bigger brands to display them in the Glovo platform.

What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo

We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. Company Description

At Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing we‚Äôre part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.

Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the world‚Äôs most recognized brands.

As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.

Our teams are based in some of the world‚Äôs most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 48 different nationalities.

And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.

Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)

What Makes Us Smile, When Looking At Your Profile‚Ä¶
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)

Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

Additional Information

At Netcentric You Get
Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
