We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors in some of tech‚Äôs most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the travel industry.

We‚Äôve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

If you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are searching for a world class individual to join our Strategic Planning and Analysis team, reporting to our Head of Corporate SP&A. We are seeking someone who has proven modelling skills, and can translate complex analysis into impactful insight.

Role

Our role is to inform and drive some of Travelperk‚Äôs most important business decisions by

We are a dynamic Strategic Planning and Analysis team that enjoy solving the business challenges that come with rapid scaling. Our goal is to grow Travelperk as fast as possible, but in an efficient way.
Providing data driven insight and connection across multiple functions, segmenting by time (quarter, year, multi-year), and among varying levels of data (high-level external metrics to detailed operational indicators).
Linking that context directly to our corporate and business strategy.
Objectively assessing the impact of the decision on our business.

Do you have an analytical mind? Are you good storytelling? Let¬¥s talk!

What You Will Do
Use of best practice techniques to design 3 statement financial models, with multi-year scenario planning
10X our performance reporting capability in order to bring impactful and actionable insight to decision making across TravelPerk
Creating and explaining analysis for C-Level and other stakeholders. This will require experience in presenting at exec and senior manager level, as well as to the board, highlighting an ability to simplify high level details into digestible summary and actions
Working closely with our accounting and data science teams to ensure accurate and robust actual data and forecast
Cultivate and foster strong cross-functional relationships and collaboration across the company
Promote Travelperk‚Äôs brand and values in a friendly, professional manner


Who You Are
5 years post qualified experience, made up of the FinTech and SaaS sectors.
Experience in business travel a big bonus but not essential
High-performing track record in a top technology/software company, where involvement in financial analysis and modelling has been of fundamental importance
Slide creation and ability to tell a compelling story, through the eyes of the different readers
Advanced Excel, Powerpoint, SQL and VBA experience
You are curious and will take ownership of a task/project/action
You are tech savvy. You love the world of tech. You know what is going on in the market. You use tech at home and at work to make life easier and constantly looking for cutting edge technology to help & automate processes
Role can be based in Barcelona or London, with an element of business travel required for the role

What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain or 25 in the UK
Flexibility to work from home most of the time
Health perks, these vary depending on your location (private healthcare in Spain & UK)
A "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary

Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain or UK for this position
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona or London once per week
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up 3-5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event
We have core working hours between 10:30-16:30 CET
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!

We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office.

Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base‚Äîand we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer, which means you‚Äôre welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you‚Äôre from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

Role: Global Salesforce Analyst and Developer Cost Price and Quote (CPQ) M/F/D

Your Challenge

After a tailored learning programme, the Global Salesforce Analyst & Developer CPQ is an outstanding opportunity to support the Videojet Sales organization. With specific focus on our quoting tool, your work will directly create positive impact on process efficiency, drive revenue, margin growth and improve the experience of the Videojet‚Äôs customers and associates. This will be achieved by supporting leadership-led initiatives to develop these enhancements.

Western Europe Videojet locations, for all these locations we offer ‚ÄúWork from Home‚Äù flexibility.

Your responsibilities as Global Analyst Salesforce at Videojet, include:

Application Development
Translate business requirements into technical specifications while incorporating systematic constraints and balancing cost-reward relationship
Develop new features and enhance existing features to increase the functionality of the Salesforce quoting tool and other Sales system environments
Suggest and drive logic-based business rules, email alerts and process flows to support increased automation initiatives
Understand the user‚Äôs experience and predict use-cases to architect and implement usable solutions across multiple sales organization, systems and tools

Application Support
Manage and provide technical & software support for the sales (mobile) users for the Salesforce.com quoting tool and other commercial applications
Develop and implement reporting mechanisms for key business metrics and provide analytical support to Business Stakeholders in order to identify and capture sales growth opportunities
Provide general Salesforce and Applications‚Äô support for non-mobile sales users

Application Administration
Develop and/or enhance Standard Work Documentation and Auditing activities ( data collections, data integrity, and data compliance)
Manage the set-up, on-boarding, and training of new Quoting users, sales managers and product or managers
Analyse and optimize sales systems-related applications for both Customers (Portals) and Associates in relation to the quoting ecosystem

Basic Qualifications :
Fluency in both written and spoken English.
+4 years experience as Salesforce business analyst and configuration
+2 years experience SF CPQ configuration

Preferred qualifications:
Command of additional European languages

Our offer

Being part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important.

It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals.

You will work in a leading global company, with a Manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself!

About Us

Videojet Technologies, Inc. is the global leader in the manufacturing of coding, printing and marking products. This high technology product prints variable information, such as expiration dates on grocery products, packaged goods, pharmaceuticals or catalogues. Our industry is pivotal in ensuring end users consume their food, beverage and pharmaceutical products safety. As the market share leader, we have operations in over 30 countries with 4,000 employees worldwide. A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (www.danaher.com), Videojet is the core of the $1 billion Product Identification Platform. We offer a results-oriented environment that is multicultural organisation that promotes both diversity and inclusion through the full organisation, team-cantered, customer focused and quality-focused, guided by the successful Danaher Business System. Working at Videojet, gives you access to a robust career development process and exciting opportunities.

Our Core Values

We empower creativity and unconventional thinking to help us uncover breakthrough solutions and accelerate the pace of innovation. We believe with conviction that diversity helps us uncover more powerful customer insights and ultimately creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. And we would love to have you on this journey with us!

Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. Data and Analytics at Vistaprint

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all passionate about providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do
Be immersed in diverse teams (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to drive marketing efficiency in our advertising and improve the customer experience to acquire valuable customers and promote repeat shopping behavior.
Design and execute a/b/n tests to optimize the customer experience and analyse results to provide insightful recommendations to the business. Experience with Optimizely a plus.
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.

Your Qualifications
Passionate about data and technology. You have experience in SQL. Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R) are a plus. Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics) a plus.
Inquisitive by nature. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker is a plus.
A resourceful and driven problem solver. You enjoy and/or have demonstrated ability tackling complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to identify solutions. You have excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Team-minded and versatile. You have experience and an interest in partnering with multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives. You are open to creative approaches to solving problems.
Experienced. 0 to 3+ years in an analytics environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.

Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here

At Vistaprint, we put phenomenal importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include language courses, flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, ‚ÄúVistabreak‚Äù, Summer hours and Public Holidays, to name a few!

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

Your Tasks  

You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills. 
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.

Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)

Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)

Motivation to work in a distributed, international team

A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

Descripci√≥n:
Who We Are

Our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere ‚Äî every person, every organization, and every community around the globe. This motivates us ‚Äî inspires us ‚Äî to do what we do. To make what we make. To invent, and to reinvent. To engineer experiences that amaze. We won‚Äôt stop pushing ahead, because you won‚Äôt stop pushing ahead. You‚Äôre reinventing how you work. How you play. How you live. With our technology, you‚Äôll reinvent your world

What We Offer
Exciting experience with data science‚Äôs and analytics‚Äô hottest topics: HP‚Äôs Analytics team is covering wide range of exciting, fast-growing and business critical areas such as: Big data SKU level pricing (in a space of millions of transactions), SEM/Display optimization in the world‚Äôs leading channels platforms (e.g. Google, Amazon, JD‚Ä¶) and predictive analytics in the area of sales management (which accounts to target, with what offer ‚Ä¶)
Career building platform- HP‚Äôs analytics team has a global footprint, offering many possibilities to advance one‚Äôs career
International, collaborative and dynamic team - We are a dynamic, highly skilled and diverse global team consisting of economists, consultants, marketers, statisticians, engineers, scientists and even musicians, united by the passion to create impact using technology

Responsibilities
Under minimal direction, formulate and define system scope and objectives based on both user needs and a good understanding of information technology, business processes, and industry requirements.
Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using advanced communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate client requirements.
Apply extensive knowledge of the client's business and industry to develop requirements specifications.
Document requirements, and translate into proper system requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.
Develop visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.
Execute and coordinate requirements management and change management processes.
Develop and maintain internal and external relationships to support management of scope and expectations.
Participate in proposals, feasibility studies, implementations, and new business development.
Operates as a team member and as a team leader. Advise on methods to improve business processes.
Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment.
May lead the training of clients and peers.
Oversees production and delivery of analytic deliverables, and sets expectations with key business stakeholders.
Collaborates with team members to establish analytic methodology; manages and prioritizes A/B and multivariate testing projects.
Use of advanced statistical information and models to predict the outcome of proposed projects and provide data-driven recommendations to ensure successful execution.
Manages the implementation, maintenance, accuracy and improvement of digital analytics data, systems, and tools.
Inform site optimization strategies, by proactively providing quantifiable recommendations to drive growth

Education And Experience Required
Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience and a minimum of 6 years related experience or a Master's degree and a minimum of 4 years of experience.

Knowledge And Skills

Join us in our exciting journey..!

If you would like to become a member of our multidisciplinary and international team of highly qualified colleagues and take over your own areas of responsibility, we look forward to receiving your application!

Your tasks;

Native German, very good English language skills.

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona‚Äôs fastest growing Startups ‚Äì helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

The routing team mission is to provide accurate, reliable and business-driven estimations around the logistics of each order in real time, contributing to a top-class user experience and to maximize the efficiency of the fleet. Engineers, data scientists and data analysts work together to develop and productionalize machine learning models, explore and roll-out new features, and to solve complex problems through the means of data.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

About The Job

Our opportunity Are you passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a motivated team and help us make a difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world's leading insurance groups!

In this role as a Reporting Business Analyst / Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the " Analytics and Reporting " team within Group Investment Management.

You will collaborate closely with IT functions and a diverse range of end user in different countries and translate their analytical and reporting needs into requirements and solutions.

Responsibilities

Maintain key business applications (based on SAP/BW, BW4/HANA) and support/lead new business initiatives

Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs
Run requirement gathering workshops; create requirements documents and design concepts
Ensure compliance and data quality

Your Skills And Experience As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
Minimum 5 years of experience as a business analyst/ business intelligence specialist

Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, data analytics, query design, modelling and reporting front-end tools
Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g. analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Basic knowledge of financial processes and investment instruments are a plu
Knowledge of SAP FSCM-FAM is a plus
Spanish language skill is a plus


Technical Knowledge
Strong skills in SAP/BW & SAP BW4/HANA, Query Design, SAP front-end tools

Data analysis skills in R/Python are a strong plus

Additional Information

Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Building an advertising platform that answers our client marketing objectives requires strong product managers and great software developers, but it also demands excellence from the commercial and operations teams. To connect both product and operational worlds, Criteo can count on Product Experts whose goals are to ensure that products are best brought to market, correspond to client expectations and that their revenue grows.

The Creative Product Expertise team is, therefore, co-accountable for the customer success and growth of our products, with a particular mandate over the management of creative and analytical knowledge across our field operations teams as well as the collection of market feedback. As part of the Global Operations team, members build a relationship and have a direct line with product management and field operations, granting them great autonomy to influence the full cycle of a products life.

Every day, you will

Develop understanding and in-depth knowledge of the Criteos Creative Product, including technical inner workings of products, their business functionality and performance, their managed and self-service controls and best practices, and our product improvement strategy and roadmap.

Review the product line strategy, the Creative product roadmap and the R&Ds objectives and key results (OKRs),

Attend and participate in recurring discussions with Product Management, Product Analytics and other internal groups,

Assist Product Management in the writing of technical documentations in a way that is broadly digestible,

Dig into technical specifications and data models to get a complete understanding of the products underlying architecture.

Act as an analytical expert as well as a Creative product evangelist, providing support and opportunities to field creative consultants (CS), field analytics (AX), and advertising operations (AdOps) teams in order to converge toward the most successful use and extension of our Creative products.

Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, responding to business/creative product priorities.

Leverage your expertise to deliver actionable insights to the field.

Prepare operations team with trainings, processes and tools to build a product expertise on the field (i.e., in all our markets),

Collect and answer creative and analytical questions in a way that contributes to maintaining a global expertise,

Monitor, fix or escalate technical issues around existing creative product reports to maintain their performance,

Exchange and debate the need of new features that contribute to customer success and revenue,

Identify data storytelling opportunities that could solidify our products position on the market.

Become a trusted advisor to our product managers and product solutions strategists, best connecting our client marketing objectives with our services, increasing customer success and participating in the rollout, growth and maturity of products.

Challenge the roadmap to ensure that our products are performing and run smoothly,

Job Description

Purpose of the role
PepsiCo is a leading food and beverage company in Europe, with presence across many complex markets where we have a broad range of categories and products. This very successful business is launching a multi-year business transformation program which is relying on an SAP S4 backbone and other integrated strategic solutions being rolled out. The purpose of this role is to lead the SAP S4 data design and data conversion for the value stream Order to Cash (OTC) as part of Europe template deployment.

Our first program deployment is focusing on our UK and Poland business units with a project office near London, while our teams are based across multiple hubs around Europe and the World. The team consist of functional experts, business analyst and development/integration experts as well as vendor partners, consultants and internal/external service groups

The broader team
We are a diverse multi-cultural group of excited and purpose-driven professionals located across Europe, driving business transformation and collaborate across teams and functions. Our projects are often complex and challenging but always business driven and cross-functional. Our core values include transparency, inclusion, trust and to deliver as a team. We are agile, with a positive and innovative mindset and we find important to keep each-other energized and to have some fun on the journey.
The ideal Candidate
You drive your agenda with passion and pride, inspiring team members to grow. You set the agenda and embrace risks and ambiguity that comes from complex problems and the broader matrixed organization and continuously find mitigations and solutions to succeed. You set an example within your team with your own personal growth and you even influence peers and other teams with your proactivity and coaching approach. You can get things done with an effective combination of formal and informal collaboration across the organization. You have a sense of humour and you‚Äôre not afraid of using it.

Further Details of the role

Relationships
Reports to the SAP Business Data Lead
Works closely with project IT, Business and Value Streams
Partners with SAP Global Template teams
Partners and closely collaborates with business value stream teams
Deliverables:
Senior SAP Data Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting the Data Collection and Cleaning activities working closely with Business and Project Team (Process Leads and Data Migration Team)
Oversees and ensures delivery of all aspects of QM and EAM data objects: data readiness, data quality issue resolution
Ensures compliance with SAP Global Template Data standards for business process areas: Quality Management and Enterprise Asset Management
Work with legacy IT system experts to understand legacy data designs
Accountabilities
Lead data readiness activities for respective area
Partner with process leads, migration and conversion team
Work with the Data Conversion & Readiness team to review results of legacy data profiling to identify data cleansing opportunities and optimized approach for cleansing
Supports data quality issue resolution during testing and migration activities
Ensure data is fit for purpose and aligned to business needs and PGT Design

Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum of 5 years of experience supporting or deploying SAP ERP (ECC or S/4) implementations, with a strong focus on the QM and EAM Value Stream area
Good understanding of following business process areas: Quality Inspections Processes, Plant Maintenance Process
Good understanding of Data Objects in QM Area: Inspection Plans, MICs, QMIR, Inspection Methods
Good understanding of Data Objects in EAM Area: Functional Locations, Measurement Points, Equipment BOM, Tasks etc
Strong analytical skills, as shown by the advanced use of data analysis tools and concepts, such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Data Migration (ie: LSMW, Hana Cockpit)
Previous experiences of ERP Data analysis, Data Cleansing and migration activities is a must
Ability to understand complex data requirements, and be able to identify and offer multiple solution options to facilitate the best outcome (e.g. automated transformation vs. manual enrichment)
Strong influencing, facilitating, and consulting skills in working with stakeholders at all levels in the organization and across departments
Excellent oral and written skills to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts, and provide clear documentation to the management and project leadership
Service oriented attitude balanced with ‚Äúdoing what is right for the project/business‚Äù, even if that is not a popular decision.
Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences, deal with ambiguity, and succeed against in a high-pressure environment
Knowledge and experience in the Agile Methodology and related tools (such as MS Azure DevOps) desired
Ability to work flexible hours based on varying business requirements
Knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines and processes are nice to have: SAP SolMan 7+ , MS Azure DevOps, HP ALM

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries ‚Äì powered by the world‚Äôs largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world‚Äôs leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD‚Äôs in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture‚Äôs business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client‚Äôs needs.

Data Engineer role

Introduction

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts

Puesto ofertado: Senior Analyst - Financial Planning and Analysis
Sector: Veterinaria
Descripci√≥n:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Finance Manager COE is responsible for preparing the Budgeting, Forecasting, Analysis and Management Reporting activities for designated markets withing the Southern European Cluster. The Finance Manager will work closely with the in-market finance leads, Market General managers and EuAfMe CoE FP&A Lead to provide finance support for the commercial business. Furthermore the Finance manager will have a finance analyst report directly to them ensuring to lead from the front and provide indepth training on all FP&A activities.

The Finance Center of Excellence will be responsible for the following but not limited to:

Work with the business to develop the bottom-up budget and forecast.
Prepare standard management reporting package, ad hoc reporting and key performance indicators (KPIs) each period for the business and finance management for defined Markets.
Identify business drivers that support business decision making for budgeting, planning, forecasting and management reporting.
Review financial models for solutions to manage the budgeting and forecasting process to ensure consistency.
Provide decision support to commercial leaders in defined Markets.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

The CoE Finance Manager will be primarily responsible for the completion of the activities related to designated Markets which includes but is not limited to:

Responsible for the preparation of the budget and forecast supporting the in-market finance lead and providing analysis including analysis on revenue, profitability, growth, and other drivers that helps drive finance decision support to the business.
Investigate variance analysis and provide explanations, in addition to assisting the market finance leads in the preparation of the key drivers for the financial performance.
Responsible for the preparation of management reporting of financial results for assigned functional areas. Will also work closely with ZFS (financial shared services) on month-end activities including the review of mark-up adjustment, price and volume analysis and submission, calculation of rebates and sales return provisions and other month-end entries.
Routine communication with the in-market finance leads and supervisor relating to financial close, issues and deliverables.
Responsible for performing ad hoc analysis and special projects
Respond to requests from CoE colleagues in an efficient and timely manner.
Work collaboratively with the Finance Director, CoE Team , ZFS Shared Services Team and other finance team members to ensure continuity of business knowledge and execution of the responsibilities related to planning and budgeting, forecasting, and management reporting.
Manage a team of 1 Headcount to ensure timeliness, accuracy and business insights amongst full Southern European cluster
As a senior member of the EuAfMe COE team, the Finance manager will lead internal projects and be expected to provide solutions and drive standardization across all FP&A processes
Contribute to ongoing Zoetis efficiency opportunities and continuous improvement initiatives
Present monthly P&L performance to senior cluster leaders including SVP, General managers and Finance Director
Challenge the internal pricing and margins in the financial performance of the Southern European Cluster identifying areas of potential increase



ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:

Zoetis Finance CoE, ZFSS, Italy and Spain Finance teams, and Commercial team in location.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Undergraduate degree in Finance or Financial Accounting or Business Administration.
4 to 6 years of experience in finance or accounting preferable with a multinational company.
TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIREMENT:

Ability to prepare, conduct and lead Executive-level presentations.
Understanding of financial planning processes, procedure, accounting process and internal Decision support experience in different aspects of financial management including financial planning and analyses, forecasting, and management reporting and analytics.
Working knowledge of Anaplan, SAP, Hyperion Financial Management and/ or Essbase is a plus.
Demonstrated proficiency in US GAAP is a plus.
COMPETENCIES:

Ability to identify business issues and opportunities through financial analysis and reporting.
Ability to meet reporting deadlines (operating plan, forecasting and month-end close activities).
Ability to work well in a team environment and independently.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Microsoft Office capabilities, particularly Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Analytical and solution oriented to resolve complex issues, with attention to detail.
Effective Communication Skills (Written & Verbal).Ability to adapt quickly and learn new tasks independently.
Excellent organization skills.
Ability to manage competing priorities.
About Zoetis


At Zoetis we are passionate about our customers and the animals in their care. We discover, develop and manufacture the world's most innovative and effective products for animal health-medicines, vaccines, diagnostics, genetic tests, biodevices-and we are creating the next generation of integrated solutions and services to support this evolving industry. We know our people drive our success. Our colleagues are proud of our company culture and the meaningful role we play in caring for animals. The Zoetis Core Beliefs define the commitments we make to our colleagues, customers and stakeholders every day. They have guided the creation of our award-winning workplace and our proud position as a leading partner of choice in animal health.





Diversity, Equity & Inclusion


Our Colleagues Make the Difference, and we know their differences make Zoetis stronger. We strive to create an environment where each colleague feels valued and cared for and where we can be our best every day. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus and commitment begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities (50% of our executive team members are women), and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and industry. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council, representing colleagues across locations, functions and communities, serve as ambassadors and champions for DE&I initiatives. In addition to the Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council, Zoetis has six colleague resource groups that bring together colleagues who share similar backgrounds, experiences, or interests and work together toward goals aligned with our strategic business priorities.





Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality, a 100 Best Company for Working Mothers, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others.





For animals. For health. For you.

Revenue Strategy Senior Analyst

The following position is is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

This role provides the opportunity to understand the entire cycle of the Pricing Process. Starting from Pricing Strategy until the deployment of these strategies in the different markets.

This role will allow as well the development of interpersonal skills, as this role requires a high level of coordination with other functions.

Role Responsibilities

A key component of the role is to interpret global into local guidelines and support the implementation in the different channels/markets. Ensuring BSI global brand‚Äôs pricing strategy aligns with desired brand role, ambition, and positioning.

Descripci√≥n:
Offer Description

Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.
Maintain communication with ELIXIR platforms, communities, and leadership; participate in their regular meetings and discussions.
Contribute to supervise junior members at the INB/ELIXIR-ES units.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 2 years of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Vast experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on workflow managers such as Galaxy, Nextflow or similar.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to represent the team at international project meetings.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Descripci√≥n:
Job Description Summary

The role of the MES Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible of understanding and influencing the provision of demands delivered with Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) applications globally.

This role is responsible for ensuring that the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing are consistently modelled and architected to enable the business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to enable continuous improvement and ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

The individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and liaise with the solution delivery teams to deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that solutions meet business objectives and align with TGS strategy. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD‚Äôs MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Partner in the definition of the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate digitalization for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD‚Äôs MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company‚Äôs manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, assess proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain strong relations with the solution delivery organisation and our external partners.

around the world remotely, with the vast majority of our teams working from home. No matter where you are located, you‚Äôll join a dedicated, diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

Description

Currently, we are looking for Business Analysts with Capital Markets knowledge for our Malaga office to make the team stronger.

With over twenty-five years‚Äô experience in crafting market leading software, our business has been rapidly evolving and is now a global player in solving business challenges and developing tailor-made cutting-edge solutions. These challenges require a dynamic and highly skilled workforce imagining, designing, engineering, and delivering software, through to business consulting services & customer experiences, which are changing the world around us.

Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

The Growth Analytics team at Glovo is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to support our Pricing team by analyzing and visualizing data to make more educated decisions on how to optimize our core pricing strategies. You will also be responsible for nurturing the relationship between Pricing HQ and a subset of countries.

You will interact with stakeholders across all levels of the organization on a regular basis and hence require the ability to compartmentalize requests and formulate applicable data-driven solutions. You will require a sharp business focus, a collaborative style of working, and a proactive and critical mindset. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and writing skills are crucial, as is the ability to synthesize complex issues, drive desired outcomes.

Glovo is a fast moving, dynamic environment where flexibility and adaptability are key attributes. The successful candidate is a self-starter with a passion for data analytics and continuously demonstrates an ability to tackle complex problems and implement solutions.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be responsible of the pricing strategy for a subset of countries
Collaborate in redesigning the pricing algorithm. Develop, test and productionize an improved pricing algorithm
Identify commercial opportunities using data to understand user-buying behavior and define our pricing strategy. Designing frameworks to assess price elasticity of demand - to be able to assess which consumer will stay, which will drop
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Work closely with cross-functional leads to develop technical vision and drive the team direction
Work in hand with the product team to define the process and tools to effectively translate strategies into products
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches


You Have
Minimum 2 years of prior experience in a data-driven environment delivering actionable insights
Strong quantitative background
Excellent software development skills in one or more of Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with large data sets
Command line skills
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novices
Fluent spoken and written English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Flexible compensation - transport, childcare, restaurants etc via our 3rd party company called Cobee
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment
Flexible Time Off


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000‚Äôs and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 170+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 33 nationalities

At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our analytics department.

In this position, you will play a critical role in setting up critical reporting for one of our fastest-growing products. Excellent technical skills are required to define and implement ETL processes, define SQL queries and visualize data by building a set of automated dashboards.

Thanks to the analytical and business-oriented approach to data, the senior business intelligence analyst will boost product optimization and help to unlock new revenue opportunities.

Responsabilities
Help define and monitor user journey KPIs (such as ARPU., etc.)
Collaborate with marketing teams (CRM, user acquisition,‚Ä¶) to define key metrics and reporting requirements.
Understand marketing questions and dynamics and translate them into analysis and opportunities.
Proactively provide hands-on analyses to highlight trends and discover insights from data.

Design, implement and maintain ETL processes for integrating the necessary data sources.
Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making.
Enable self-service data exploration, making data standardized and easily accessible.
Collaborate with stakeholders to collect feedback, educate on new data solutions and promote data culture within the company


Requirements

The ideal candidate will have at least 3+ years of relevant industry experience, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements.
Experience in a similar role and/or a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
High level of expertise with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.
Knowledge of digital marketing & advertising technology ecosystem.
Experience exploiting and integrating external API‚Äôs.
Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL pipelines and data modeling.
Strong presentation skills in communicating to both experts and general audiences.
Excellent problem solving, analytical and critical thinking.
Quality driven, attention to detail and pragmatic.
Proactive and positive attitude, self-organized and an excellent team player.
Agile and innovative with the tenacity to thrive in a constantly changing environment and willingness to improve.
Communicative and empathic with stakeholders.
Fluent spoken and written English.

Nice to have experience with not necessarily
Experience with AWS Big Data stack (Redshift, S3, EMR, etc)
Data modelling expertise with R or Python
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Superset


Benefits
Private Health Insurance plan for you and your kids.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly Internet allowance.
Working-from-home setup allowance
Sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored external training and development programs.
Quarterly Company bonus and recruitment referral programs.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Day off for your birthday.
Beautiful offices with amazing city view terraces, right in the centre of Barcelona.

It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference! If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data! Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!
Job Purpose
The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes.

She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyse information and make recommendations.

An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

Responsibilities:
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies.
Create process maps and document key business requirements needed to evaluate opportunities.
Create value stream maps to identify and highlight potential areas of improvement.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional / cross-organization meetings between stakeholders on various end-to-end business processes.
Conduct root cause analysis of process inefficiencies by examining material flow, scheduling, production capacity, constraints.
Document Operational ‚ÄúAs-is‚Äù processes and the desired ‚ÄúFuture State‚Äù processes.
Define SLAs and measure results.
Deploy new operational processes and escalate them as needed.
Maintain, manage and constantly improve central processes
Document all process accordingly: Ensure all necessary procedures and management processes are implemented to guarantee homogeneous and up-to-standard across locations within regional scope.
Ensure appropriate training and self‚Äìactualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Ensure relationship with countries and other stakeholders under excellency metrics


Knowledge Skills And Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Solid understanding of eCommerce
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international result driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful
Technical Know-how / understanding on Tech Data tools such as: SAP, MS office products, hardware, and operating systems as well as knowledge of programming languages, diagnostic utilities, monitoring tools, etc is a plus.
IT Channel experience, Pan European distributors or Software vendor are a definite advantage
Significant experience working with large multinational accounts
Exceptional written and oral communication and presentation skills in English language, additional European languages being a plus.
Intercultural experience is a plus
Excel advance knowledge considered a plus but not mandatory
Cultural Competency Requirements:
For this position, you will be expected to understand, communicate, and collaborate effectively with people across various identities and cultures.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda‚Äôs accommodation partners and promote Agoda‚Äôs top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

In this role you‚Äôll get to

This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.

Key Activities Involved Include But Not Limit To
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendations
Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team‚Äôs performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Minimum 8 -year experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice.
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Descripci√≥n:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Do you enjoy working on real-world business problems that can be solved using data? Its not just about crunching numbers we transform business problems into business solutions through the use of data. We use these statistics to tell stories that are used to make strategic decisions.

As a Data Analyst in the Customer Experience & Strategy team you will use an analytical, data-driven approach to understand our clients needs and provide insights. You will be working closely with the largest Mid-Market clients to optimize their campaigns, present actionable insights, and answer challenging analytical questions.

This role involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyze data and solve problems. The ideal candidate will be able to properly convey the business impact of their analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences.

What youll do
Develop a deep knowledge of Criteos technology, products, and position in the marketplace
Identify and develop innovative analysis to address business challenges and client needs
Provide end-to-end analysis, including formulation of business needs, data gathering, data exploration, analysis and communication of results
Collaborate with cross-functional business units to provide strategic recommendations to the commercial teams
Act as a business partner to strategic leadership teams, to help drive client strategy and direction
Effectively communicate complex analysis to multiple levels of stakeholders
Manage controlled A/B test design, execution, analysis and presentation of results
Who you are
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment, which often requires the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Outstanding analytical, interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to present analytics to a wide range of constituents in a relatable and understandable manner
Ability to participate in project scoping and planning for a large program of work
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau & Excel (experience with Python, R, Hive/Hadoop is a plus)
A data visualization expert someone who can take a business question and visualize the results to impactfully tell a story with data
A good grasp of statistical modeling
A passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes
Strong organizational skills to work with remote managers and teams, as well as internal/external stake holders
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment, which often requires the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
A degree in business, economics, finance, math, or statistics
You are fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restriction
Why you'll love us
Competitive compensation
Career advancement and global mobility opportunities
Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile
Generous vacation policy
Video and sports games area when you need a break
Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going
Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Company Description

We are a world leading online classifieds business that reaches more than 200 million people each month through our household name brands across 12 countries. Our brands include Leboncoin, OLX, fotocasa, Infojobs and Shpock to name a few.

Our brands are supported by global tech hubs in Paris and Barcelona. Their goal is to develop common global product & innovation platforms which all of our brands can use; this means using bleeding edge technology to create highly scalable, highly customisable and secure products and components to free up the development time of our brands and leverage our access to global data.

The Messaging team at Adevinta owns the software and infrastructure that sends over 5 million messages every day and serves millions of customers worldwide. Up to 16 Marketplaces from the Adevinta group all over the world use our infrastructure and integrate their applications using our SDKs to enable chat in their web sites. Our team is formed by a group of 30 multicultural individuals from different areas such as UX, Product, Data and Tech that work together to develop top-of-the-line software products.

Job Description

We are currently looking for a really experienced data engineer to join our team of engineers in Barcelona. As a member of the Messaging team, you will join our journey as we discover how to build state of the art data processing solutions for Adevinta, with emphasis on both volume, velocity and privacy. The event data we collect from all Adevinta sites around the world is essential to our business - including feeding marketplaces with low-latency (‚Äúrealtime‚Äù) updates, visitor insights analysis and targeted advertisement. We are solving exciting problems at scale while keeping users privacy and data security in mind.

As part of the global Adevinta organization, you will also have the opportunity to learn from and share knowledge with data scientists and engineers across Adevinta. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for the state-of-the-art in big data processing at the same time as building reliable and highly scalable services.

Responsibilities
Ensure the traceability of the data from the origins to the decisional and analytical data structures
Setup and maintain the data infrastructure
Work with Data Analyst to understand their need and provide solutions to solve them
Develop comprehensive data capture, transformation and visualization solutions
Guarantee data infrastructure in all environments.
Ensure that quality standards and data governance are being achieved
Advocate for data governance strategies
Share knowledge and provide expert advice to Adevinta engineers as to how to best use the data platform tools as well as providing answers to their engineering needs, fostering a mixed development and operations culture

Qualifications

Desired skills & Professional experience:
A BSc degree in Computer Science (or equivalent job experience)
Strong analytical / problem solving skills
Experience with batch and streaming data processing tools (Spark, Kafka, Kafka Streams, Luigi, etc.)
Experience with ‚Äúbig data‚Äù NoSQL databases design and optimization (S3, Hive, Redshift, Cassandra, etc)
Experience with AWS or any other cloud platform
Experience with Agile methodologies.
SOLID, TDD
Understanding of Software Development best practices
Proven ability and experience developing highly structured computer programs, and interested in learning more.
Must show initiative, proactively finding, discussing and solving product and software problems
You love developing good quality software

Desirable

Experience with modern development tools like Git, Travis, Terraform or equivalent

This is an important and high-profile role within IQVIA. It is a role that requires you to liaise directly between IQVIA functions and the customer, acting as that accountable point for delivery and quality whilst maintaining financial control.

As a project leader you will manage cross functional teams across this global organization. You will be supported by domain experts in every function, enabled by best in class technology and data analytics. Key collaborators are the Clinical Lead for site management, the Project Management Analyst for project coordination, tracking and financial analysis, and the Site Activation Manager an expert in start-up. IQVIA‚Äôs size and global footprint will present you with the breadth of opportunities necessary to develop your career.

While projects vary, your typical responsibilities might include:

Serving as the primary project contact with the client
Leading and managing cross-functional project teams
Project status reporting and surveillance for risk

Leading problem-solving including management of risk and issue resolution

Ensuring compliance with study tools, training materials and standard processes, policies and procedures.

Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Strong organizational and problem-solving skills

Good team leadership skills
Effective mentoring and training skills
Excellent customer service skills
Good judgment
Effective presentation skills
Ability to manage competing priorities
Strong software and computer skills, including MS Office applications
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients.

Minimum Required Education And Experience
Bachelor's degree in life sciences or related field and 5 years‚Äô clinical research experience including 4 years‚Äô project management experience and experience in clinical operations; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Physical Requirements
Extensive use of keyboard requiring repetitive motion of fingers.
Extensive use of telephone and face-to-face communication requiring accurate perception of speech.
Regular sitting for extended periods of time.
Will require occasional travel

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible ‚Äì to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Descripci√≥n:
As a Business Analyst you will provide accurate financial reporting in Spain & Portugal. You will manage and prepare month end management accounts and make accounting adjustments as required. You will integrate into each SBU leadership team and will become the main point of contact for all finance issues. Upon guidance from the GBFS Manager, and in partnership with EMEA SBU Analysts, produce annual budgets, control budget against actuals, and lead on the monthly forecasting processes. Work alongside the Market Director and Commercial Excellence Manager to improve business finance support to all SBUs within scope.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting
Collaborate in the monthly closing process and prepare the monthly reporting and interpret financial results against Profit Plan and Prior Year. Provide financial information in a form and content to drive business decisions
Drive initiatives to ensure financial reporting accuracy; Provide financial analysis to assess business investments
Implement standard reporting tools that will ensure an efficient analysis of performance; Support implementation of new IT tools or system as far as the financial aspects are concerned
Develop an ongoing approach of strong financial management working within the local teams. Understand business cost drivers in detail and collaborate with our BRNO Financial Center
Understand PPG Corporate reporting requirements and provide support to implement Corporate policies; ensure that accounting practices are aligned with PPG and SOX internal control requirements in a timely and correct manner; improve internal controls and internal processes
Help to build & maintain a well-adapted and controlled account reconciliation process with support of Brno (quarterly AA, monthly analysis, BS analysis etc); Perform quality check (audit) on balance sheet reconciliation.
Internal control & audit
Support interim, year-end US Gaaps & statutory audits as required, depending on annual scoping.
Support annual update of the AICC (PPG‚Äôs internal controls certification tool)
Other
Assist in implementation of projects and provide local support and drive cost reduction action plans
Supervise inventory monitoring, adjustments and annual physical inventory
Working with the credit organization with the scope to create further improvement in the main metrics focusing on underperforming areas


Qualifications

The position requires accounting experience, a strong finance background, a high degree of planning, analytical and interpersonal abilities.

Functional/Technical Skills & Knowledge
University degree in Finance with validated accounting background
Proven track record in Finance reporting and controlling
Proficient expertise in IT tools (e.g. Oracle, Access, Word, Excel, Hyperion)
Outstanding analytical skills in order to produce financial analysis on business performance.
Adaptability to change and drive continuous performance and efficiency improvements.
Proficient in English language
Flexible - Outstanding communication - Extraordinary Teammate
Willing to travel (below 20%)
