Are you interested in being part of the green and technological revolution? Do you consider yourself as passionate and customer focused as we are? Are you looking to be part of a Start-Up within a global group? In GreenPowerMonitor you can have the luck to find them all! In addition to the above, we have fun providing cutting-edge monitoring solutions for the renewable energy industry: join us!

GreenPowerMonitor is looking for a talented and proactive person who will join our team in Barcelona as a UX Researcher .

We are looking for a talented and passionate UX researcher to help build one of the best renewable energy data platform in the market place. You will be fully integrated in the UX design team, wherein you will work across product teams and collaborate with Product Owners, UX/UI Designers, Writers, Developers, Engineers, and other key stakeholders.

As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you‚Äôll help the teams understand user needs and run research sessions to capture customer insights based on product team goals and objectives. You‚Äôll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. You‚Äôll work with stakeholders across functions and levels and have impact at all stages of product development. You‚Äôll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, UX workshops, service design blueprinting, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis.

Be a part of a team where you will:
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of products and experiences.
Collect and analyze user behavior through lab studies, field visits, ethnography, surveys, benchmark studies and user A/B testing.
Build a system and scoreboard for Product metrics.
Identify and analyze user metrics. Also identify user flow gaps, new opportunities or new functionalities as per user needs and business goals.
Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and other UXers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate UX research and communicate findings.
Integrate in the overall UX workflow in order to achieve the best quality in our product¬¥s user experience.

Position Qualifications

We need you to have:
Bachelor's degree in Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Human Factors, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least 2 years of experience with research design utilizing various methods including but not limited to usability studies, workshops, contextual inquiry, and surveys.
Relevant product research experience, either in an end-to-end, usability, or generative setting.
Below elements, although not required, will be considered a plus:
Master's degree or PhD in a related field.
Relevant work experience within User Experience, Human-Computer Interaction, applied research setting, and/or product research and development.
Experience in UX UI design support, Usability heuristics analysis support and Web audit.
Experience in a variety of product spaces, applied research and/or academic settings.
Proficiency in communicating user research findings with cross functional partners to drive impact.
Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process.
Our offer:
The possibility to be a part of the passionate team with a start-up mindset within a robust corporate group.
The opportunity to work for a company that is providing state-of-the-art monitoring solutions for the renewables industry.
Competitive salary.
Flexible core hours.
Employee referral bonus programs.
Medical scheme.
Commuting allowance.
Meal ticket or meal allowance.
Life insurance & pension plan.
Kindergarten allowance.
And many, many more!
If you feel that this is the place for you, apply!

Please send us your CV in English.

Please note we may close this position earlier in case of finding successful candidates.

If you have any kind of disability, do not hesitate to inform us and present your certificate. GreenPowerMonitor (DNV GL) is an employer that offers equal opportunities to everyone, regardless any condition.

Company & Business Area Description

GreenPowerMonitor is an international company that offers products and services in the renewable energy sector, with a specific focus in the photovoltaic space. With more than 10 years‚Äô experience, GreenPowerMonitor has consolidated its position as the independent leader in management, monitoring and control of renewable energy installations with more than 20GW globally managed and more than 3.000 facilities across the globe.

GreenPowerMonitor has a great depth of experience with renewable energy plants ranging from 2 kW to 585 MW capacity across the globe. The company offers a market-leading integrated solution set for the management and maintenance of renewable energy installations that includes Hardware, Software and Services unmatched in the industry.

DNV GL is a global quality assurance and risk management company. Driven by our purpose of safeguarding life, property and the environment, we enable our customers to advance the safety and sustainability of their business. Operating in more than 100 countries, our professionals are dedicated to helping customers in the maritime, oil & gas, power and renewables and other industries to make the world safer, smarter and greener.

GreenPowerMonitor merged forces with DNV GL to make world safer, smarter, greener.

Learn more at www.greenpowermonitor.com and www.dnvgl.com

Equal Opportunity Statement

GreenPowerMonitor (DNV GL) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!

We are seeking an Engineer to join our Enterprise Data Analytics & Architecture (EDAA) organization within Group Operations Business Transformation.

Descripci√≥n:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision ‚Äì transforming patients‚Äô lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease ‚Äì and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry ‚Äì each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.

We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Reverse Translation) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To
Develop and apply computational methods for in-depth analysis of stratified patient data to gain mechanistic insight into driver mechanisms
Collaborate with disease stratification and target identification teams to leverage stratification results to impact discovery of novel therapies
Perform integrative analysis to derive validation-ready target hypotheses, linked to clearly defined patient subtypes
Contribute to the identification of suitable in-vitro models and validation scenarios
Collaborate experimental teams on iterative validation of therapeutic and mechanistic hypotheses

Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.
Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).
Experience analyzing high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etc
Experience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageous
Attention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.
Verbal and written English language fluency.

Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.

The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Sector: Ense√±anza superior Investigaci√≥n Biotecnolog√≠a

Descripci√≥n:
Hi! In Frontiers we want to give a boost to our IT department in Madrid and reinforce it with an enthusiastic hands-on Data Engineer to help us improve the quality, scalability, and resilience of our data-intensive applications in the company. Are you interested?

Data is one of our key assets, and actually it‚Äôs the main deliverable of some of our IT teams. But not just data, but data at scale built from different external and internal sources and applying Data Science models on it. Depending on the application we can manage stream data, batch data, bulk data, processed data, data lake, data pipelines, ETLs, machine learning models‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs an amazing playground for an eager Data Engineer, isn‚Äôt it?

The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and excellent IT skills. It‚Äôs key to have hands-on experience designing data-intensive applications and big data solutions, and we also expect a good knowledge of all types of data storage structured files, relational databases, documental databases, graph databases, etc.

And what about us? Well, I invite you to check out Frontiers as a company, our mission, and how we envision society and the world. It's so important to work in a company you can be proud of! By joining us you will play a key role in shaping the future of science and academic publishing, and the way it affects the people, the planet and the evolution of our society. If this resonates with you, please check the job description below, maybe you are the person that can help us!

What You Do
Understand the functional requirements for defining the best data models and data flows between our applications, services, data storages and synchronization mechanisms.
Integrate, transform, and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems into structures that are suitable for building analytics solutions.
Ensure that our data applications/processes are scalable, reliable, secure, extensible, traceable, available and manageable.
Design, implement, monitor, and optimize our data platforms to meet the data pipeline needs.
Support the different SW development teams in the modelling, design, construction, evolution, and decommission of their data-intensive applications and data models
Understand and promote the best Data frameworks and solutions, technical standards and key technologies, to effectively support existing and future business requirements. Develop guidelines and procedures to achieve this goal.


How You Do It
Work closely with IT Architects to provide overall consistent and reliable data solutions for all the applications ecosystem.
Create a partnership with Scrum teams and POs, understanding the application and business requirements, and helping them understand the data through exploration, building and maintaining secure and compliant data processing pipelines.
Collaborate closely with Machine Learning and Data Science Team to improve the performance of our ML pipelines.
Create models and prototypes that validate your ideas, before bringing them to the development teams.
When necessary, provide Technical Support and Training to other IT teams.
Create and maintain up to date the documents describing the Data strategy of your applications domain, as well as all relevant guidelines and standards.
Attend IT conferences and participate in relevant Data Engineering forums where trends and innovations are discussed.


What We Are Looking For
Solid knowledge of data querying and processing languages, such as SQL, Python, or Scala.
Spark and PySpark are also a must.
Understands big data principles and is able to implement them (volume, velocity, variety, veracity and value)
Familiar with data quality requirements and implementation
Excellent understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns. Focus on designing for efficiency for querying, processing, pruning, archiving...
Solid knowledge on DataBricks, DataFactory, SQL Server, MongoDB, data file types (for storage and for analytical queries). Knowledge on ElasticSearch and DeltaLake are a nice-to-have.
Experience on building Data Lakes.
Expertise in data processing data ingest and transformation, batch processing, streaming data processing, distributed processing, monitoring, optimization, logging.
Experienced in troubleshooting data processing and data storage
Knowledgeable of data security standards
Knowledgeable of serving layer design star schema, dimensions, incremental loading, stores,‚Ä¶
Knowledgeable of physical data storage structures compression, partitioning, sharding, redundancy, distributions, archiving‚Ä¶
Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios, able to understand priorities and balance them.
Familiarity with Agile framework
BS in computer science, engineering or relevant field
You are willing to Travel to the Frontiers' headquarters in Switzerland occasionally.
You have good English skills, we are an international company and English is our working language.


What we‚Äôre offering
Competitive salary.
25 leave days.
Great work-life balance.
A top-notch office in an awesome location
Great flexibility for working from home.
Fresh fruit, snacks and coffee.
English classes.
Flexible retribution scheme (nursery cheques, restaurant pass, transportation).
Team building/sport activities and monthly social events.
Lots of opportunities to work with exciting technologies and solve challenging problems.
Joining a company that can really boost the beneficial impact of science on people, society and the planet


Application Process
Please submit your application in English (cover letter and resume).
Applicants must be Spanish or EU citizen, or have a valid Spanish work permit.
Agencies must first contact jobs@frontiersin.org and confirm agreement to our T&C‚Äôs, failing which any exclusivity and/or candidate representation right will be considered to be waived.


Thanks for your time checking the job description, if you think you can match with the role don't hesitate to send us your CV, we‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you!

Offer Description

The Institute

IRBLleida Acts As a Cluster Of All Biomedical Research Carried Out In Lleida And Belongs To Two Players That Conduct Health Research And Implement Innovation Policies
The University of Lleida (UDL) includes researchers from the Faculties of Medicine, Nursing and Physiotherapy.
The Department of Health , includes researchers from the Arnau de Vilanova University Hospital (HUAV), Santa Mar√≠a University Hospital (HUSM), the Catalan Health Institute (ICS) and the Lleida Primary Care and Community .
The IRBLleida is a CERCA centre , a member of the biocluster supported and supervised by the Autonomous Government of Catalonia and it is also accredited as a Centre of Excellence by the Carlos III Health Institute (funded by Spanish Government). In addition, it interacts in the region with the Institute for Innovation and Research in Sustainability (Inspires), the Technological Centre of Catalonia ( EURECAT ), the Scientific and Technological Agri-Food Park of Lleida and with Agrotecnio , the Centre for Research in Agriculture, Animal Production And Food Technology of the ETSEA campus of the University of Lleida.

In December 2014, the Lleida Biomedical Research Institute‚Äôs received the 'HR Excellence in Research' logo from the European Commission. This is a recognition of the Institute's commitment to developing an HR Strategy for Researchers, designed to bring the practices and procedures in line with the principles of the European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers (Charter and Code).

Please, check out our Recruitment Policy

Professional Profile
Pre-doctoral researcher.
The candidate must be enrolled in a PhD program in Health Sciences.
Main duties/responsibilities

The person hired will join the Health Care Research Group (GRECS) and will work in a line of work funded at national and European level.

Participation in the design and development of the trials for the validation of the technologies derived from the project in samples of elderly participants; both in a laboratory setting and at the participants' home
The person hired will participate in specific tasks of collecting, managing and analysing quantitative and qualitative data derived from the project.
Participation in the presentation of results to national and international congresses, writing scientific articles and reports with the project.
Active participation in project meetings, both at national and European level.

The hiring will be carried out at the expense of the project PP10523 ‚ÄúNextPerception - Next generation smart perception sensors and distributed intelligence for proactive human monitoring in health, wellbeing, and automot‚Äù. This project resorts under the ECSEL joint undertaking and is co-funded by the EU H2020 programme under grant agreement 876487 and national funding agencies in Belgium, Czech Republic, Finland, Germany, Italy, The Netherlands and Spain.

The Company

Aizon is the outcome of years of expertise and the commitment to guide and lead biotech and pharma manufacturing into the future leveraging our AI/ML technology. With headquarters based in San Francisco and development in Barcelona, we are working with the latest technologies and top worldwide companies as partners (like Amazon). We've developed a Serverless SaaS platform, based on IoT, big data, artificial intelligence, and pharma 4.0 technologies, offering an intuitive way to gain meaningful operational intelligence by enabling real-time visibility, faster root cause analysis, and predictive insights for AI-augmented decision making in a GxP compliant manner with end-to-end data integrity. Aizon‚Äôs technology platform can enable pharma/biotech customers to accelerate their manufacturing process while improving quality and compliance.

Our Vision, Mission, and Values

We are looking for new members of our team who already live by our shared values and are inspired by our company vision. Vision: helping pharma and biotech industries improve the efficiency and quality of their operations through the use of Artificial Intelligence technologies ensuring total traceability through simple IT solutions. Our mission is to improve manufacturing processes to positively impact society. We are guided by our values: trust, customer- centricity, innovation, integrity, collaboration and passion.

The Position

Software Training Manager

Reporting to the Chief Customer Success Officer, this position will develop, coordinate, and implement policies, procedures, and programs encompassing all aspects of training, training management, and training development. Being part of the Customer Success department, this position will be responsible for devising the training plan, preparing and overseeing the training portfolio and courses, conducting training, and tracking and reporting training progress. The most direct way of bringing value to our customers is through Aizon‚Äôs platform-specific Solutions. Thus, the Training Manager must be able to educate our audiences on how to make the best use of our products and services.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Manage the development, implementation, and delivery of software training

Work directly with product management, solutions engineers, data scientist, quality engineers teams for training and quality needs.

Direct all training and quality assurance activities, programs, and staff to ensure the highest quality is achieved for clients, centers, and corporations.

Identify and implement training best practices using lessons learned, industry standards, and client feedback.

Demonstrate expertise and ability to present material driving understanding confidently

Manage the development and implementation of software training

Work directly with product management, solutions engineers, data scientist, quality engineers teams for training and quality needs.

Instruct performance through quantitative data and training evaluation feedback.

Ability to cultivate mutually beneficial partnerships with Product Managers / Proactively engage with business contacts to establish partnership (value delivered beyond the execution of training projects)

Develop training materials and deliver expert training to customers and partners

Conduct live webinars to technical audiences to support marketing strategy for lead generation

Comprehension of rules & standards // Ensure content quality, standards and process are met and exceeded for publication.

Deliver final content in specified formats, authorize delivery channels and manage product-related content

What Do You Need

Must-have

Great educational background, preferably in the fields of Engineering (Industrial, Electronics, IT) or a Bachelor (or Master) degree in a related field

5 years at least of demonstrating experience in training in manufacturing (not laboratory) SaaS, automation, or equivalent platforms within the B2B market space

Experience working with software implementations and understanding what goes into training users on a new application

Experience with needs assessments, course development design, and presentation/facilitation of professional training courses.

Proven and practical leadership experience

Excellent ability to run meetings efficiently and see those action items are completed on time

Understanding of digital transformation and change management in manufacturing

Conduct live webinars and on-line training sessions

Proficient in spoken and written English

Bonus- points

Pre-sales experience

Familiar with the use of the Atlassian suite (Confluence, Jira)

Knowledge of AWS

Basic understanding of Industry 4.0 concepts and principles

Project management skills necessary to keep tasks coordinated, delivered on time

Ability to thrive in an environment that is fast-paced, dynamic, and at times stressful

Capable of working with a dynamic product that is ever-changing and evolving rapidly

We are committed to providing an inclusive environment where all employees feel mutual respect and are contributing to the good of society. Letgo is the fastest growing mobile marketplace to buy and sell locally in Turkey. We‚Äôre powering a new, second-hand economy on mobile with a diverse, passionate and hardworking team that‚Äôs connecting millions of buyers and sellers. And who helps us doing it? Our incredible Squads!

And now you are thinking‚Ä¶ ‚Äò‚ÄôHow can I be part of this?‚Äô‚Äô Let‚Äôs us help with the answer!

We're looking for an ambitious Senior Data Engineer for our Data Engineering team! They're a focused group that delivers a large impact. We like to experiment, iterate, adapt quickly, and anticipate the data needs of the organization. We are driving the state-of-the-art data architecture at letgo, ensuring that our solution is fast, highly scalable, and reliable. This allows all teams to make the most out of our data while upholding the highest standards to protect our users and their privacy!

Competitive salary

As a Data Science Team Lead, you will lead a team of 3 to 5 people and will report to the Head of Analytics. You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You‚Äôll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

Specifically, You‚Äôll
Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players‚Äô behaviour and the performance of our games
Lead recruitment, onboarding, peer review and career development for the team from a technical perspective
Be self- motivated to learn and drive your teams‚Äô development while improving methodology and working practices across the company
Provide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work on
Be the pro- active owner of the entire data chain for your games

Skills To Create Thrills

Our ideal candidate will have solid experience leading an analytical team in a commercial environment. There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:
Leadership: The ability to mentor, guide and inspire your colleagues and drive best practices across the company
Stakeholder Management: The ability to recognise dependencies, build relationships and influence others
Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions
Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.
Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposes
Stats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.
Bonus Points
Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:
Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businesses
Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)
Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design
Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)
Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players ‚Äì and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Senior User Researcher @TheFork

TheFork‚Äôs growing Product team seeks an experienced researcher to work directly on projects that impact the company‚Äôs key initiatives. Research projects will range from exploratory to evaluative, from surveys to usability testing, for both Diners and Restaurateurs.

Partnering with the Product team, the Senior Researcher will be responsible for bringing the user experience (attitudes, opinions, and behaviors) into product development.

For this position, we are looking for a mixed-methods researcher with 3+ years of qualitative and quantitative research experience in a professional setting, and an understanding of survey design and basic survey analysis. Responsibilities include: conducting usability studies, designing and fielding surveys, designing click-tests/other fast forms of user feedback, and partnering with external research vendors.

The right candidate will be: experienced in qualitative methods such as in-depth interviewing and usability testing, experienced with designing surveys and basic survey analysis, passionate about research and food, and comfortable in a fast moving organization.

Specific Responsibilities Include
Build and maintain a database of Diners and Restaurateurs who will be part of our core tester pool
Identify and optimize key opportunities to develop user insights and influence customer behavior to drive toward TheFork‚Äôs goals
Define research strategy and manage projects across a variety of methodologies
Design from scratch and conduct qualitative studies (usability studies, click-tests etc.), analyze data, and share findings
Create and field surveys, analyze responses, and report findings
Maintain ongoing research initiatives including projects with external research vendors
Communicate research findings internally in clear and compelling ways
Work cross-functionally with design, marketing, and product management leadership


Hiring Requirements
3+ years of professional applied research experience
Extensive experience with qualitative research methods
Understanding of quantitative research methods (e.g. surveying) and basic statistics
Detail oriented and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to present clear results
Ability to ask, and answer, meaningful and impactful questions
Fluent in English. (Spanish and/or French is a plus)


We are looking for somebody to join the team in Barcelona but we're also open to consider Paris as the main location.

About Typeform

One sunny Barcelona morning, two designers sat down to build a beautiful lead gen form for a bathroom company‚Äôs showroom. They ended up reimagining the data collection experience, and realized it was one idea they wouldn‚Äôt be flushing down the toilet. Today, Typeform is a team of over 300 people from more than 35 countries, with offices in Barcelona, Spain and San Francisco, US.

We‚Äôre building a world where brands, businesses, and their communities can have more personal relationships with the people who matter most. To do this, we give people the tools they need to have conversational experiences at scale‚Äîbecause meaningful relationships start with conversations.

From online lead forms and engaging quizzes, to face-to-face encounters in the office, help us build more meaningful relationships, one conversation at a time.

About The Team

At Typeform, the Data team is making data our #1 asset. And we know how important that is‚Äî our product helps people collect information in the best way possible, by making it conversational.

That‚Äôs why we need you. We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist Technical Lead to work together with the insights teams.

The Marketing DS chapter teams are focused on unlocking customer acquisition. We are responsible for Data Analysis, and development of optimization models to enable data-driven decisions and automated optimizations in marketing.

We are responsible for identifying and monitoring initiatives that drive customer value, understanding the needs and sentiments of our current customers for Customer Success and Product team to improve our value proposition.

About The Role

The Data Science Tech Lead has a pivotal role in the Data department by defining, propagating and updating the quality standards of the work of Data Scientists across the DS chapters.

Here‚Äôs What You‚Äôll Do
Mentor Data Scientists on best practices of coding, collaboration and communication
Be the point of contact between Data Scientists and Data Engineers and Machine Learning Engineers
Guide Data Scientists in translating business questions into technically sound solution that foster reusability, reproducibility and minimize technical dept
Contribute to critical, company-wide, projects and coordinate technical work
Define cross-team rituals and dynamics about coding reviews
Promote and coordinate the development of in-house built tools
Keep the team up to date with emerging tools and methodologies


Here‚Äôs What We‚Äôre After

About you
You‚Äôve got +7 years of directly relevant, tech industry work experience as a statistician / data scientist.
You have deep expertise of statistical modeling / applied machine learning with a focus on churn prediction, customer behavioural. clustering, LTV. Experience with A/B and multivariate analysis, test design and implementation.
Strong mentorship skills with demonstrated experience collaborating with team members and learning new techniques.
You are a driven person capable of lead and propose complex projects.
You‚Äôre pragmatic. You value simple and effective solutions over complicated brain-melters.
You can take a complex concept and make it sound simple, using clear visual references to help.
You like taking on big challenges‚Äîgiven the appropriate time and resources.
You‚Äôre hungry to learn and embrace healthy debate.
You're empathic, enthusiastic, and collaborative.
You‚Äôve are proficient building queries with SQL.
You have experience with AWS or other cloud systems.
You are an expert in Python, and have some experience in implementation (Scala/Java).
You‚Äôre fluent in English and eager to work in a multicultural, international environment.


It'd Be Amazing If You Also Have
Having working knowledge of Big Data technologies (mostly Spark and Redshift ) is a plus.
You are versed in engineering and coding best practices: object oriented. programming, software design patterns, version controlling (GIT)

Think you‚Äôre a good fit? Hit apply‚Äîsuccess might be just around the corner üòâ

Today, more than 2.5M people from all over the world use Typeform. We celebrate the diversity of our customer base, and we want our employees to reflect those differences. At Typeform, we‚Äôre committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Senior User Researcher @TheFork

TheFork‚Äôs growing Product team seeks an experienced researcher to work directly on projects that impact the company‚Äôs key initiatives. Research projects will range from exploratory to evaluative, from surveys to usability testing, for both Diners and Restaurateurs.

Partnering with the Product team, the Senior Researcher will be responsible for bringing the user experience (attitudes, opinions, and behaviors) into product development.

For this position, we are looking for a mixed-methods researcher with 3+ years of qualitative and quantitative research experience in a professional setting, and an understanding of survey design and basic survey analysis. Responsibilities include: conducting usability studies, designing and fielding surveys, designing click-tests/other fast forms of user feedback, and partnering with external research vendors.

The right candidate will be: experienced in qualitative methods such as in-depth interviewing and usability testing, experienced with designing surveys and basic survey analysis, passionate about research and food, and comfortable in a fast moving organization.

Specific Responsibilities Include
Build and maintain a database of Diners and Restaurateurs who will be part of our core tester pool
Identify and optimize key opportunities to develop user insights and influence customer behavior to drive toward TheFork‚Äôs goals
Define research strategy and manage projects across a variety of methodologies
Design from scratch and conduct qualitative studies (usability studies, click-tests etc.), analyze data, and share findings
Create and field surveys, analyze responses, and report findings
Maintain ongoing research initiatives including projects with external research vendors
Communicate research findings internally in clear and compelling ways
Work cross-functionally with design, marketing, and product management leadership


Hiring Requirements
3+ years of professional applied research experience
Extensive experience with qualitative research methods
Understanding of quantitative research methods (e.g. surveying) and basic statistics
Detail oriented and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to present clear results
Ability to ask, and answer, meaningful and impactful questions
Fluent in English. (Spanish and/or French is a plus)


We are looking for somebody to join the team in Barcelona but we're also open to consider Paris as the main location.

Verisure, operating under two brand names (Securitas Direct & Verisure) is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate UX Researcher. The role will part of a growing and talented Group Design Team, and will work closely with a wide cross-functional team in validating new concepts, improving on the existing products, and contributing to innovation process for the purpose of enhancing the user experience. . The role will be based in our R&D centre in Madrid with some European travel required.

Technology plays an important role in our value creation. It is at the core of the service and operations we provide to our customers.  It is what enables our people to do our job, protecting what matters most. But it is also at the heart of our future value creation. It is at the core of the new services we will offer, building on our legacy of value accretive innovation by deploying world-class products and services.



Strategic context and value proposition



Our Technology objectives for the coming years are ambitious. We must continue to support our countries and customers with secured and world-class quality, service and product performance. We must lead in product and service innovation and increase our innovation pace. We need to support our ambitious growth in customers and geographies. For this, we must provide key capabilities, Key talent and tools supporting business efficiency and commercial priorities.

The role will be an excellent communicator and flexible team player that thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. The UX Researcher must be comfortable working closely with passionate engineering and product teams that are deeply concerned about the creation of a great consumer experiences.

The UX Researcher contributes to design expertise by actively participating in various product discussion sessions with designers, developers, managers and other collaborative personnel.

The UX Researcher is also tasked with finding compelling and creative ways of evangelizing insights discovered from research efforts as well as evangelizing the best research methods. Internal evangelism is not limited to product management departments but is meant for the whole business to cultivate a highly informed and effective product organization.

A proactive mindset focused on driving value to the business from quality is key. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker as well as an operational enabler.

Responsibilities will include:

Run both explorative and evaluative design research programs for the products and services the Design group supports.
Facilitate the collection of consumer experience metrics in the course of collaboration with different product development departments including senior stakeholders, product management and the leadership team.
Independently define the research objectives and formulate research proposals that are agreed with the various stakeholders based on project needs and business goals.
Conduct various studies by applying methods such as usability testing, field research, surveys, diary studies, and any other methods that are deemed impactful in the formulation of product approaches that improve consumer experiences.
Triangulate many sources of qualitative and quantitative data in order to generate strategic and tactical insights along with actionable recommendations that drive product design improvements and innovation that will in turn improve the consumer experience.
Lead the design and product development departments in a hands-on manner through both small scale and large-scale user experience researches upon request. Assist in the analysis and interpretation of cognitive, behavioural, and physiological consumer data.
Use data and insights from a multitude of sources to help designers and other key stakeholders make informed decisions about the user experience.
Conducts analysis on the final product, raising the alarm on any overlooked defects relating to the product‚Äôs interface or design as well as the potential solutions to such errors.
Have an understanding of modern project management methodologies (e.g. agile, lean UX)
Be aware of the latest UX trends and industry best practices and use this knowledge to evolve products and features when and where it is appropriate.


Location



The position will be based in Madrid



Reports and organization structure



This position will report directly into our Global Design Director

Candidate profile



Experience and Qualifications



We see this role as critical for the achievement of Verisure‚Äôs growth and organizational transformation goals.



¬∑5+ years in qualitative or quantitative research methods. Experience in usability studies, interviewing, ethnographic observation, surveys, and video editing.

¬∑A proven track record of successfully applying design research and strategic thinking to products or services.

¬∑University degree in Design, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Human-Psychology, Computer Science, Computer Interaction, or any other related field.

¬∑Possess exceptional communication skills to relay complex information in a simple, clear, and concise manner to collaborating personnel. These communication skills have to be excellent in both verbal and written form.

¬∑Good people skills are necessary for the position in order to ensure proper execution of the role‚Äôs duties with minimal conflict and complications between collaborative and cross-functional personnel.

¬∑Possess strong interpersonal skills for proper execution of this function. These include; a passion for consumer-centred product designs; have a meticulous eye for detail, be able to manage multiple simultaneous projects with ease; a drive to take initiative beyond normal duties; strong listening, organisational, and analytical skills; and a will and capacity to constantly learn new and developing research methods and analyses.

¬∑Proficient with in-person and online moderated and unmoderated user testing tools such as UserZoom, Loop11, Usertesting, UsabilityHub, OBS, Morae, etc.

¬∑Proficient in PowerPoint and other computer software that aid in the delivery of high-quality presentations to the Global Design Director as well as to stakeholders.

¬∑Proficient in English, both written and spoken forms.

¬∑Native Spanish, both written and spoken forms.

Competencies



Committed to delivering world class user experiences.
Motivated to drive and direct research projects and programs. 
Ability to communicate clearly with stakeholders and team members in different locations (across Europe).
Be the voice for the user in a room with people who hold their own respective points of view. Argue for the best user experience while also respecting the different business, market, and technological needs in the decision-making process. 
You are an analytical problem solver who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.
Proven ability to create collaborative relationships with stakeholders and peers in a matrix organization and be recognized as a value-added partner and resource, working in multicultural teams.
A match to our culture, the successful candidate will have high energy, flexibility, fantastic communication skills (both written and verbal) and huge amounts of drive.
Familiar with current home security / smart home technologies.
Pro-active, driven and willing to listen, observe and understand real user needs
Strong knowledge of design thinking practices and methodologies

Applications must include:

An up to date CV and concise portfolio or sample of research work in a PDF format ‚Äì no web links 



Strong fit with our Company DNA



Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

Description

Do you have a deep passion for utilizing technology to empower businesses? Are you passionate about collaborating with technology and business leaders to deliver cloud-based solutions?
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon and a leader in cloud computing, is seeking early career talent to join our AWS Professional Services Graduate Program. This is a unique opportunity for driven, self-starters to play a key role in a fast-growing business, and to deliver significant value to AWS customers of all sizes from startups to global brands. You will learn from top AWS subject matter experts and train for an exciting career in the tech industry.
We work with cutting-edge technologies supporting the largest and most innovative businesses, non-profits, and government agencies around the world. This is an unparalleled opportunity to begin your career path in a role helping AWS to transform the way the world uses technology to solve their business challenges. The skills and experiences you gain will lay foundation for the career of a lifetime.

In This Role, You Must Possess The Following
An affinity for the new and unknown. We are always experimenting with innovative concepts including cloud computing, application development, machine learning, and Internet of Things.
Enjoy working with customers of all shapes and sizes. You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building solutions for a diverse and challenging set of customers ranging from small businesses to large enterprises.
About Graduate Program

The AWS Professional Services Graduate Program is a 12-month program on our consulting teams. The program focus is to develop early-career talent and future leaders at Amazon. Start date is September 2021. The program consists of technical in-depth training, consulting training, and real-world projects with our enterprise customers, typically large multinationals, or public sector customers.

As Graduate Consultant, You Will
Work as part of a team of experienced AWS consultants on-site at our customers and together with our customers‚Äô business and IT specialists to help them achieve their desired business outcomes quickly
Receive continuous mentoring and training to support your personal and professional development both in your field of specialty and beyond
Teach and coach customer teams and external partners in how to best use AWS Services and other technology, thereby helping them make good technology decisions
Innovate on behalf of our customers and contribute to team goals to exceed the quality standards of all deliverables
Get certified on AWS Platform during the program through hands-on and on-the-job training
The program offers these specialty tracks: DevOps, Cloud Infrastructure Architect, Application Developer, Cloud Migrations, Big Data & Analytics, IoT, Data Science, and Security.

Appendix Of Specialty Descriptions

DevOps Specialist - A specialist in building advanced computing systems that harness continuous integration/continuous deployment pipelines and utilize the strengths of cloud computing to build scalable and economical systems for clients.
Cloud Infrastructure Architect - A specialist in cloud-based networking and system rollouts. CIAs specialize in network performance, infrastructure provisioning, and building Application Programming Interfaces (APIs)
Application Developer and Cloud Migrations - AppDev resources are specialists in designing applications that run natively in the cloud. They are experts in building programs that run on any number of platforms including virtualized instances, containers, or serverless architecture. They help our customer to migrate to AWS cloud platform quicker.
Big Data & Analytics - This role supports our teams that leverage data and produce business insights. The specialists in this area help our customers use and integrate data collection, IoT, data extraction, and analytics services in their data pipeline.
Data Scientist - Data Scientists use scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from data sets. They collaborate with Data Engineers and Machine Learning Ops Experts to deliver results for our customers.
Security Consultant - Within AWS, security is job zero. We believe that solid security practices are the foundation for using the Cloud. Security Consultants are trusted advisors and enablers for our customer to make their cloud implementations secure.


Basic Qualifications
Currently enrolled in or received a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) (or graduated less than twelve months ago)
Experience with one of these: software engineering or development, networking fundamentals, security, databases (relational and/or NoSQL), data analytics, operating systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows), or Data Science concepts

Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Watson Assistant‚Äôs API and Runtime team.

You need to be able to think strategically to develop long-term architectural roadmaps, while continuously delivering new features to make incremental progress.
Develop and implement innovative techniques for solving linear, mixed-integer linear or non-linear programming problems.
Transform customer needs into features, from defining, to implementing, to testing, to drafting documentation, (CPLEX prefered)
Support customers by working with the support team, answering technical questions, or fixing defects in the code.
Familiar coding in C, however good knowledge of C++ and Java will be useful.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Fluency in written and spoken English is required.
Professional experience with node.js and JavaScript
Professional experience with designing and developing enterprise applications
Professional experience with SQL databases, such as Postgres
Knowledge in algorithmics outside mathematical programming, for example graph algorithms, approximation algorithms and heuristics, dynamic programming, etc.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques.
Very strong background in Operations Research, particularly mathematical programming, coupled with high quality and rigorous programming skills.
An excellent background in C coding. Knowledge of C++ and Java will also be appreciated.
Ideally you will have already implemented high-performance codes for (some aspects of) either linear, mixed integer, or non-linear programming algorithms.
Finally, experience in evaluating and tuning performance of code is highly sought after.
You should be self-motivated and be able to work as part of a distributed team.
Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise
Experience with designing enterprise REST APIs
Experience with writing enterprise applications with Java
Experience with deployment and management of microservices to Kubernetes or OpenShift clusters
Knowledge in algorithmics outside mathematical programming, for example graph algorithms, approximation algorithms and heuristics, dynamic programming, etc.

About Business Unit

IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company‚Äôs Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM‚Äôs global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients‚Äô growth and innovation. Descripci√≥n:
Casa Systems, Inc. (Nasdaq: CASA) is 5G, delivering physical, virtual and cloud-native 5G infrastructure and customer premise networking for high-speed data and multi-service communications networks. Our core and edge convergence technology enables public and private networks for both communications service providers and enterprises. Casa Systems‚Ñ¢ products deliver higher performance, improved network flexibility and scalability, increased operational efficiency and lower total cost of ownership (TCO). Commercially deployed in more than 70 countries, Casa serves over 475 Tier 1 and regional service providers worldwide. At Casa Systems, our mission is to deliver ultra-broadband solutions that keep families, communities and the world connected. We harness our passion for innovation to drive technological solutions that allow service providers to do amazing things that improve the way we live.

Casa Communications Technology S.L.U., an entity of Casa Systems, Inc., seeks to hire a ITN-5VC Early Stage Researcher (ESR) to join its engineering team based in Valencia, Spain. This duration of this assignment is three year.

The Early Stage Researcher impacts the organization by modifying the current 5G chipsets in order to adapt them to on-board autonomous driving sensors. The main focus of the researcher will be on the modification of the light RRC and MAC protocols of a 5G communication system for the specific use of IoT and 5G V2X communication, evaluating the Radar-Communication platform that will be built implementing the 5G V2X link.

The ESR applicant must have resided or carried out his/her main activity outside of the country of the institution (Polytechnic University of Valencia) for more than 24 months in the 3 years immediately prior to recruitment. The chosen candidate, after a thorough selection process, will be part of an excellent international research team and benefit from the scientific and complementary training programme of the EU-funded Innovative Training Network (ITN) ITN-5VC ESRs as part of Marie Sk≈Çodowska-Curie Actions, upon successful completion, shall be entitled to PhD. degree from the host organization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Participate in the different ITN project meetings.
Develop technical solutions for the ITN-5VC project in the 5GNR Protocol Stack.
Participate in the writing of the technical reports related to his PhD.
As a member of a software engineering team, develops subsystems of 4G and 5G small cell solutions including 4G and 5G protocol stacks and/or management systems.
Designs and develops high-volume, high-performance, high-availability Radio Access Network software and applications using proven software development frameworks and technologies.
Ensures consistent use of shared platform components and technologies within Casa Systems RAN product portfolio.
Designs and develops reusable libraries and APIs for use across the Casa Systems RAN product portfolio.
Contributes to best practices for software development at Casa Systems.
Designs and writes unit and integration tests, within automated test environments to ensure code quality.
Assists in defining the team's technical strategy and advising on product roadmaps in terms of software feasibility and migration plans to achieve strategic goals.
Writes concise yet comprehensive technical documentation.
Liaises with the product manager and technical architect to explore and suggest appropriate technical solutions.
Responsible for work quality, ensuring it meets the technical standards for all Casa Systems RAN product portfolio.
Monitors work against the product delivery schedule closely and provide progress updates and report any issues or technical difficulties to both the management team and the senior developers on a regular basis.
Participate in Webinars and conferences.


Qualifications
Have resided or carried out his/her main activity outside of the country of the institution (Polytechnic University of Valencia) for more than 24 months in the 3 years immediately prior to submitting application.
MSc degree in electronics, communications, electromagnetics or physics.
3+ years of research and development experience.
Knowledge and practical experience in mobile communication protocols.
Background in networking protocols (TCP/IP, IGMP, VoIP, VoLTE, etc.).
Background in Mobile Communications Technologies (4G, 5G).
Knowledge in ‚ÄúC‚Äù and/or ‚ÄúC++‚Äù programming.
Knowledge in Python and Matlab programming.
Basic knowledge in hardware design.
Ability to design and develop complex systems.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills are required.
Creative and self-motivated.


Casa Systems is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment free from unlawful employment discrimination and without barriers to Equal Employment Opportunity. Candidates must be able to work in Spain without Company sponsorship.

Role

Contributes to the forecasting process by generating the statistical forecast and executing all forecast preparation activities (such as portfolio segmentation, history cleansing, forecasting review) in order to guarantee on a monthly basis the most appropriate forecast baseline for all products of his/her perimeter.

About Us
RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. RavenPack‚Äôs products allow clients to enhance returns, reduce risk and increase efficiency by systematically incorporating the effects of public information in their models or workflows. We're looking for
Are you super passionate about search? The Machine Learning Team at RavenPack is seeking proven technical leaders to help create a game-changing search experience that returns rich, intelligent, contextual, and personalized search results across RavenPack's Search & Discovery products. The candidate will participate in the research related to the integration processes of asylum seekers and refugees, to the impact of COVID-19 in the migrant population, as well as to discourses on immigration.

Research in the NIEM project on integration processes of asylum seekers and beneficiaries of international protection, the impact of COVID-19 in the migrant population, as well as to discourses on immigration in mass media channels and in the political debate. Preparation of the NIEM project annual report.
Produce academic articles, scientific reports and CIDOB publications for the general audience. Participate in mass media channels to disseminate research results.
Take the lead in planning and organizing activities and conferences.
Participate in the activities and projects of the Migration Area and in the meetings of the research team; collaborate with other research areas at CIDOB.
Participate in communication and dissemination activities of the Migrations area at CIDOB.
1- The National Integration Evaluation Mechanism (NIEM) Project, cofunded by the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF), aims to measure and improve integration of beneficiaries of international protection. The final purpose is to prepare key actors in the integration field in 15 EU Member States to better face the current challenges and improve the integration outcomes of beneficiaries of international protection.

Descripci√≥n:
Bioinformatician

Paramount have partnered with a major new start up in Oxford that has made exceptional progress in the field of cancer diagnostics. Harnessing breakthrough technology from one of the most renowned academic institutions in the world, they are dedicated to making cancer diagnostics more sensitive, accurate and cheaper than ever before. Due to a recent substantial funding round, this exciting Biotech is now looking for talented and highly motivated Bioinformaticians to join their R&D team.

The ideal candidate will bring a deep knowledge of various statistical approaches required to analyse and interpret NGS data and will drive the creation of novel methods. We are looking for an enthusiastic Scientist with excellent communication skills, who thrives when working in a collaborative team environment.

Responsibilities May Include
Creating and implementing novel methodologies and algorithms to enable the analysis of DNA sequence and methylation data for a range of R&D projects and clinical-grade assays
Analyse and interpret sequence data to improve understanding of product performance and clinical utility
Supporting wider teams with experimental design and clinical studies, as well as project requirements, planning, execution and reporting
Working in close collaboration with the software team to support in writing production ready code
Skills And Experience Required
A PhD in Bioinformatics, statistical genetics, applied mathematics, statistics or related field.
Experience in scientific programming, in particular python and/or R.
Excellent statistical skills with post doctorial or industry experience of working with NGS, WGS/WES or DNA Methylation data
An understanding of cancer genomics would be desirable (but not essential)
A background in genomics lead diagnostics technologies would be desirable (but not essential)
Strong team-working skills with previous experience of completing collaborative projects on time and within budget.
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) with the ability to communicate complex ideas and information to a range of stakeholders.
Enjoy working towards challenging goals in a fast-moving environment where on-time delivery of results is a high priority.
This is a really exciting opportunity for a Bioinformatician or Statistical Geneticist who wants to work on truly breakthrough science and make a real impact on the lives of cancer patients. Alongside working amongst some of the brightest minds in this field, the successful candidate will receive a competitive salary package and flexible working options. To be considered, please email your CV to Emilie Francis at Efrancis@pararecruit.com.

Key words: Oxford, Biotech, Startup, Oncology, Cancer Genomics, Diagnostics, Epigenetics, Statistical Genetics, Bioinformatics

Please see our website for details or send your CV in to us to find out the latest opportunities. Company Description

Adevinta is an international group present in 12 countries, and we are sure that you know our brands in Spain: fotocasa, habitaclia, InfoJobs, coches.net, motos.net and milanuncios, reach more than 18 million unique users per month: we are one of the top 10 companies with the largest internet audience in Spain! This and our more than 1,000 employees make us one of the leading tech companies on the Spanish market.

As a tech company, we have digital DNA. We love challenging the status quo and we are constantly thinking of new ways of doing things.We work using PEAK Performance, a streamlined way of working based on OKRs, and self-sufficient and self-organising teams. We believe in a culture of feedback and a close leadership style. In short, we create ever smarter solutions to offer our users and clients the best experience.

If you like challenges and believe in the power of connection as much as we do...Join our team!

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced UX researcher with strong communication and people skills. Strong candidates will demonstrate a rigorous approach to UX research methods as well as have experience shaping and informing product backlogs.

In particular, we value researchers with experience in standard generative and evaluative UX research methods, that strive to seek insights and translate them into actionable and impactful solutions for our business.

While strong candidates will have experience working end-to-end (early user needs research to post-ship UX research), we are looking for researchers with strong generative research skills, plus demonstrated capability in driving insights into actionable, measurable product UX and business goals.

You will work with multi-disciplinary teams to push the boundaries of what is possible in the second hand industry. Ultimately, your expertise in research must do more than just contribute to knowledge ‚Äì you must also be skilled at driving a measurable positive impact on the product and business.

Qualifications
Strong understanding of usability and user experience principles
Expert understanding of qualitative user research methodologies, their benefits, costs, time frames and suitability to different stages of product development lifecycle, as well as a good grounding in quantitative methods
Be the driving force of user research by identifying research needs of the teams that leads to planning, defining, conducting and reporting findings of all conducted research
Working with product teams to ensure that user data / research findings are incorporated into design and implementation (in an iterative manner, from first concepts through to release and after)
Making sure that the findings of user and market research help inform the business strategy, engineering / product road maps and data analytics team
Ability to work closely with data analytics team to synthesise both the quantitative data provided by them with the qualitative data from UX to form strong hypothesis for design, research and engineering
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Hands on management and planning with external vendors doing UX research for usability to work in an Agile, lean environment with quick iterative research

Additional Information
Work with excellent professionals to solve hard technical challenges.
Be part of a company with an excellent working environment and modern, creative offices.
Opportunities for development and growth within the company and the international group.
Flexible working hours 8-10h / 17-19h
38h work week (Friday afternoons off).
23 paid vacation days a year, plus the 24th and 31st of December off.
Intensive workday during summer months and Easter (34h work week).
Medical insurance.
Attractive remuneration according to your experience.
MacBook Pro or Dell equivalent laptop + iPhone XR or Samsung S10.
Free breakfast, coffee and fruit.
Flexible compensation

Sector: Servicios y tecnolog√≠as de la informaci√≥n Software Internet
Descripci√≥n:
Are you ready for a new challenge?

At Celonis, we are building a leading product that defines the new market category of Execution Management Systems (EMS). We give data-driven & AI technologies context and let them speak in a wholly new way based on our award-winning process mining technology, which is powered by our in-house developed and patented PQL (Process Query Language). The Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications to help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, strategy and planning, to management, actions, and automations.

Our technology helps bring immediate value to the biggest enterprises around the globe, and makes a direct impact on how people work day-to-day. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L‚ÄôOreal, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone, and Whirlpool. All of them rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes.

Celonis has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. We are continuously expanding, especially in Europe, to be able to serve local markets. Recently offices were opened in Paris, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Madrid, as Centers of Excellence for international tech talent. Our current headquarters are in Munich, Germany and New York, USA, but we have 15 offices worldwide.

At each and every Celonis office, we get things done quickly by cultivating an open-minded culture with creative, collaborative, autonomous teams in which the best ideas win. As part of Product & Engineering you will have the opportunity to grow with a steep learning curve, being equipped with responsibility from day one.

At Celonis, we believe that every company can unlock their full execution capacity - and for that we need you as a Senior Product Manager.

The Studio Tribe is contributing to that mission to a great extent by surfacing the power of the Execution Management System to the end-users. The focus for the sub-tribe visualisations is to come up with visualisations, components and the right infrastructure that enable our customers and partners to build apps that drive productivity for customers, and allows them to create visuals and analytical capabilities for apps that are as delightful as they are valuable. The visualisation is a team that spans across three squads of customer centric product managers, UX designers and engineers who continually learn the needs of our customers and app developers and provides all functionalities and visualisations for advanced data and process analytics as well as components to drive productivity for customers which allows them to steer their organization and take action to close execution gaps.

We are looking for a Product Manager/Owner or Data Scientist to play a key role in building the visualizations, components and infrastructure that enable our customers and partners to build solutions that drive productivity for customers, and create apps that are as delightful as they are valuable.

Do you possess an outstanding blend of business and technical savvy, critical thinking and tactical execution? Are you passionate about evangelizing a transformative vision for Celonis‚Äô new solutions? Read on!

YOU...

... have a master‚Äôs degree in a technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Information Systems) or a comparable education
... have 4+ years' experience as a Product Manager/Owner, Data Scientist or UX Designer with visual presentation of data or complex information preferred
... are familiar with end-to-end product lifecycle and methodologies, programming languages, databases, design and prototyping tools
... are able to take ownership and push things forward while making sense of choices to stakeholders through qualitative and quantitative data and a fact-based approach
... have strong project management and cross-group collaboration skills
... are fluent and comfortable in working and presenting in English

WE...

... see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test
‚Ä¶ offer attractive compensation models (stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, ‚Ä¶)
... are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world
‚Ä¶ are experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations
‚Ä¶ distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible work


Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.
