Our opportunity

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Solution Architect to join our Enterprise Data Architecture and Analytics (EDAA) organization.
You will support lead a team creating solutions on Big Data technology. In this role you will be accountable for the overall design of solutions, ensuring the meet customer‚Äôs needs and are scalable and reliable as part of the overall IT Architecture.

Your role

As a Big Data Solution Architect your main responsibilities will involve:

Promote transformation of the company into a data and analytical insights driven insurance company
Define integration pattern with downstream applications
Partner with other solution architects (security, infrastructure, vendors) and collaborate with open source community define and implement best practices and standards for Big Data Solutions implementation
Define & document data dependencies & data flow diagrams of the solution, e.g. between source and systems consuming the data, as well as the logical processes and interfaces with other systems
Promote sharing of data assets across functions and analytical use cases
Support Data Scientist and Big Data Engineers in implementing data structures based on data modes
Overview and review work of developers to ensure alignment with the designed solution, and adapts the design in line with changes of project scope and understanding

Your Skills And Experience

As a Big Data Solution Architect your skills and qualifications will ideally include:

Technology education with completed University degree. Secondary business education or insurance background is a plus.
+4 years of work experience in technical positions including +3 years as an Application Architect with Big Data Solutions.
English language on the Business Fluent level is required.


KNOWLEDGE:

Architecting Shared service Platform for Big Data
Relational and NoSQL Databases
Logical and Physical Data modeling, Data Dictionaries
High availability and contingency solutions
Knowledge of Data Quality Management and Master Data Management concepts
Demonstrable knowledge of Continuous Integration/Test Driven Development and Code Analysis including its application within the software development lifecycle.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
A track record of making complex business decisions with authority, even in times of ambiguity, considering the potential long term risks and implications.
Proponent for innovation, best practices, sound design with data & information optimization in mind, strong development habits, and efficient team/project structures.
Capable of articulating complex designs, code and applications for large scale projects to a simple to understand non-technical client-facing standard

Technical Skills

Big Data Technologies hands-on experience: on-premises and on cloud
Scala and Python programming knowledge
Experience in Analytical Solutions
Cloud Solutions experience: AWS, Azure and/or Google
SQL and NoSQL Databases experience
Linux
TOGAF certification is a plus

Competencies & Skills

Flexible, agile and adaptive to change.
Deep commitment.
Strong organizational and able to multi-task.
Able to prioritize the business needs
Forward thinking in order to determine alternatives.

Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

Wide range of internal and external trainings
Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Life Insurance
Exclusive employee discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depends on the business needs

Primary work location is Barcelona (Poblenou). Mobility is required (mostly within Europe). You can apply by clicking on the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù

Who We Are

Looking for a career that will excite, challenge and inspire you? Thinking about insurance? Perhaps you should. Working for us is a totally different experience to what you probably expect. How do you feel about the things you truly love? Don‚Äôt you want to protect them in the best way possible? Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. This is no easy task. In today‚Äôs interconnected world, tackling risk is fast, unpredictable and invigorating. Descripci√≥n:
Stuart is a leading last mile delivery platform that connects small and big businesses to a fleet of geolocalised couriers. We empower thousands of companies across Europe by providing same-day delivery, next-day delivery and return solutions. We work across verticals with retailers, grocery stores, restaurants and ecommerce merchants to enable smarter transportation models.

Our office is located in Carrer de Pau Claris, one street away from Gaudi's famous Casa Mil√†.

We are looking for an Operations Research Expert to join a fun crew of 8 Physicists, Mathematicians and Engineers who compose our Data Science team, striving to provide the most efficient and highest performing algorithms in the delivery industry.

You will join our dispatch division, the team that focuses on our dispatch algorithm, our crown jewel, participating in the research on new algorithms and methods to address emerging business opportunities, leveraging our machine learning services for making better decisions and collaborate with our Platform team to deliver a scalable, high-performance, low-latency real time dispatch engine. Our ultimate goal is to understand the business, determine the limits of state-of-the-art solutions, and to break them!

If you are passionate about high performance algorithms for complex problems, big data technologies or mathematical modeling of business problems, we can guarantee you're in for a ride.

Responsibilities
Participate in the scientific discussions about our algorithms and provide original insights.
Design experiments and A/B tests to verify our hypotheses, and analyze the data to support them.
Contribute in the data-driven mathematical modeling of our fleets and to extract business value from those models.
Play and explore with data and technology, to come up with groundbreaking ideas that our product team would have not dreamt in their wildest dreams.


Requirements
4+ years of experience as Operations Research practitioner, Data Scientist or any similar role (at least 2 years in non-academic positions)
Solid background in probability/statistics. PhD in quantitative Sciences (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Biology)
Proven experience in Operations Research, Mathematical Programming and Discrete Optimization
Fluent in Python or Scala

Nice to have experience
SQL and some NoSQL database, such as MongoDB
Event-driven architecture (Kafka Streams, Spark Streaming, Flink, etc‚Ä¶)
Distributed computing (Spark, Hadoop, etc‚Ä¶)
Machine Learning


Benefits
Great compensation package
Good work-life balance work from home, flexible hours, extra days off
Learning and training opportunities
Tangible career development possibilities as we grow strong üöÄ
Meal vouchers
Nursery vouchers for childcare
Monthly gym allowance to use in any gym or for any sport class
Excellent family private health care
Annual company offsite ‚Äì Ibiza last year

"Logistics for a sustainable world." That is the mission at the heart of Stuart Delivery. While customer expectations around the delivery experience are skyrocketing, cities are limiting traditional logistics methods to improve congestion, pollution and liveability. The convergence of these two trends means that a disruptive approach to last mile delivery is not a nice-to-have but rather an inevitability.

Stuart sits at the crossroads of the future, using our best-in-class proprietary dispatch technology to connect small and big businesses alike to a shared fleet of geolocalised couriers. The result? Efficient, reliable, eco-friendly delivery to help retailers to meet their customers' demands.

We launched in 2015 with a big vision and a handful of clients. Five years later, couriers on our platform complete tens of millions of deliveries annually for the biggest brands across retail, e-commerce, grocery and food.

Stuart is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do

As a member of the Data Science Chapter, you‚Äôll be supported by an ever-growing, diverse and international Data Scientist teams here at Vistaprint! You‚Äôll focus on applying your expertise in NLP to our Customer CARE domain, helping us to better understand when and for what reason our customers contact us. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with the CARE teams to define and prioritize data products that bring your models to life, helping our customers and team members alike!
Partner with product owners, business analysts, and data engineers within the multi-disciplinary data product teams to develop excellent analytics-based data products. ÔÇ∑
Being prepared and willing to take over development of other data products in the commercial or manufacturing space of Vistaprint in the future.
Interact regularly with other Data Scientists to discuss and provide technical feedback on their work.
Build new models, as well as analyze and improve pre-existing models and algorithms. ÔÇ∑
Prioritize and complete the backlog of improvements envisioned for the current data product.
Build the underlying codes and algorithms as part of a team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers. ÔÇ∑

Your Qualifications
MSc/PhD in computer science, math/statistics, a technical field such as engineering, or in quantitative natural sciences (e.g. physics, chemistry).
3+ years with machine learning and modeling experience.
Proficiency in at least one data science programming language (Python, R, Scala, Julia) and SQL.
Proficiency in model development, model validation and model implementation for large-scale applications.
Experience using standard libraries (scikit-learn, MLlib, TensorFlow, MXNet, PyMC3).
Familiarity with NLP (Natural Language Processing) techniques.

Nice To Have
Familiarity with techniques in Recommender Systems, Information Retrieval, Learning To Rank, Deep Learning to Match etc.
Familiarity with infrastructure topics (e.g. AWS, Databricks, Azure) is a huge plus.
Results-oriented with Data Engineering chops for wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data to deliver proof of concepts end to end.
Good knowledge of data visualization theory and tools (e.g. Tableau, looker, plotly, ggplot, etc.).
Experience in the customer care environment and with relevant technologies, e.g., forecasting, sentiment analysis, and agent matching.
Agile working methodology.
Relevant works in an e-commerce environment.

Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don‚Äôt see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey - and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what‚Äôs next, we‚Äôre always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we‚Äôre capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Offer Description

Context And Mission

BSC is seeking talented and motivated professionals to work in an exciting research collaboration in the topic of accelerating HPC and big data (HPDA) applications. This is a NEW project to build an FPGA-based emulator for an energy-efficient Exascale system.

Key Duties
Modeling and design of the accelerator Network on Chip (NoC). Integrating the NoC model into the existing simulator infrastructure and maintaining high simulator performance. Design and evaluation of the NoC based on the applications used in the project.
Analyzing different Network on Chip topologies and routing mechanisms, deadlock avoidance protocols, virtual channels, and optimizations.
And considering memory subsystems with multiple banks having different connections to computing elements.
Working with, and modifying the software simulation stack and the architectural simulator.
Writing high-quality technical reports and papers.

Requirements

Education
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering or Engineering degree or equivalent level of professional experience.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in both Computer Architecture and specifically NoC and system network designs.
Understanding of computer architecture, preferably in high performance computing, processor micro-architecture, memory subsystem, storage and networking.
Experience with architectural simulators, like Spike, GEM5, etc.
Experience with network simulators, like booksim, ns2, etc.
Agile development and open source development, deployment, and support, including GitHub or equivalent.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications or equivalent.
Competences
Fluency in English is essential, Spanish is welcome.
Effective communication, multitasking, and working well on collaborative designs.
Keeping abreast on technology trends.
Ability to think creatively.
Ability to work independently and make decisions.
Ability to take initiative, prioritize and work under set deadlines and pressure.
Conditions
The position will be located at BSC within the Computer Sciences Department

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Descripci√≥n:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision ‚Äì transforming patients‚Äô lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease ‚Äì and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry ‚Äì each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.

We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Network Biology) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To
Devise network approaches to gain insights from large-scale datasets of molecular profiles of cancer and other disease areas. These profiles include genomic and transcriptomic data, but also involve epigenetic regulation, phenotypic (CRISPR) screens and single-cell measurements
Develop innovative computational tools and methods to elucidate mechanisms of disease and predict model the effects of (combinations of) treatments
Collaboratively apply these methods to impact the clinical development of pipeline compounds and the discovery of novel therapies

Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.
Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).
Advanced mathematical and statistical skills. Machine learning expertise a plus.
Familiarity with methods for high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etc
Experience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageous
Attention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.
Verbal and written English language fluency.

Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.

The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

ISGlobal is a cutting-edge institution with demonstrated capacity to address global public health challenges through research, translation and education, with 407 members and 42 research groups. ISGlobal is located on two campuses: Campus Clinic, with the University of Barcelona and Hospital Cl√≠nic and Campus Mar, with University Pompeu Fabra and Hospital del Mar. ISGlobal has an ambitious vision as a world-class centre in research, translation and education, with a commitment to improve global health and promote health equity.

ISGlobal is a leader in epidemiological research of environmental exposures with particular expertise in research related to the health effects of air, noise, and the built environment. ISGlobal is leading several COVID-19 related research projects exploring the links between the environment and COVID-related outcomes and the health impacts of the pandemic response. These projects leverage ISGlobal‚Äôs unique expertise in both environmental and infectious disease epidemiology.

Location

Barcelona - Campus Mar

What We Are Looking For

We are recruiting a post-doctoral researcher to join our dynamic team in the Urban Environment and Air Pollution research programme. The researcher will be based in the research group of Cathryn Tonne, Associate Research Professor and involved in the project Air Pollution in relation to COVID-19 morbidity and mortality: a large population-based cohort study in Catalonia, Spain (COVAIR-CAT) funded by the Health Effects Institute. The position will involve conducting statistical analysis in a large dataset (i.e. over 5 million participants), application of advanced statistical techniques, and drafting publications related to the impact of air pollution on COVID-19 hospital admission and mortality and identification of vulnerable population subgroups.

Specific Duties
Coordinating health and environmental exposure databases
Conduct statistical analyses
Draft original articles for publication in high impact journals
Disseminate findings at conferences, workshops, scientific journals, and other channels

Offer Description

The ICP aims to recruit a motivated postdoctoral researcher (R2) with an excellent publication record and expertise in vertebrate paleohistology and life-history evolution to join the Life History Evolution (LHE) Research Group . A certain degree of independence with regard to research as well as international mobility experience are required, while at the same time good team-working abilities are indispensable to collaborate with other members of the group under the guidance of the group leader (Meike K√∂hler). The position is mostly devoted to research (including publications and contributions to meetings), with a minimal teaching burden but including other associated academic duties such as supervision, fundraising, fieldwork and dissemination/outreach activities.

Main Responsibilities

The main responsibilities of the R2 (Postdoctoral Researcher) professional category at the ICP are the following:
Collaboration with the researchers of the research group (and in particular to the corresponding supervisor) in order to attain the specific goals of the research group in accordance to the strategic aims and scientific policy of the ICP, including publications, contributions to meetings and fieldwork activities.
Participation in research project applications by other members of the research group (especially the corresponding supervisor).
(Co-)supervision of master‚Äôs and bachelor‚Äôs theses.
Publication, as first author or coauthor, of articles in SCI journals.
Attendance and contribution to international and national scientific meetings.
Teaching in master‚Äôs and/or bachelor‚Äôs degrees.
Attendance to scientific training courses, conference cycles and workshops.
(Co-)direction of and/or participation in planned and emergency paleontological interventions of prospection, excavation and/or sampling (if applicable).
Providing the Head of the Research Department and the Head of the Communication & Scientific Dissemination Area with regular updates of the (co)authored publications.
Providing the corresponding Research Group Leader with all the fieldwork reports and memoirs elaborated for the paleontological interventions (co)directed.
Providing the Head of the Communication and Scientific Dissemination Area with all the required noticeable information regarding the research and dissemination activities performed.

Who We Are

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most forward-thinking self. About Pepsico

Job Description

PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader with a product portfolio including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in annual retail sales. Our main businesses ‚Äì Quaker, Tropicana, Gatorade, Frito-Lay and Pepsi-Cola ‚Äì make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.
At PepsiCo, you get the best of both worlds: an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset plus reach and resources. Our collaborative culture and worldwide presence generate a stream of new opportunities to define the future and propel your life‚Äôs work. Bring your unique perspective. Bring curiosity. Bring ingenuity, and drive. We‚Äôll give you a platform to be daring on a global scale.

About Data & Analytics

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo‚Äôs leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.

Job Description

Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.
Backed by some of the world‚Äôs leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.
Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.
As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.
At Preply, we have a strong culture of experimentation which translates to hundreds of AB Tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.
As part of this role, you‚Äôll participate in critical architectural decisions, evaluating multiple approaches to empower our people to inform their decisions with quality data. You‚Äôll heavily contribute to select the appropriate tech stack and define standards to ensure scalability and reliability.
As a Data Engineer, You Will
Scale and evolve our data infrastructure, optimizing for cost, performance, scalability and reliability
Design and implement diverse strategies to meet existing requirements while anticipating the future needs of our internal clients
Work closely with our Data Strategy team to ensure a smooth and organic growth of our data models
Build and optimize ETL processes for the core data model, integrating additional data sources as needed
Optimize data ingestion in our multi-terabyte data lake, data warehouse and experimentation platform
Act as a referent for our Data Scientist, providing guidance and expertise as they build and productionize their data pipelines, minimizing redundancies, inefficiencies and technical debt.
Select and instrument data quality tools and processes

What We're After
Ideally 3-4 years experience as a Data Engineer or a similar role
Strong coding skills in one or more languages (SQL, Python, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions
Experience with high-volume tracking events ingestion and processing
Good written and verbal communication skills. Fluent English is a must.

Nice To Have
Previous experience scaling start-ups infrastructures
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Experience in distributed processing frameworks (Spark, etc.)
Experience with Streaming technologies (Kafka, Kinesis, etc.)
Experience with the AWS stack

What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance

Our values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We‚Äôre obsessed with our customer‚Äôs problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.

Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion
Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Descripci√≥n:
The "Institut de Rob√≤tica i Inform√†tica Industrial (IRI), CSIC-UPC" is seeking a highly motivated applicant with a keen interest in doing research in Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) applied to manipulation robotic problems in the framework of the COHERENT project. The postdoc will be supervised by Dr. J√∫lia Borr√†s and Dr. Guillem Aleny√†.

The applicant will work within the European CHIST-ERA project "COHERENT‚Äù offering possibilities of collaboration with our project partners, King‚Äôs College London (KCL) in the UK and Universit√† degli Studi di Napoli Federico II (UNINA) in Italy.

About Iri

IRI is a Joint University Research Institute participated by the Spanish National Research Council (CSIC) and the Technical University of Catalonia (UPC) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and automatic control. The institute, is a key player in the Spanish robotics and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number of international collaborations including more than ten ongoing H2020 projects and an ERC Advanced Grant. It has been recognized as a Maria de Maeztu Excellence Unit, the main accreditation given by the Spanish Government to research units that stand out for the impact and international relevance of their results.

About Coherent Project

The position is linked to "COHERENT: COllaborative HiErarchical Robotic ExplaNaTions", a CHIST-ERA European project which seeks to improve trust and

reliability in robots by developing a framework capable of generating explanations during a robot action. The idea of the project is to synthesize an explanation from the different explainable machine learning methods that occur at the different robotic layers: decision making, perception and action execution.

XAI is becoming a trending research topic the more society comes to depend on machine learning-based dynamic systems. In the near future, clearer accountability will be required for decision making processes to ensure trust and transparency.

About The Contract

The postdoc will be incorporated into the Perception and Manipulation Group of IRI. S/he will be hired through a 2-year postdoctoral contract with a salary in the range of 30000 to 40000 ‚Ç¨ gross per year, depending on experience and skills. The incorporation will be take place as soon as possible.

Web site for additional job details

REQUIRED EDUCATION LEVEL

Computer science: PhD or equivalent

Skills/Qualifications

PhD in artificial intelligence, preferably with experience in robotics

Specific Requirements

Skills in C++ programming

Good track of publications in international journals and conferences of the area

Puesto ofertado: Senior Data Scientist - Digital Ventures Lab (f/m/x)
Sector: Construcci√≥n Dotaci√≥n y selecci√≥n de personal Recursos humanos
Descripci√≥n:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint ‚Äì join us in creating a better future for our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues‚Äô safety at the heart of our organization.

The Digital Venture Lab is where all our SGRE functions run alongside to support and to drive our common efforts and initiatives, fueling SGRE's digital transformation. We focus on our people and business opportunities, driving a digital strategy that creates a true advantage leading us into the future of digital offerings and optimized operating models. The Digital Ventures Lab provides access to a unique ecosystem of digital natives, data sciences, developers, universities, startups, and other corporates & partners to accelerate the digital transformation of Siemens Gamesa.

And overall, our Digital Ventures Lab comes without any hierarchy levels making everyone a unique contributor to our overall success.

How To Contribute To Our Vision
As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be taking a leading role in our data science community of practice. It is a pivotal role regarding the development of our digital solutions in line with digital architectures and designs. You will drive the practice to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
You will mine and analyze data from company databases to ensure optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. This includes the assessment data source accuracy and data gathering techniques, as well as developing custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Predictive modeling to increase and optimize user experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, or other business outcomes will be part of your responsibilities, as well as coordination with different functional teams to develop processes to analyze model performance and data accuracy. This will include the development and validation of new signal processing and machine learning algorithms.
It is imperative that as a leader of change, you be an external and internal ambassador for SGRE‚Äôs digital transformation. This will require presenting and lobbying within academic and industrial forums with the aim of garnering people‚Äôs trust and excitement in The Digital Ventures Lab‚Äôs mission and drive this future digital paradigm to the energy community as a whole.

What You Need To Make a Difference
Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.
We expect you to have a proactive and innovative mindset and driving attitude. You are highly result oriented and extensive knowledge about signal processing and applying PCA, AI, ML and DL methods on big data sets. You combine your ownership attitude with your very strong knowledge and experience in machine learning techniques and analytical skills to recognize patterns in data and develop relevant algorithms.
We expect you to be familiar with big data processing and cloud-based platform architectures. In addition, it is expected that you have a proven track record of product algorithm development in languages amenable to statistical and other numerical processing, such as R and Python, as well as familiarity with open-source ML packages such as Keras, PyTorch and sklearn.
You have acquired a PhD or master‚Äôs degree within the fields of computer science, mathematics or physics or similar and more than 5 years of experience in data science and /or pattern recognition. In addition, you should ideally have at least 5 years‚Äô experience working within the wind industry, with exposure to wind turbine and wind farm performance analytics, prognostic turbine health monitoring and/or wind resource assessment and wind farm micro-siting activities.
In return of your commitment we offer you‚Ä¶
Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Flexible working hours as well as home-office
Employer-funded pension
Attractive remuneration package
Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more
Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the recruiting team an email via Shoaib.khan@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

Please apply in English via the apply button.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.

We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

A healthcare company is in search for a Clinical Research Scientist to support their development team in the area of clinical research. This is an opportunity to help and drive forward effective therapy for patients.

Job Responsibilities
Developing and designing studies to determine the clinical value of compounds in development and interpreting the results of these studies under the guidance of the senior R&D team
Writing research protocols for clinical studies
Preparing scientific reports and presentations related to clinical trials
Reviewing and assessing research proposals for investigator-initiated studies
Coordination of communication and collaboration with the relevant scientific and regulatory partners
Interpretation of study findings
Delivering end of study reports and publication/presentation of results

Skills And Requirements
A PhD in a scientific field, preferably in the areas of psychology or psychiatry, is desirable. Equivalent education and/or experience are acceptable
Relevant experience in conducting and designing clinical trials in the areas of psychiatry, neurology, or neuroscience
Experience of working in industry is highly desirable as is a broad understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and the clinical development process
Strong analytical and statistical skills
Experience with authoring scientific documents
Well-developed communication skills appropriate to the target audience, promoting effective decision-making where necessary
Project management experience is desirable
Passion for working collaboratively and learning new skills
To Apply
Proclinical is a specialist employment agency and recruitment business, providing job opportunities within major pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies.

BNP Paribas Group
BNP Paribas is one of the euro zone‚Äôs leading banks, with nearly 194.000 employees in 74 countries with key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets, International Financial Services and Corporate & Institutional Banking.
 RISK Function and Team:
The mission of the RISK function
¬∑      To advise the Bank on risk appetite definition
¬∑      To contribute as an objective ‚Äúsecond pair of eyes‚Äù that risks taken on by the Bank align with its policies
¬∑      To report and alert Bank Management of the status of risks to which the Bank is exposed
¬∑      To contribute to the development and growth of the risk culture within the Group
Within the RISK function, RISK Artificial Intelligence Research is an AI expert team in charge of developing Artificial Intelligence solutions for RISK Streams and beyond. This involves in particular assisting internal customer with the definition of their project, understanding what data is available and what the pain point to be addressed is. Then the team proceeds to develop algorithms to address the identified pain point based on the data provided. Finally, we develop systems /applications (interface + back end) to give access to the solution built to designated internal users. In addition to the development of use cases, they also provide technical expertise on artificial intelligence topic (for instance review of internal or external solutions) and seek to develop some API based on common data processing needs.

The Position:
As a software engineer within RISK AIR, you will be in charge of the application development and deployment in collaboration with the data scientist and our UX designer. Software engineers are involved within our projects from start to finish, providing early on guidance on the feasibility of the solutions dreamed by our clients, ensuring proper code structuring and management by our data scientist, managing the devops set up of the project and actively participating in the industrialization discussion with the target IT.
Altogether, we are looking for full stack developers, people who are as comfortable with front-end development as with storage and back end, people who like to build!

Techical expertise: AngularJS, JavaScript, Python, MySQL, Apache, Docker, Elastic search, React, Django, devops methodology, Java

Education: Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science or related field

Level of experience: at least 5 years of experience as software engineer in an agile, innovation oriented team.
 Fluent in English, French a plus

Personal skills:
¬∑              Strong analytical / problem solving skills
¬∑              Capacity to work in project mode
¬∑              Rigorous and curious
¬∑              Resourceful

This is a customer facing role, owning the overall technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft Azure Infrastructure and Applications Development Platform. You will own the Cloud Infrastructure and Azure Applications Development technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots.

The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers.

#CustomerSuccess

Apply technical knowledge and customer insights to create a modernization roadmap. Collaborate with other Cloud Solution Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform
Maintain technical skills and knowledge of market trends and competitive insights; collaborate and share with the technical community
Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities

Qualifications

Professional Experience

5+ years of success in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications required
Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior IT executives in large or highly strategic accounts. Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects. required
Problem Solving. Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required
Collaboration and Communication. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams, ensuring successful implementation of customer projects. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management, Database administrators and Data Scientist) required
Technical
Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management required
Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios in enterprise-wide environments (including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud) required
Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following:
Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions (i.e. Windows and Linux IaaS, SAP, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, OSS, containers and Infra as a code technologies) required
Cloud application development solutions (e.g. PaaS, Serverless, API Management);
Container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry);
Continuous integration technologies (e.g. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure for DevOps, Chef, Puppet);
Web application server technologies, cloud application design, software architecture and practices; (design/development/deployment, Agile, SCRUM, ALM)
one or more of the following programming languages: C++, C#, Java, Node.js, JSON, PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby on Rails, Pig/Hive
Experience using integrated development environments (e.g. Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Eclipse, XCode, WebSphere) targeting Android, iOS, Linux, Windows, public clouds (i.e. Azure, AWS) required
Experience with scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management, serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry etc.), API management, microservice frameworks etc.
Software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure DevOps, GitHub). preferred
Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of cloud development platforms preferred
Partners. Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs preferred

About Pepsico

Job Description

PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader with a product portfolio including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in annual retail sales. Our main businesses ‚Äì Quaker, Tropicana, Gatorade, Frito-Lay and Pepsi-Cola ‚Äì make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.
At PepsiCo, you get the best of both worlds: an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset plus reach and resources. Our collaborative culture and worldwide presence generate a stream of new opportunities to define the future and propel your life‚Äôs work. Bring your unique perspective. Bring curiosity. Bring ingenuity, and drive. We‚Äôll give you a platform to be daring on a global scale.

About Data & Analytics

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo‚Äôs leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.

Job Description

Your role will be to be part of growing team called ‚ÄúDigital Hub‚Äù, based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.

You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of our continuous delivery of statistical/ML models. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.

You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.

This Role Will Support The Following Activities
Partner with data scientist working on discovery, prototypes and pilot. Focus on experiment tracking.
Partner with data engineers regarding data pipelines and data versioning.
Coordinate work activities with IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset.
Build, deploy or publish machine learning models that run efficiently in cloud pipelines.
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality (unit tests).
Monitor model performance, working with data scientists assessing bias and fairness.
Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.
Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.

Qualifications/Requirements
2+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions.
3+ years‚Äô experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques.
3+ years‚Äô experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
3+ years‚Äô experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‚Äòproduct‚Äô creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.
Fluent with Azure cloud services. Certification is a plus.
Fluent in git (version control)
Fluent in Docker
Fluent in Jenkins
Fluent with design and management of APIs.
Experience with K8s is a plus.
Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.
Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.
Experience with distributed systems is a plus.
Experience with Databricks and Mlflow is a plus
Experience with ELK is a plus.
Experience with ML security is a plus.

everis (www.everis.com) is a dynamic, growing and ambitious IT consulting firm. We employ worldwide more than 21.000 people and keep on growing, with a 20% annual growth on average.   We at everis make the difference by being close to our clients, exceeding expectations, managing proactively our projects and customers and focusing on quality and selecting employees with the right mindset to make our company grow. The Group has the ambitious goal to position within the TOP 3 worldwide. We have been awarded Best Place to work in Spain for 4 consecutive years.
  Data & Analytic practice  is both a strategic bet and a fast-growing initiative and thereby we are currently looking for a Data & Intelligence CoE LEADER. The position can be based in Barcelona, even if the geographical scope is Europe. The desirable characteristics are:
  What are we looking for?
  We are looking to add a Data Engineer Leader to our team to take on the technical decision-making in projects within the scope of our Data & Intelligence CoE, working in initiatives for top-tier organizations.
  We are looking for a professional who brings his knowledge and experience in data engineering and analytics to be in charge of a growing group of consultants focused on:
  Transforming our customers‚Äô business through data engineering and analytics, applying it in cases such as real-time ML models serving; IoT device data collection, ingestion and streaming; log accumulation, aggregation and analysis; etc.
Facing challenges related to DataOps for data-pipelines and ML (e.g. automation, scaling, no down-time deployments), data & data pipelines portability, managing cross cloud & hybrid deployments, etc.
Architecting Shared service Platform on MPP and  on the Hadoop based platform (e.g. HDFS, YARN, MapReduce, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Oozie, Ambari, HCatalog, Zookeeper, Flume Kafka etc.).
Making the most of enterprise-scale distributed NoSQL solutions (i.e. based on Neo4j, Casandra, Couchbase, HBase, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, etc.).
Ensuring high availability and contingency solutions.
Continuous Integration/Test Driven Development and Code Analysis including its application within the software development lifecycle.
    What will you be accountable for?
  Your responsibilities around everis data engineering and analytics services will be focused on the following fields of action:
Project execution: ensuring the achievement of project/service goals in terms of effectiveness, efficiency and customer satisfaction. Identifying team and resources needed to do so while ensuring proper management of scope, quality, risks, planning economic parameters, etc.
Technical decision making.

You have technical education, a degree in computer engineering or mathematics, or any other engineering at master level.

You are proficient in English with excellent written and spoken communication skills.
You are passionate about data engineering and analytics, being up to date and applying your knowledge and experience to provide business solutions.
You value an environment offering challenging opportunities for professional development in an excellent atmosphere
  We will positively value:
Any kind of training specialization.
Experience in agile methodologies and project management with Atlassian Jira or tools alike.

To work on projects for leading companies in Spanish and European market through the use of innovative data technologies.
To be involved in high priority projects with visibility to senior leadership

To join the team of a consolidated multinational such as everis, which shares with you its professional interests and enjoys applying streaming and distributed data pipelines in large companies and public agencies.

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for world-class Operations Research Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

You will be part of the Q-Commerce team responsible for improving time efficiency and user experience for our couriers, partners and customers. The teams leverage machine learning, statistics, and operations research techniques to build best-in-class services and products.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Develop, prototype, and productionize optimization and machine learning algorithms by using state-of-the-art techniques.
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Generate and execute on ideas for product discovery to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions.
Build robust and reliable processes for systems and algorithm fine tuning.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing amongst others; to identify use cases for optimisation application.
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics.


You Have
Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in mathematical optimisation and experience in discrete events and agent-based simulation.
Experience on designing and implementing mathematical models and/or metaheuristics for large scale problems in logistics or supply chain (experience solving VRPs is preferred).
Ability to analyzing and working with large quantities of data, using analytical tools such as: Python, SQL
Experience with optimization/simulation software and libraries (e.g. Xpress, Gurobi, CPLEX, pulp, ortools, SIMIO, Arena, SimPy, etc.).
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novices
Fluent spoken and written English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Flexible working environment
Paid internship


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/en/

Job Description

Clarity‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to markets . Our disruptive tech tool allows systematic measurement and optimization of the social impact of investment portfolios, and our proprietary methodology provides a deeper understanding of the needs of the population and gives a comprehensive view of how those needs are covered by different economic actors. Together, the tool and the methodology will improve the allocation of the World‚Äôs capital to human needs.

People at Clarity don‚Äôt "talk" ethics and values, we "live" values by example. Our international team is constantly embracing the challenge, solving problems, driven by the purpose of helping investors optimize the social impact of their portfolios. Together, we can become the ‚Äúgold Standard‚Äù offering solutions to all society stakeholders ‚Äî we're just getting started.

Would you like to join an international and fast growing Startup where you can play an important part in shaping its future? How about an opportunity to take part in next-generation social impact solutions in a highly collaborative work environment, where space for professional development is taken very seriously? Interesting, right? Keep reading!

Requirements

Requirements

We are looking for an individual to conduct research on Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) ratings for private companies and national governments.

The Social Impact researcher should possess exceptional analytical skills and thrive in an entrepreneurial setting as you will be required to lead, leading research workstreams, thinking critically and maximizing scientific rigor in you work. The ideal candidate should love having different types of problems thrown at you, be able to quickly digest and understand the key issues and the main objectives, and provide advice and guidance on how best to proceed.

Location: Madrid or remote.

Key Responsibilities

Role

The ESG Researcher‚Äôs role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities

The ESG researcher will be responsible for ensuring that the ratings we provide to clients are statistically and methodologically sound.
Compare methodological options for calculating ESG ratings and identify trade-offs.
Explore statistical properties of datasets and identify relevant insights for rating construction and/or interpretation.
Write code for calculating ESG ratings.
Conduct checks and validation tests on calculated ESG ratings.
Identify and propose continuous improvements and refinements to the rating calculations.
Prepare reports and presentations of document findings.


Qualifications
Deeply passionate about social impact.
Advanced degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, math, or other applied quantitative field. Candidates with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree and a strong record of success doing similar work will be considered. PhD would be desirable.
3+ years of relevant work experience, including designing and conducting quantitative research and analyzing data. Experience in the financial services sector will be a plus.
Outstanding quantitative and critical thinking skills.
Significant experience with Python or R. Experience with additional programming languages a plus.
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative.
Decisive and action oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when short of information, and has a high level of energy and stamina.
Complete fluency in English (minimum C1)
Intellectual curiosity and sense of humor.


Benefits

What We Offer

People are one of Clarity‚Äôs main assets. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values .
The team comprises professionals from leading consulting and banking firms, MBA graduates from top business schools, entrepreneurs and PhDs.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum.

We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work.
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).

We care about our employees. We think that every effort has to be rewarded and want them to feel comfortable with us.
Salary proposals are between 10% and 15% above benchmark gross compensation.
Benefits: We are offering a large benefits package for the team, considering their needs and interests.
Stock/ Phantom: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with phantom stock options.

We are a US company with a Spanish subsidiary. We have amazing offices in Madrid and NYC.

Our investors believe in us and share our goals. We are a leading startup thanks to public and private funding .

Clarity Has Received Several Awards
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017.
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent.
Top 2 start-ups with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017.
One of the most innovative Spanish companies by NeoTec.
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab.

Job Description

The Robotics and Automation Unit of Eurecat Technology Center (Barcelona) is looking for a highly motivated researcher to work on Advanced Manipulation and Human-Robot Interaction.

The candidate shall work on different research projects dealing with industrial and collaborative robots and mobile manipulators with focus on planning, control under interaction of physical forces. The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments including
Dexterous and collaborative robotics manipulation and human-robot interaction.
Participate in the definition and development of new robotic platforms
Develop, validate and maintain code
Sporadic support/supervision to hardware and prototype integration and maintenance
Lead, plan and execute demonstrations
Participate in scientific publications
Support to project management to ensure proper project execution
Establish and maintain contact with clients and partners in consortium

What Eurecat Can Offer You

The Robotics Group is specialized in research and development on Ground, Aerial and Industrial Robotics. With a strong focus on our customers and partners needs, our mission is to enhance the capabilities and reliability of autonomous systems operating in realistic scenarios, improving the existing technology and enabling new applications. For over 10 years, the group has been involved in several of the most successful European projects in robotics. These are the links of our current and previous publicly available robotics projects:

And many more to come!

Team spirit and ability to work independently.
Excellent communication skills, flexibility and creativity.
Very good knowledge of English is required.
Experience with robotics mechanics and electronics would be considered relevant as well.

Additional Requirements
Familiarity with mobile manipulators
Knowledge about ROS Industrial
Knowledge about industrial robot programming (ABB, KUKA, UR‚Ä¶)Availability to travel occasionally
Availability to work in client facilities temporally

Descripci√≥n:
Context And Mission

BSC is seeking talented and motivated professionals to work in an exciting research collaboration in the topic of accelerating HPC and big data (HPDA) applications. This is a NEW project to build an FPGA-based emulator for an energy-efficient Exascale system.

Key Duties
Modeling and design of the accelerator Network on Chip (NoC). Integrating the NoC model into the existing simulator infrastructure and maintaining high simulator performance. Design and evaluation of the NoC based on the applications used in the project.
Analyzing different Network on Chip topologies and routing mechanisms, deadlock avoidance protocols, virtual channels, and optimizations.
And considering memory subsystems with multiple banks having different connections to computing elements.
Working with, and modifying the software simulation stack and the architectural simulator.
Writing high-quality technical reports and papers.

Requirements

Education
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering or Engineering degree or equivalent level of professional experience.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in both Computer Architecture and specifically NoC and system network designs.
Understanding of computer architecture, preferably in high performance computing, processor micro-architecture, memory subsystem, storage and networking.
Experience with architectural simulators, like Spike, GEM5, etc.
Experience with network simulators, like booksim, ns2, etc.
Agile development and open source development, deployment, and support, including GitHub or equivalent.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications or equivalent.
Competences
Fluency in English is essential, Spanish is welcome.
Effective communication, multitasking, and working well on collaborative designs.
Keeping abreast on technology trends.
Ability to think creatively.
Ability to work independently and make decisions.
Ability to take initiative, prioritize and work under set deadlines and pressure.
Conditions
The position will be located at BSC within the Computer Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract, a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, tickets restaurant, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Temporary - 31/12/2022 renewable
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: asap

Design and development

Promote in the Data community the best bases for the development and programming of the proposed solutions. Promote continuous improvement as the basis for the growth of Adevinta's professionals.
Help to define good practices in the use of the data platform as well as the processes that are executed in it.

Ensure alignment with all data teams, promoting interactions and teamwork.
To be the image of Data in the community of Adevinta, promoting collaboration between the different organizations of the company.

Data Catalog/Lineage/Literacy

Descripci√≥n:
We are looking for the position of Cybersecurity Junior Researcher in the protection and trust research line.

Selected candidates will contribute in project development and in applied research publications in digital security domain.

Digital Security has a specific Body of Knowledge in Vicomtech (including Anomaly and Attack Detection in Internet, Industrial and Cyber-Physical Systems, Identity and Privacy Management, Biometrics (face, voice and behavioral signatures), Dynamic Risk Management, Traceability and accountability, and support to other vertical sectors (see Vicomtech general profile above) and with domains where security can be considered transversal(Video Surveillance, ITS, Media Security, eHealth, ...)

The selected candidate‚Äôs activities will include:

-Development of software-based technology in the line of protection and trust: Oauth, OpenId, -Blockchain systems (ethereum, hyperledger fabric e indy) and SmartContracts, behavioral biometrics (signature, keystroke, mouse, ...), digital certificates (X509), digital signatures, etc.
-Deployment of controlled environments (laboratories) and design of experiments
-Realization of multiple and varied tests of the developed software, analyzing the obtained results
-Active participation in department technical meetings and center organizational meetings
-Participation in the writing of applied research articles for journals and conferences
-Workplace: San Sebastian-Donostia and/or Vitoria-Gasteiz
Requirements:   

-Academic Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a TIC related field.
-Proven experience, formation or training in protection and trust related aspects: PKI infrastructure, DLT technologies, federated access control, self-sovereign identities, etc.
-High programming skills in python and other script languages.
-Problem solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
-Willing to work hard in exciting and challenging situations.
-Strong team worker.

Additionally, to have one or more of the following characteristics will be a clear plus:

-High attentional control and mathematical thinker; equally logical and creative thinker.
-Personal resistance to frustration and capabilities to chase long-terms results.
-Knowledge of several programming paradigms, there are more than one way to obtain the same goal.
-Active participation in team meetings, explain a viewpoint on a topic issue giving related advantages and drawbacks
-Interest in developing a scientific record.

What we offer:

-We offer to join a very dynamic team, with a culture of excellence in applied research. 
-We have a clear professional career path and great working conditions. 
-If you want to make a difference with your research in real world applications, Vicomtech is the place to make it happen.
-Compensation commensurate with experience and responsibility.

Our team is growing and we are now looking for a Senior User Experience Researcher to join Guillaume Simon‚Äôs team, and help us craft the future of on-demand delivery üôå You‚Äôll help bring to life our UX Research department, designing processes and practices to establish a user-centred continuous learning mindset throughout the company. Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with a cross-functional, geographically distributed team of data scientists, user researchers, product managers, product designers, product analysts, and engineers across Paris, London, and Barcelona to make impactful, data-enabled decisions regarding our products and services.

Act as a thought leader in the research domain, always advocating for the people who could use our products.

Job Description & Summary
In PwC Deals we help our clients to successfully carry out a transaction, whether it is buying or selling a business or company, and creating value through their merger, acquisition, financing, divestment and restructuring processes.

Our Financial Decisions and Analysis (FDnA) team delivers additional insight for decision making. We use our people's range of industry experiences with a commercial mindset and deep technical skills to produce rapid, pragmatic and clear outcomes for our clients.

About The Employer

ARQUIMEA Research Center (ARC) is a private R&D center which relies on a product-oriented strategy, market diversification and internationalization to achieve a sustainable growth with the calling of developing ideas and getting involved in projects with a high impact in society.

We have as much passions as technologies we develop. But there is only one that we enjoy more than the rest: passion for people. We are a team of specialists and researchers pursuing the highest exponent of technology and science.
Our search is to find new projects that stimulate our day-to-day.
Our challenge is to attract talent that shares our worldview.
At ARC we research in fields like sensors, robotics or drones, cybersecurity, digital manufacturing, biotechnology, artificial intelligence, quantum computing, nanotechnology and blockchain.

We like to surround ourselves with digital nomads to assemble solid teams, specialized in each of our technologies. We trust people as much as we trust progress if it is accompanied by skills and attitude. Furthermore, our center is located in Canary Islands (Tenerife), where is impossible to have a negative attitude. We have soft weather, ocean and so much technology.

We like to think of talent as a five-pointed star that brings light and value to the center and we want bold, creative, proactive, efficient and humble people in our team.

Who We Are
